verses.latin: Omnis sapientia a Domino Deo est, et cum illo fuit semper, et est ante saecula.
verses.english: All wisdom comes from the Lord God; it has always been with Him. Wisdom existed before the beginning of time.

verses.latin: Arenam maris et guttas pluviae, et dies saeculi, quis dinumeravit?
verses.english: Who can count the sand of the sea, the drops of rain, and the days of eternity?

verses.latin: Altitudinem caeli, et latitudinem terrae, et profundum abyssi, quis investigavit?
verses.english: Who has searched the height of the sky, the width of the land, and the depth of the abyss?

verses.latin: Sapientia ante omnia creata est, et intellectus prudentiae ab aeterno.
verses.english: Wisdom was created before all other things, and the understanding of prudence is eternal.

verses.latin: Fons sapientiae verbum Dei in excelsis, et semita illius mandata aeterna.
verses.english: The Word of God in the highest heavens is the source of wisdom, and His eternal commandments are the path to it.

verses.latin: Radix sapientiae cui revelata est? et astutias illius quis agnovit?
verses.english: To whom has the root of wisdom been revealed? Who has known its cleverness?

verses.latin: Scientia sapientiae quis enarrabit? et quis sensus illius agnovit?
verses.english: Who can describe the knowledge of wisdom? Who has understood its meaning?

verses.latin: Unus est altissimus, creator omnipotens, et rex potens, timendus valde, sedens super thronum suum, et dominans Deus.
verses.english: There is only one Most High, the all-powerful creator, a mighty King, greatly to be feared, seated on His throne, and a God who rules.

verses.latin: Ipse creavit illam in Spiritu sancto, et vidit illam, et dinumeravit, et mensus est illam.
verses.english: He created wisdom in the Holy Spirit; He saw it, measured it, and gave it understanding.

verses.latin: Et effudit illam super omnia opera sua, et super omnem carnem secundum donum suum, et praebuit illam diligentibus se.
verses.english: And He poured out wisdom on all His works, on all flesh according to His gift, and gave it to those who love Him.

verses.latin: Timor Domini gloria et gloriatio, et laetitia, et corona exsultationis.
verses.english: The fear of the Lord is glory, and pride, and joy, and the crown of rejoicing.

verses.latin: Timor Domini delectabit cor, et dabit laetitiam et gaudium, et longitutdinem dierum.
verses.english: The fear of the Lord delights the heart and gives joy, gladness, and length of days.

verses.latin: Timienti Deum bene erit in extremis, et in die obitus benedicetur.
verses.english: It will go well with the man who fears God in the end, and he will be blessed on the day of his death.

verses.latin: Initium sapientiae timor Dei, et cum fidelibus in utero formata est.
verses.english: The fear of God is the beginning of wisdom; it was formed with the faithful in the womb.

verses.latin: Cum hominibus credentibus et sanctis creata est, et cum electis illorum credulitas et scientia, et fides.
verses.english: It was created with believers and saints, and with the chosen, they are found with faithfulness, knowledge, and belief.

verses.latin: Timor Domini pietatis scientia est.
verses.english: The fear of the Lord is the fullness of the knowledge of piety.

verses.latin: Pietas custodit illos, et justificat, et acceptat preces eorum.
verses.english: Piety protects them, makes them righteous, and accepts their prayers.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, habebit amicitiam, et sicut ille est, ita erit et proximus illius.
verses.english: Whoever fears God will have friendship, and his neighbor will be like him.

verses.latin: In sapientia honor, et gloria, et fiducia, et corona justitiae.
verses.english: In wisdom is honor, and glory, and trust, and the crown of righteousness.

verses.latin: Sapientiam justi in benedictione, et gloria ipsius fructus honorabilis.
verses.english: The wisdom of the just brings blessings, and the fruit of his glory is honorable.

verses.latin: Adversarius impii non est honorabilis, et memoria impiorum delebitur.
verses.english: An enemy of the wicked is not honorable, and the memory of the wicked will be erased.

verses.latin: In timore Domini longitudo dierum, et anni vitae minuuntur.
verses.english: In the fear of the Lord is length of days, and the years of life will be shortened.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, omnia faciet, et qui continet se, propter illum, et in visitatione diei effundetur.
verses.english: Whoever fears God will do all things, and whoever holds himself back for Him, will be filled on the day of visitation.

verses.latin: Initium timoris Dei est acceptio illius: et cum fide adhaeret illi.
verses.english: The beginning of the fear of God is the acceptance of Him, and it adheres to Him with faith.

verses.latin: Omnis plaga, et omnis ira, impiorum: et in peccatoribus non invenietur.
verses.english: All plagues and all anger will come to the wicked, and will not be found in sinners.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, non negliget mandata illius: et qui fortis est, custodiet viam ejus propter illum.
verses.english: Whoever fears God will not neglect His commandments, and the strong will keep His way because of Him.

verses.latin: Et omnis sapientia cognoscet, et qui tenent illam, laudabunt eam: et qui confidunt in illa, noti erunt ei.
verses.english: And all wisdom will know, and those who hold it will praise it; and those who trust in it will be known to Him.

verses.latin: Fili, accedens ad servitutem Dei, sta in justitia, et timore, et praepara animam tuam ad tentationem.
verses.english: Son, when you are serving God, stand strong in righteousness and with fear, and prepare your soul for the trials ahead.

verses.latin: Humilia cor tuum, et sustine: inclina aurem tuam, et excipe verba intellectus.
verses.english: Humble your heart and remain patient: incline your ear, and understand words of wisdom.

verses.latin: Aperto corde tuo ad Deum, et confide in illum, et conserva te abominationibus.
verses.english: Open your heart to God, and trust in Him, and keep yourself from the abominations of sin.

verses.latin: Respice in mandata illius, et observa praecepta illius: et exaudi orationem tuam.
verses.english: Look at His commandments, and observe His precepts: and hear your prayer.

verses.latin: Redi ad Dominum, et relinque peccatum tuum: ora in conspectu illius, et minue offendicula.
verses.english: Return to the Lord and leave behind your sin: pray in His presence, and reduce your faults.

verses.latin: Averte te a peccato, et corrige manus tuas: et a cordis tui inmunditia emunda cor tuum.
verses.english: Turn away from sin, and correct your hands: and cleanse your heart from all impurity of your heart.

verses.latin: Et dirige viam tuam in rectum, et ad senes et justos convertere.
verses.english: And direct your path in the right way, and turn to the elders and the righteous.

verses.latin: Esto in fide firmus, et in timore illius: et cum pace permane in patientia.
verses.english: Be steadfast in faith and in the fear of God: and remain in peace with patience.

verses.latin: Credenti sibi, confide: et non confundetur in misericordia illius.
verses.english: Trust in Him who believes in himself: and he shall not be ashamed in His mercy.

verses.latin: Vae cordi duplici, et labiis impuris, et manibus facientibus mala, et peccatori terram ingredienti duabus viis.
verses.english: Woe to the double-minded heart, and to the impure lips, and to the hands that do evil, and to the sinner who walks the earth with two paths.

verses.latin: Vae cordi timido: quoniam non credit, ideo non protegetur.
verses.english: Woe to the timid heart: for he does not believe, therefore he will not be protected.

verses.latin: Vae illi qui perdit patientiam: et quid faciet, cum visitaverit Dominus?
verses.english: Woe to him who loses patience: and what will he do when the Lord visits?

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, sustinebit, et in patientia sua justificabitur.
verses.english: He who fears God shall persevere, and in his patience he will be justified.

verses.latin: Sibi respexerit, et vias suas confirmaverit, et intellexerit, quod iniquitas non habitabit in eo.
verses.english: He shall look to himself, and confirm his ways, and understand that iniquity will not dwell in him.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, sic faciet: et qui habet legem, ad illa convertetur.
verses.english: He who fears God will do this: and he who has the law, will turn to these things.

verses.latin: Et qui novit ea, parabit illam, et sicut in messe, sic quaeret illam.
verses.english: And he who knows them will prepare for them, and will seek them as in the harvest.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, diriget vias suas, et sicut in tempore solstitii illuminabitur.
verses.english: He who fears God will direct his ways, and will be enlightened as in the time of the solstice.

verses.latin: Et qui confidunt in Domino, intelligent gloriam illius.
verses.english: And those who trust in the Lord will understand His glory.

verses.latin: Nolite timere verba peccatoris: quoniam gloria ejus in stercore consumitur.
verses.english: Do not fear the words of the sinner: for his glory is consumed in dung.

verses.latin: In diebus prosperitatis illius, exultabit, et in diebus adversitatis non erit memor.
verses.english: He will exult in the days of his prosperity, and in the days of adversity he will not be remembered.

verses.latin: Timor Dei, timoris est, et non peribit: et in diebus tentationis, perseverabit justus.
verses.english: The fear of God is of fear, and it will not perish: and in the days of trial, the righteous will persevere.

verses.latin: Sapiens non odit legem Dei, et non erit in ea mendacium, et impii in ea pereunt.
verses.english: The wise man does not hate the law of God, and there will be no lie in it, and the impious perish in it.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, dirigit cor suum, et in conspectu illius humiliavit animam suam.
verses.english: He who fears God directs his heart, and humbles his soul in His sight.

verses.latin: Si non feceris, in malum incides: et Deus confundet te in conspectu inimicorum.
verses.english: If you do not do this, you will fall into evil: and God will confound you in the sight of your enemies.

verses.latin: Usque ad mortem, contine justitiam, et pugna pro veritate, et Deus expugnabit pro te inimicos tuos.
verses.english: Hold fast to righteousness until death, and fight for the truth, and God will fight for you against your enemies.

verses.latin: Noli esse velox in lingua tua: et in operibus tuis, et negligens.
verses.english: Do not be quick with your tongue: and be negligent in your works.

verses.latin: Esto velox ad audiendum Deum, et in patientia tua, responde: si habes intellectum.
verses.english: Be quick to listen to God, and answer in your patience: if you have understanding.

verses.latin: Si habes intellectum, responde proximo tuo: sin autem, ponas manum tuam super os tuum, ne capiaris in verbo indisciplinato, et confundaris.
verses.english: If you have understanding, answer your neighbor: but if not, put your hand upon your mouth, lest you be caught in an undisciplined word, and be ashamed.

verses.latin: In gloria et ignominia non habeto faciem, et in veritate, non timeas confiteri peccata tua.
verses.english: Have no preference in glory and shame, and do not be afraid to confess your sins in truth.

verses.latin: Noli esse quasi leo in domo tua, suspiciens famulos, et terrens eos.
verses.english: Do not be like a lion in your house, looking at your servants, and frightening them.

verses.latin: Non sit manus tua ad accipiendum, et ad dandum remissa.
verses.english: Let your hand not be for receiving, and let it be slow to give.

verses.latin: Fili, audi me, et responde vocem meam, et docebo te timorem Domini.
verses.english: My son, listen to me, and respond to my voice, and I will teach you the fear of the Lord.

verses.latin: Quoniam magna est gloria illius, et magna est gratiam ejus, et timorem ejus, quis investigabit?
verses.english: Because great is His glory, and great is His grace, and who will search out His fear?

verses.latin: Timor Domini gloria, et gloriatio, et laetitia, et corona exultationis.
verses.english: The fear of the Lord brings glory, and boasting, and joy, and the crown of exultation.

verses.latin: Timor Domini delectabit cor, et dabit laetitiam, et gaudium, et longævitatem.
verses.english: The fear of the Lord will delight the heart, and give joy, and gladness, and length of days.

verses.latin: Timenti Deum bene erit in extremis, et in die consummationis impietatis salvabitur.
verses.english: He who fears God will be well in the end, and in the day of consummation he will be saved.

verses.latin: Non timebit timorem, neque conturbabitur: quoniam ipse est spes ejus.
verses.english: He will not fear fear, nor will he be troubled: because he is his hope.

verses.latin: Timor Dei tanquam paradisus benedictionis: operuerunt illum omnem gloriam.
verses.english: The fear of God is like a paradise of blessing: they have covered all glory.

verses.latin: Omnem qui timebat Dominum, suscepit, et benedicens illi.
verses.english: Everyone who feared the Lord, he received, and blessing him.

verses.latin: Quoniam timor Dei, et honor est, et gaudium, et corona exultationis.
verses.english: Because the fear of God, and honor, and joy, and the crown of exultation is.

verses.latin: Timorem Dei eligens, et opera ejus, et dilectionem ejus, et vias ejus.
verses.english: Choosing the fear of God, and his works, and his love, and his ways.

verses.latin: Qui tenet illum, paratus est ad omnia, et vita illius propter ipsum non separabitur.
verses.english: He who holds Him is prepared for everything, and his life will not be separated because of Him.

verses.latin: Omnium malorum initium superbia: qui ab ea teneatur, redundabit impietate.
verses.english: The beginning of all evils is pride: he who is held by it, will abound in impiety.

verses.latin: Quare contriti sunt superbi, et quasi virga contriti sunt: et memoria eorum iniqua, et non erit.
verses.english: Therefore the proud are crushed, and as a rod they are crushed: and their memory is iniquitous, and it will not be.

verses.latin: Superborum non sunt placita Deo: quoniam a Deo aversi sunt.
verses.english: The pleasing of God is not for the proud: because they are turned away from God.

verses.latin: Superbia initium omnis peccati: qui tenuerit illam, effundet impietatem: propterea Deus aspera vitia detexit, et evertit ea.
verses.english: Pride is the beginning of all sin: he who holds it, will pour out impiety: therefore God has discovered harsh vices, and overturned them.

verses.latin: Deo detulit sedes principum superborum.
verses.english: God has overturned the seats of the proud leaders.

verses.latin: Gentes iniquæ detulit Deus.
verses.english: God has taken away iniquitous nations.

verses.latin: Radices superborum extirpavit Deus.
verses.english: God has uprooted the roots of the proud.

verses.latin: Sedet Deus in solio judicantium, et in spiritu ejus non sit iniquitas.
verses.english: God sits on the throne of judgment, and in his spirit there is no iniquity.

verses.latin: Quis enarrabit opera altissimi? Quoniam mirabilia ejus.
verses.english: Who will tell the works of the Most High? Because they are His wonders.

verses.latin: Quis enarrabit potentiam majestatis ejus? Et quis poterit enarrare misericordiam ejus?
verses.english: Who will tell the power of His majesty? And who will be able to tell His mercy?

verses.latin: Nihil diminuitur, et nihil additur, nec inveniri potest mirabilia Dei.
verses.english: Nothing is diminished, and nothing is added, nor can the wonders of God be found.

verses.latin: Cum finierit homo, tunc incipiet: et cum quieverit, tunc dubitabit.
verses.english: When man finishes, then he will begin: and when he rests, then he will doubt.

verses.latin: Quid est homo? et quæ est ejus gratia? Quid bonum, aut quid malum ejus?
verses.english: What is man? And what is his grace? What is his good, or what is his evil?

verses.latin: Numerus dierum hominum, omnes ad summum centum anni.
verses.english: The number of days of men, all at most are one hundred years.

verses.latin: Sicut stilla aquæ maris, et sicut gutta arenæ, sic pauci anni in die ævi.
verses.english: Like a drop of sea water, and like a grain of sand, so few are the years in the day of eternity.

verses.latin: Haec est gloria hominis: et major quam illa, non est ei in vita sua.
verses.english: This is the glory of man: and greater than that, is not for him in his life.

verses.latin: Sanguis caro ejus, et spiritus ejus: opera impiorum conterentur.
verses.english: His blood is his flesh, and his spirit: the works of the wicked will be broken.

verses.latin: Pietas, et misericordia permanebunt, et bona opera: et merces eorum cum illis.
verses.english: Piety, and mercy will remain, and good works: and their reward with them.

verses.latin: Duobus generibus placet mihi anima mea, et tertium placitum est mihi: qui contristatur, et qui diligit fratres.
verses.english: My soul is pleased with two kinds, and the third is pleasing to me: he who is grieved, and he who loves his brothers.

verses.latin: Qui non peccat in lingua sua, et non contristatus est in sensu suo.
verses.english: He who does not sin with his tongue, and is not grieved in his mind.

verses.latin: Qui non contristatus est in sensu suo, non contristabitur in operibus suis.
verses.english: He who is not grieved in his mind, will not be grieved in his works.

verses.latin: Qui timuit Deum in corde suo, et in omnibus signis justificatus est.
verses.english: He who fears God in his heart, and is justified in all signs.

verses.latin: Fili, si accesseris ad servitutem Dei, praepara animam tuam ad tentationem.
verses.english: My son, if you give yourself to serving God, brace yourself for the trials of faith.

verses.latin: Cor tuum corrige, et constanter sustine, et ne festines in tempore tribulationis.
verses.english: Set your heart straight, be resolute, and don't rush in times of hardship.

verses.latin: Adhaere illi, et ne discedas, ut crescas in novissimo tuo.
verses.english: Stay close to Him, and don't turn away, so that you may be rewarded in the end.

verses.latin: Omne quod tibi applicabitur, suscipe, et in dolore patienter esto.
verses.english: Accept whatever is brought upon you, and be patient in times of pain.

verses.latin: In igne, et aurum probatur, et in fornace tribulationis, homines acceptabiles.
verses.english: Gold is tested by fire, and acceptable men are tested in the furnace of hardship.

verses.latin: Crede illi, et ipse adjuvabit te; dirige vias tuas, et spera in illum.
verses.english: Trust in Him, and He will help you; make your ways straight, and hope in Him.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, nihil trepidabit, et non pavebit, quoniam ipse est spes ejus.
verses.english: Those who fear God will not tremble, and will not be afraid, because He is their hope.

verses.latin: Beatus animae ejus, qui timet Deum.
verses.english: Blessed is the soul of those who fear God.

verses.latin: De timore Dei, diligat eum, et in fide illius, sperabit.
verses.english: Because of their fear of God, they will love Him, and in their faith, they will hope.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, praeparabit cor suum, et in conspectu illius humiliavit animam suam.
verses.english: Those who fear God will prepare their hearts, and humble their souls in His sight.

verses.latin: Cadent in manus Dei et non in manus hominum.
verses.english: They will fall into the hands of God, and not into the hands of men.

verses.latin: Quoniam secundum magnitudinem ipsius, est et misericordia ejus, et secundum nomen ipsius, est et gloria ipsius.
verses.english: For as great as He is, so is His mercy, and as great as His name, so is His glory.

verses.latin: Miserebitur enim Deus, qui confititur et confitebitur in conspectu omnium.
verses.english: God will have mercy on those who confess and give thanks to Him in the sight of all.

verses.latin: Stultus, et in tempore malorum, contristabitur.
verses.english: The fool will be troubled in times of evil.

verses.latin: Sapiens, non contristabitur, in malis.
verses.english: The wise will not be troubled by evils.

verses.latin: Cor sapiens, intelliget parabolam, et auris audiens, desiderium sapientis.
verses.english: A wise heart will understand a parable, and an attentive ear will desire wisdom.

verses.latin: Sicut aqua extinguit ignem, ita eleemosyna restinguet peccatum.
verses.english: As water extinguishes fire, so almsgiving extinguishes sin.

verses.latin: Qui reddit gratiam, memor erit futurorum, et in tempore casus inveniet firmamentum.
verses.english: He who gives thanks will remember the future, and will find strength in the time of need.

verses.latin: Filius malorum, quasi nebula venti, et qui est hodie, et cras non apparebit.
verses.english: The sons of evildoers are like a mist driven by the wind, here today, and gone tomorrow.

verses.latin: Beatus, qui perseverat in timore Dei.
verses.english: Blessed is he who perseveres in the fear of God.

verses.latin: Quia in fine, ipse salvabitur.
verses.english: Because in the end, he will be saved.

verses.latin: Talem timorem, Deum eligent, et qui diligunt eum.
verses.english: Those who love God choose such fear of God.

verses.latin: Qui timent Dominum, facient placita illius, et qui sustinent illum, invenient benedictionem.
verses.english: Those who fear the Lord do His will, and those who endure in Him will find blessing.

verses.latin: Qui timent Dominum, parant corda sua, et in conspectu illius humiliaverunt animas suas.
verses.english: Those who fear the Lord prepare their hearts, and humble their souls in His sight.

verses.latin: Cadent in manus Dei.
verses.english: They will fall into the hands of God.

verses.latin: Melior est, qui non habet facultatem, et gloriatur, quam qui habet facultatem, et mentitur.
verses.english: Better is the one who has no means and boasts, than he who has means and lies.

verses.latin: Pretiosior est, qui non est dives, et timet, quam qui dives est, et superbus.
verses.english: More precious is he who is not rich but fears God, than he who is rich and proud.

verses.latin: Justus et pauper, timens Deum, melior est, quam homo dives, et elatus.
verses.english: A just and poor man, fearing God, is better than a rich and arrogant man.

verses.latin: Sapiens, et pauper, in timore Dei, plus placebit, quam homo dives, et superbissimus.
verses.english: A wise and poor man, in the fear of God, will please God more than a rich, and very proud man.

verses.latin: Mors justorum, in manu Dei, et non tanget illos malum.
verses.english: The death of the just is in God's hand, and evil will not touch them.

verses.latin: Stulti autem, et peccatores, ira illius, exscindet eos.
verses.english: But fools and sinners will be destroyed by His wrath.

verses.latin: Timor Domini, facit sanitatem, et plenitudinem, et visitatio illius, auferet peccata.
verses.english: The fear of the Lord brings health and fullness, and His visitation takes away sins.

verses.latin: Qui timet eum, non timebit; et non pavebit, quoniam ipse est spes ejus.
verses.english: He who fears Him will not fear; and will not be afraid, because He is his hope.

verses.latin: De timore Domini, nullus timendus est, et non est timor in conturbatione.
verses.english: Of the fear of the Lord, nothing is to be feared, and there is no fear in disturbance.

verses.latin: Beatus omnis qui timet Deum.
verses.english: Blessed is everyone who fears God.

verses.latin: De timore enim Domini, adjuvatur, et in diebus finis, bene sperabit.
verses.english: For by the fear of the Lord he is helped, and in the days of the end, he will hope well.

verses.latin: Timor Dei, omnis creatura; et illi, comparat gloriam.
verses.english: The fear of God belongs to all creation; and to it, God gives glory.

verses.latin: Melius est, mori, quam vivere, et malum videre.
verses.english: It is better to die than to live and see evil.

verses.latin: Vita tristis, et mors voluntaria.
verses.english: A sad life, and a voluntary death.

verses.latin: In omni opere tuo, memorare novissima tua, et in aeternum non peccabis.
verses.english: In all your work, remember your last end, and you will not sin forever.

verses.latin: Ne confidas inimico tuo, neque filio tuo, ne dimittas.
verses.english: Do not put your trust in an enemy, and do not give yourself over to his authority.

verses.latin: Quoniam omnis homo inimicus sibi dissimulat iniquitatem suam.
verses.english: Because all men conceal the sins they do against themselves.

verses.latin: Et a vicino tuo cave, quoniam in malitia ejus est,
verses.english: Be cautious around your neighbor, because he seeks to harm you.

verses.latin: et odium transiet ad te.
verses.english: And his hatred could turn against you.

verses.latin: Non in omni lingua credas, omnis enim lingua perversitate laborat.
verses.english: Do not believe everything you hear; for every tongue has its own faults.

verses.latin: Peccata enim eorum quae faciunt, in malis operibus eorum sunt:
verses.english: Because in their wicked deeds, they sin.

verses.latin: et non ambulant in timore Dei.
verses.english: And they do not live in the fear of God.

verses.latin: Sunt enim oculi Dei super vias hominum, et ipse novit omnem viam eorum.
verses.english: For God's eyes watch over the ways of men, and He knows every path.

verses.latin: Non mandavit alicui impie agere, et nemini dedit peccandi licentiam.
verses.english: He has not commanded anyone to act wickedly, nor has He given anyone permission to sin.

verses.latin: Non sunt ei opera carnis, et homo impius in manibus ejus.
verses.english: He does not rejoice in works of the flesh, nor does the impious man hold power over Him.

verses.latin: Ante opera hominis bona et mala, coram ipso,
verses.english: Before men's good and bad deeds, the Lord sees all; He sees them.

verses.latin: et singulis operibus suis respicit.
verses.english: He looks upon each of their works.

verses.latin: Ne dicas: Peccavi, et quid mihi accidit?
verses.english: Do not say, “I have sinned, and what has happened to me?”

verses.latin: Sustinuit enim Altissimus.
verses.english: For the Most High is patient.

verses.latin: De propitiatione autem, noli esse sine metu, et ne addas peccatum super peccatum.
verses.english: But as for atonement, be without fear. Do not add sin upon sin.

verses.latin: Et dicere, Misericordia Domini magna est, multorum peccatorum.
verses.english: And do not say, “God’s mercy is great, and He forgives many sins.”

verses.latin: Quoniam et misericordia et ira cito est apud illum, et super peccatores requiescit ira illius.
verses.english: Because mercy and anger are swift with Him, and His wrath rests upon sinners.

verses.latin: Noli differre converteri ad Dominum, et ne differas a die in diem.
verses.english: Do not delay turning back to the Lord, nor put it off day by day.

verses.latin: Subito enim veniet ira illius, et in tempore vindictae perdes.
verses.english: For suddenly His wrath will come, and in the time of vengeance you will perish.

verses.latin: Ne confidas in pecunia injusta, et ne dicas: Habeo satis ad vitam.
verses.english: Do not put your trust in unjust riches, nor say, “I have enough for life.”

verses.latin: Non enim proderunt tibi in die irae et vindictae.
verses.english: For they will not help you on the day of wrath and vengeance.

verses.latin: Ne sequaris in viis cordis tui, et virium tuarum.
verses.english: Do not follow the paths of your heart and your own strength.

verses.latin: Et dicere: Quis me coërcebit?
verses.english: And do not say, “Who will restrain me?”

verses.latin: Quoniam Deus quidem ulcisci potest,
verses.english: Because God can surely punish,

verses.latin: et scias quoniam Deus diu non morabitur.
verses.english: and know that God will not delay long.

verses.latin: De peccatis tuis noli esse sine metu, et ne addas peccata super peccata.
verses.english: Do not be without fear of your sins, and do not add sin upon sin.

verses.latin: Et dicere: Misericordia Domini magna est, et peccata mea multa dimittet.
verses.english: And do not say, “God’s mercy is great, and He will forgive many of my sins.”

verses.latin: Quoniam et misericordia et ira cito est apud illum, et super impios requiescit ira illius.
verses.english: Because both mercy and wrath are swift with Him, and His wrath rests upon the impious.

verses.latin: Noli tardare converti ad Dominum, et ne differas a die in diem.
verses.english: Do not delay turning to the Lord, and do not put it off day by day.

verses.latin: Subito enim veniet ira illius, et in tempore vindictae perdes.
verses.english: For suddenly His wrath will come, and in the time of vengeance you will perish.

verses.latin: Quasi in partu mulieris dolores, est dies irae impiorum.
verses.english: Like the pains of a woman in labor, is the day of wrath for the impious.

verses.latin: Filium pro mortuo portans, et non habens auxilium:
verses.english: He will carry the son he thought was dead, but he will have no help.

verses.latin: Sic est in die visitationis impiorum.
verses.english: Such is the day of visitation for the impious.

verses.latin: Sapientiam et disciplinam narrare volo, et notitias sensuum dicere.
verses.english: I wish to speak of wisdom and discipline, and of the understanding of the senses.

verses.latin: In quantum enim est a Deo, et gloriosus est.
verses.english: For, as wisdom comes from God, it is also glorious.

verses.latin: In principio, Deus creavit illam, et effudit illam super omnia opera sua.
verses.english: In the beginning, God created it, and poured it out over all His works.

verses.latin: Cum timor Domini, gloria est, et honor, et gaudium, et corona exsultationis.
verses.english: When there is fear of the Lord, there is glory, honor, joy, and the crown of exultation.

verses.latin: Timorem Dei elegit cor ejus, et in sanctificatione, et in justitia, et in fide custodivit illam.
verses.english: The heart of God has chosen the fear of the Lord, and he has kept it in sanctification, justice, and faith.

verses.latin: Mandata Dei timor est, et disciplina servans vitam.
verses.english: The fear of God is the commandments, and discipline preserves life.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, nihil timebit, et non pavebit, quoniam ipse est spes ejus.
verses.english: Those who fear God will fear nothing and will not be afraid, because He is their hope.

verses.latin: Anima timoris Dei, vita est et qui habet illam, visitabitur a Deo, et benedicetur.
verses.english: The soul of the fear of God is life, and those who have it will be visited by God, and will be blessed.

verses.latin: Sapiens recipiet illam, et quasi mater, honorabit illam, et quasi virgo nubens, suscipiet illam.
verses.english: The wise will receive it, and, as a mother, will honor it, and, as a bride marrying, will receive it.

verses.latin: Et nutriet illum pane vitæ, et intellectus dabit illi aquam salutaris.
verses.english: And it will nourish them with the bread of life, and will give them the water of salvation.

verses.latin: Fundamentum sapientiæ timere Deum, et in justitia et cum hominibus fidem custodire, et dilectionem conservare, et verba justorum custodire.
verses.english: The foundation of wisdom is to fear God, and to keep faith, to love, and to keep the words of the just in justice and with others.

verses.latin: Abominationem impiorum superbia: et non prope sunt justi a superbia.
verses.english: Pride is the abomination of the wicked; the just are not near to pride.

verses.latin: Initium superbiæ, hominis apostatare a Deo: quoniam ab eo qui fecit se recessit cor ejus.
verses.english: The beginning of pride is for a man to apostatize from God: because his heart has receded from Him who made him.

verses.latin: Initium superbiæ, peccatum: et qui tenet illam, effundit abominationes.
verses.english: The beginning of pride is sin: and those who hold it pour out abominations.

verses.latin: Propterea Dominus intulit illis plagas mirabiles: et contrivit illos usque in finem.
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord has brought upon them terrible plagues: and He has broken them to the end.

verses.latin: Sicut aquae, flamma exstinguunt ignem: ita eleemosyna exstinguit peccata.
verses.english: As water extinguishes fire, so almsgiving extinguishes sins.

verses.latin: Qui retribuunt bona, memores erunt futuri: in tempore quo nutant pedes eorum, invenient firmamentum.
verses.english: Those who give back good deeds will be mindful of the future: in the time when their feet falter, they will find firmness.

verses.latin: Qui custodit mandata, custodit animam suam: et qui sperat in Deum, non confundetur.
verses.english: Those who keep the commandments guard their souls: and those who hope in God will not be ashamed.

verses.latin: Timor Domini, gloria sapientis.
verses.english: The fear of the Lord is the glory of the wise.

verses.latin: Sapiens justitiam custodit: et qui justitiam operatur, illius gloriam refert.
verses.english: The wise keep justice: and those who practice justice refer to His glory.

verses.latin: Sapiens in verbis operatur: et prudens, in lege confirmabitur.
verses.english: The wise works in words: and the prudent are confirmed in the law.

verses.latin: Qui confidit in lege, parat intellectum, et qui perficit illam, quasi flumen, plena est sapientia.
verses.english: Those who trust in the law prepare understanding, and those who perfect it, are, as a river, full of wisdom.

verses.latin: Qui legem excolit, parat illam: et fructus illius sanctificatio.
verses.english: Those who cultivate the law prepare it: and its fruit is sanctification.

verses.latin: Adhuc persequens eam, perveniet ad illam: et semitas ejus, quasi clarissimas, et in via ejus non laborabit.
verses.english: Still pursuing it, they will arrive at it: and its paths are very clear, and they will not labor on its road.

verses.latin: Sapiens pertransibit terram, ut testimonium peragat: et omnis homo intellectus, perquiret eam.
verses.english: The wise will pass through the earth, so that they may give testimony: and all those who understand will seek it.

verses.latin: Exquirens illam, quasi primam, et dominus in omni tempore non deficiet.
verses.english: Seeking it, as the first, and the Lord will not fail at any time.

verses.latin: Et iterum in corde meo consideravi, ut sciam quod bonum est, et quid faciam, et servabo disciplinam.
verses.english: And again I considered in my heart, so that I may know what is good, and what I should do, and I will keep discipline.

verses.latin: Et rursum cœpi diligere illam, et bonum inveni.
verses.english: And again I began to love it, and found it good.

verses.latin: Eligentes bonum, eligentur, et qui opera ejus amant, sanctificabuntur.
verses.english: Those who choose good, will be chosen, and those who love its works, will be sanctified.

verses.latin: Qui opera illius, faciunt, vita eorum semper est.
verses.english: Those who do its works, their life is always good.

verses.latin: Ne facias mala, et non venient tibi mala.
verses.english: Don't do evil deeds, and evil won't befall you.

verses.latin: Recede ab iniquo, et recedent a te mala.
verses.english: Turn away from wickedness, and wickedness will turn away from you.

verses.latin: Fili, ne semines in sulcis iniquitatis, et non metes ea septuplum.
verses.english: My son, don't plant bad seeds in the furrows of wickedness, or you'll harvest them sevenfold.

verses.latin: Ne petas a Domino principatum, neque a rege sedem honoris.
verses.english: Don't ask the Lord for a position of authority, nor the king for a seat of honor.

verses.latin: Ne iustifices te coram Deo, quoniam ipse novit corda.
verses.english: Don't try to justify yourself before God, because He knows the hearts of all.

verses.latin: Ne velis esse iudex, nisi fortis fueris virtute: ne forte extimescas faciem potentis, et ponas scandalum in iustitia tua.
verses.english: Don't desire to be a judge unless you are strong in virtue. Don't be afraid of the powerful. Then, your justice won't be a stumbling block.

verses.latin: Ne pecces in multitudinem civitatis, neque te immittas in populo.
verses.english: Don't sin against the multitude of a city, and don't thrust yourself upon the people.

verses.latin: Duplicem non commisceas peccatum: quia nec unum impunitum erit.
verses.english: Don't commit a double sin: because not even one will go unpunished.

verses.latin: Ne dicas: Deus respiciet multitudinem donorum meorum, et offerens Altissimo, suscipiet ea.
verses.english: Don't say: “God will look at the multitude of my gifts and, when I give them to the Most High, He will accept them.”

verses.latin: Ne fueris in oratione dubius: et ne dimittas facere eleemosynam.
verses.english: Don't be doubtful in your prayers, and don't neglect to do good deeds.

verses.latin: Ne subsannentem irrideas: est enim qui videt, et punit.
verses.english: Don't mock the scornful, because there is One who sees and punishes.

verses.latin: Ne negligas, cum iudicans es pauperem: quoniam est vindex pauperis.
verses.english: Don't neglect the poor when you judge, because there is One who defends the poor.

verses.latin: Iudicium fac pauperis, et non inclinaberis personam potentis.
verses.english: Make the judgment of the poor, and don't be swayed by the powerful.

verses.latin: Secundum sapientiam iudica: et fac iudicium iusti.
verses.english: Judge according to wisdom, and give a just judgment.

verses.latin: Humilia cor tuum, et sustine, et inclina aurem tuam, et suscipe verba prudentium: et ne despicias proverbia sapientium, et in parabolis illorum te exerce.
verses.english: Humble your heart and be patient, and incline your ear and receive the words of the wise. Don't disregard the proverbs of the wise and practice them in their parables.

verses.latin: Fili, operare in opere tuo, et educaberis in doctrina illius.
verses.english: My son, work on your work, and you will be educated in its doctrine.

verses.latin: Qui timent Dominum, invenient iudicium, et iustitias suas illuminabunt quasi lumen.
verses.english: Those who fear the Lord will find judgment, and their righteousness will shine like light.

verses.latin: Peccator fugiet correptionem, et secundum voluntatem suam inveniet excusationes.
verses.english: The sinner will flee from correction and will find excuses according to his own will.

verses.latin: Vir consilii non negliget consilium: timidus et ignavus non permanebit in mandatis.
verses.english: A man of counsel will not neglect counsel. The timid and lazy will not remain in the commandments.

verses.latin: Noli facere quicquam sine consilio: et post factum non poenitebis.
verses.english: Do nothing without counsel, and after you've done it, you won't repent.

verses.latin: Non ambules in via non tuta: et non offendas in lapidibus.
verses.english: Don't walk on an unsafe road, and don't stumble on stones.

verses.latin: Fidei tuo ne fidas: et vias tuas custodi.
verses.english: Don't trust in your own faith alone; guard your ways.

verses.latin: In operibus tuis ne diffidas.
verses.english: Don't be disheartened in your works.

verses.latin: Super omnia opera tua fida: hoc est enim conservatio mandatorum.
verses.english: Be faithful in all your works. This is the keeping of the commandments.

verses.latin: Qui credit Deo, attendit mandatis: et qui sperat in illum, non minorabitur.
verses.english: He who believes in God attends to the commandments, and he who hopes in Him will not be diminished.

verses.latin: Noli contendere cum homine potenti, ne forte incidas in manus ejus.
verses.english: Don’t start a fight with anyone stronger than you, or you may fall into their power.

verses.latin: Multi enim, auro et argento perdiderunt se, et non potuerunt ex eis emere animam suam.
verses.english: Many have ruined themselves seeking riches, and they could not use those riches to save their souls.

verses.latin: Non est enim pretium animæ.
verses.english: For the value of a soul is beyond all price.

verses.latin: Noli perdere substantiam tuam in extraneo, et opera tua alienis.
verses.english: Don’t waste your goods on the wrong things, or your labor on what is not yours.

verses.latin: Noli sperare super potentia tua: et noli ire in desideria tua.
verses.english: Don't be overconfident in your own power, and don't go after all of your desires.

verses.latin: Noli dicere: Quis poterit mihi resistere pro operibus meis? Meministi enim quod dies mali plures sunt.
verses.english: Don’t say, “Who can stop me now that I’m in control?” Remember that bad days happen to everyone.

verses.latin: Noli contristari in animo tuo, et noli projicere te in cogitationibus tuis.
verses.english: Don't be overwhelmed by your feelings, and don't let your imagination run wild.

verses.latin: Noli dicere: Deus miserebitur multitudinis peccatorum: et peccata mea multa remanebunt.
verses.english: Don’t say, “God is so merciful that he will forgive all my sins,” and then continue sinning.

verses.latin: Misericordia enim et ira cum illo sunt: et in impios permanebit indignatio illius.
verses.english: For God is both merciful and angry. His anger will stay with the ungodly.

verses.latin: Noli differre converti ad Dominum, et noli procrastinare de die in diem: subito enim veniet ira illius.
verses.english: Don't put off turning back to God, and don't delay from day to day. For his wrath will come suddenly.

verses.latin: Et in tempore ultionis perdes.
verses.english: Then, when the time comes to face the consequences, you will be destroyed.

verses.latin: Noli confidere in pecunia injusta, et in thesauris: non enim proderunt te in die indignationis.
verses.english: Don't trust in ill-gotten money or in great wealth. For they will not help you on the day of God's wrath.

verses.latin: In die tribulationis et ultionis.
verses.english: In the day of tribulation and judgment.

verses.latin: Noli ventilare in omni vento, et noli ire in omnem viam: sic enim facit peccator duplex.
verses.english: Don’t be like a reed blowing in the wind. Don’t go down every path you see. This is what a double-minded sinner does.

verses.latin: In corde enim duplici, cogitatio illius.
verses.english: For a double-minded man has an unstable heart.

verses.latin: Bonum est cor hominis, quod timet in malis: quia in bonis probabitur.
verses.english: A good heart fears the bad, because it will be tested in the good.

verses.latin: Cor enim bonum timet semper: et in diebus laetitiae non erit tristitia.
verses.english: For a good heart always fears, and will not be sad even on joyful days.

verses.latin: Homo timens Deum benedicetur: et prolongabit dies suos.
verses.english: The one who fears God will be blessed, and will have a long life.

verses.latin: Finis timoris Dei, vita: et qui invenit illum, permanebit in diebus suis.
verses.english: The end of fearing God is life. And those who find it will live long.

verses.latin: Timor Dei, initium est dilectionis illius: fides autem est initium adhaesionis illi.
verses.english: The fear of God is the beginning of his love. Faith is the beginning of clinging to him.

verses.latin: Anima contristata, proiciet gloriam: et oculus sub tristitia, turbabit.
verses.english: A troubled soul will lose its glory, and eyes clouded by sadness will be troubled.

verses.latin: Noli inique cor: et ne tradas animam tuam doloribus.
verses.english: Do not be hard-hearted, and do not give your soul over to sorrows.

verses.latin: Laetitia cordis, vita est hominis: et gaudium viri prolongabit dies ejus.
verses.english: Joy in the heart is the life of a man, and happiness lengthens his days.

verses.latin: Amor tui diligenti, animam tuam: in bonis justorum iterum consolabitur.
verses.english: Love yourself by caring for your soul, and you will again be comforted in the good things of the righteous.

verses.latin: Qui diligit se, diligit vitam: et qui vigilat ad illud, acquiriet gaudium.
verses.english: Those who love themselves, love life, and those who watch out for it will find joy.

verses.latin: Qui continebat manum suam, continebat linguam: et qui declinabat a scandalis, aufertur a malis.
verses.english: Those who control their hands, control their tongues, and those who avoid scandal will be spared the bad.

verses.latin: Saepe loquere et tunc exspecta: et noli esse, quasi medicus in lingua.
verses.english: Speak often, and then wait; and don’t be like a doctor with his tongue.

verses.latin: Si fueris in medio magnorum, fac te quasi unum ex illis: et cum fueris sapiens, ante te esse quaerant.
verses.english: If you are among important people, act like one of them. And when you become wise, let others seek you out.

verses.latin: Puerilis inprudentia, ut mulier in partu: et misericordia hominum, in diebus suis.
verses.english: Childish actions are like a woman in childbirth, and the mercy of men is available in their days.

verses.latin: Sapiens tacitus est usque ad tempus.
verses.english: A wise man is silent until the right time.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, faciet bona: et qui continet justitiam, adprehendet illam.
verses.english: The one who fears God will do good, and the one who perseveres in righteousness will hold fast to it.

verses.latin: Et exibit illi obviam quasi mater honorifica, et quasi uxor illius virginis.
verses.english: And justice will come out to meet him like an honorable mother, or like a virgin's wife.

verses.latin: Cibum sapientiae manducabit, et potu prudentiae potabitur.
verses.english: He will feed on the food of wisdom, and will drink the drink of prudence.

verses.latin: Non flectetur iniquitate, nec in illam dominabitur peccatum.
verses.english: He will not be bent by iniquity, nor will sin have dominion over him.

verses.latin: A malis non veniet, et super peccatores non permanebit.
verses.english: He will not be found among evil people, and he will not dwell among sinners.

verses.latin: A superbis repellitur, et in veritate sua visitat humiles, et in cogitationibus justorum permanet.
verses.english: He is turned away by the proud, and in his truth he visits the humble, and he perseveres in the thoughts of the just.

verses.latin: Deus odiit sacrificia impiorum: et a malis detestatur vota.
verses.english: God hates the sacrifices of the wicked, and he detests the vows of evildoers.

verses.latin: Et non cessat Dominus usque dum respiciat in justos, et remuneret illos.
verses.english: And the Lord does not cease until he looks upon the just, and rewards them.

verses.latin: Non tardabit vindicare justos, et custodiet pietatem electorum.
verses.english: He will not delay to avenge the just, and he will keep the piety of the elect.

verses.latin: Quasi umbra nubis, sic transiet dies mali: justus autem permanebit in tempore, et in die retributionis.
verses.english: Like a shadow of a cloud, the day of the wicked passes; but the just perseveres in time, and on the day of reckoning.

verses.latin: Os sapientiae enarrabit sapientiam: et lingua justi judicium.
verses.english: The mouth of wisdom will tell forth wisdom, and the tongue of the just will judge.

verses.latin: Amabit vir justus bona: et odiet impius.
verses.english: A just man will love what is good, and the impious will hate it.

verses.latin: Radix boni est timor Dei: et radix impietatis intellectus.
verses.english: The root of good is the fear of God, and the root of impiety is a lack of understanding.

verses.latin: In corde imprudentis requiescet stultitia: et sapiens requiescet in corde suo.
verses.english: In the heart of the unwise, folly rests, but the wise rest in their own heart.

verses.latin: In corde prudentis sapientia requiescit: et sicut mare, ita cogitationes hominis.
verses.english: In the heart of the prudent, wisdom rests, and the thoughts of man are like the sea.

verses.latin: Proverbia stultorum quasi domus dissipata in via: et consilium imprudentis quasi interrogatio in via.
verses.english: The proverbs of fools are like a ruined house on the road, and the counsel of the unwise is like a question on the road.

verses.latin: Doctrina stultis quasi pedica in pedibus: et quasi compedes in manibus.
verses.english: Doctrine to the foolish is like a snare to the feet, and like fetters on the hands.

verses.latin: Stultus in risu exaltat vocem suam: sapiens autem quasi tacitus modicus.
verses.english: A fool raises his voice in laughter, but the wise are moderate, as if silent.

verses.latin: Sermo sapientis quasi speculum in speculo: stulti autem cor quasi vas insensatum.
verses.english: The words of the wise are like a mirror in a mirror, but the heart of a fool is like an unfeeling vessel.

verses.latin: Cor stulti, sicut vas perforatum: omne doctrinale non tenebit.
verses.english: The heart of a fool is like a punctured vessel; he will not hold any teaching.

verses.latin: Sapiens audiet omnem sermonem sapientiae: et probabit illum, et assumet sibi.
verses.english: A wise man will hear every word of wisdom, and will prove it, and take it to himself.

verses.latin: Stultus non sustinebit, et irridebit.
verses.english: A fool will not endure, but will mock.

verses.latin: Verba stulti quasi onus in via: in labiis prudentis gratia reperietur.
verses.english: The words of a fool are like a burden on the road; on the lips of the prudent, grace will be found.

verses.latin: Os prudentis in ecclesia quaeritur: et verba illius in cordibus ejus quasi lapides pretiosi.
verses.english: The mouth of the prudent is sought in the church, and his words are like precious stones in their hearts.

verses.latin: Stultus quasi domus in via: omni volanti patens.
verses.english: A fool is like a house on the road, open to all who pass by.

verses.latin: Quasi lapides mortui in altis, sic verba stultorum: in consilio impiorum quasi funis fortis.
verses.english: Like dead stones in high places are the words of fools; in the counsel of the wicked they are like a strong rope.

verses.latin: Sapiens in verbis suis quasi vir doctus: et prudentis pondus et statera.
verses.english: A wise man, in his words, is like a learned man, and the prudent are weighed and measured.

verses.latin: Cor stulti quasi vas perforatum: nequaquam poterit sensum retinere.
verses.english: The heart of a fool is like a punctured vessel, it will never be able to retain understanding.

verses.latin: Lex impii odibilis est illi: sicut vincula pedibus.
verses.english: The law of the impious is hateful to him, like chains on his feet.

verses.latin: Sapiens autem quaerit sapientiam, et quasi nubes nebula est oculos ejus.
verses.english: The wise man seeks wisdom, and it is like a cloud of mist to his eyes.

verses.latin: Cor stulti quasi dolium perforatum: et nullum doctrinae tenebit.
verses.english: The heart of a fool is like a punctured barrel, it will hold no doctrine.

verses.latin: Sapiens tacebit usque in tempus.
verses.english: The wise will be silent until the right time.

verses.latin: Sapientia Domini diffundet verba sua, et in conspectu operum illius omnis caro confitebitur illi.
verses.english: The wisdom of God speaks to all people, and all who see God's works will declare his greatness.

verses.latin: Magna opera illius, plena gloria: et in absconditis sapientia illius.
verses.english: His great works are full of glory, and his wisdom is hidden from those who don't want it.

verses.latin: Sophiam quis enarrabit, et quis sensus illius adæquabit?
verses.english: Who can tell how the wisdom of God works, and who can fully understand its depths?

verses.latin: Cujus est scientia ordinis ejus? et quis novit opera illius?
verses.english: Who knows the plan that God is following? Who understands what God is doing?

verses.latin: Quis enarrabit speciem decoris ejus? et quis enarrabit gloriam illius?
verses.english: Who can describe the beauty of God's glory? Who can tell of his magnificent deeds?

verses.latin: Quid addet, et quid minuet? et quid mirabilia Domini?
verses.english: What more can we say about the wisdom of God? What can we take away? What more is there to say about all of the wonders of God?

verses.latin: A principio et usque in finem, quis exquirens eum defatigatus est?
verses.english: Who can study God's wisdom and fully understand it?

verses.latin: Timor Domini gloria et gloriatio, et lætitia et corona exultationis.
verses.english: The fear of God is the beginning of glory, of rejoicing, and of the crown of a good life.

verses.latin: Timor Domini delectabit cor, et dabit lætitiam et gaudium et longævitatem.
verses.english: The fear of God is the delight of the heart, and will bring joy, happiness, and a long life.

verses.latin: Timens Deum bene erit in novissimo, et in die consummationis benedicetur.
verses.english: Those who fear God will have a good life, and will be blessed on the day of their death.

verses.latin: Principium sapientiæ timor Dei: et cum fidelibus in vulva concreatus est.
verses.english: The fear of God is the beginning of wisdom; it has been woven into the very fiber of a faithful person.

verses.latin: Cum impiis ira et conturbatio, et dies condemnationis.
verses.english: For the wicked, there is only anger, confusion, and the day of condemnation.

verses.latin: A principio omnis creatura facta est ad conservationem vitæ, et malis ad interitum.
verses.english: From the beginning, all creation was made to preserve life, and to bring the wicked to destruction.

verses.latin: Verba hominis convertunt cor, et quasi ignis comburet.
verses.english: The words of a person can change the heart, and will burn like a fire.

verses.latin: Viri peccatoris viæ dolosæ: et ipse non habet misericordiam.
verses.english: The ways of the sinful person are full of deceit, and they have no mercy.

verses.latin: Dabit misericordiam omnis eleemosynæ, et quasi pupillam oculi respiciet singulos.
verses.english: Charity and mercy will receive mercy and will watch over each person as they would their own eyes.

verses.latin: Postea retribuet singulis secundum opera eorum: et secundum sensus illorum.
verses.english: Then God will reward everyone according to their deeds and their knowledge.

verses.latin: Ne dicas: Abscondar me a Deo? et a supernis quis memorabit mei?
verses.english: Do not say, "I will hide from God," and "Who in the heavens will remember me?"

verses.latin: In multitudine, nescit homo; et in mensura, quis sustentabit opera ejus?
verses.english: God sees everything; no one can hide from Him.

verses.latin: Opera justitiæ, sicut ligna fructifera: et cogitatus veritatis, sicut radix fortis.
verses.english: The works of justice are like fruit-bearing trees, and thoughts of truth are a strong root.

verses.latin: In plantatu ejus parasti in æternum. Quia in conspectu Domini honoratur justitia.
verses.english: You prepared for it to be in place forever. Justice is honored in the presence of God.

verses.latin: Justus non errabit in malis.
verses.english: The just man will not go astray.

verses.latin: Et justus est in conspectu Domini, et quasi sol in conspectu Dei.
verses.english: The just man is always in the sight of God, like the sun shining in God's presence.

verses.latin: Probaverunt justum, et probaverunt eum Deus.
verses.english: God tests the righteous, and puts them to the test.

verses.latin: Et sicut aurum in fornace, probavit illos: et in tempore visitationis illorum confundantur.
verses.english: He tests them like gold in a furnace, and they will be humbled at the time of their testing.

verses.latin: Et sicut carbones in fornace, ita impii: et comburentur in die judicii.
verses.english: The wicked are like burning coals in a furnace, and they will be consumed on the day of judgment.

verses.latin: Justi autem fulgebunt, et sicut scintilla in arundineto current.
verses.english: But the righteous will shine, and will run like sparks through the reeds.

verses.latin: Judicabunt gentes, et dominabuntur populis: et regnabit Dominus illorum in æternum.
verses.english: They will judge the nations, and will rule over the people, and the Lord will reign over them forever.

verses.latin: Qui confidunt in eo, intelligent veritatem, et qui fideles sunt in dilectione, permanebunt in illo: quoniam gratia et pax electis ejus.
verses.english: Those who trust in God will understand the truth, and those who remain faithful in love will remain in him, because grace and peace are given to his elect.

verses.latin: Sapiens iudicabit populum suum, et sensus gentis stabilis erit.
verses.english: A wise man will govern his people, and a wise man's rule will be stable.

verses.latin: Qualis iudex populi, talis et ministri ejus: et qualis rector civitatis, tales et inhabitantes eam.
verses.english: As the leader of the people is, so also are his helpers; and as the leader of the city is, so also are those who live within it.

verses.latin: Rex insipiens perdet populum suum, et civitas habitabitur per prudentiam principum.
verses.english: A foolish king will destroy his people, but a city will be well-governed through the wisdom of its leaders.

verses.latin: In manu Dei est terra, et hominem utilem suscitabit in tempore suo.
verses.english: The earth is in God's hand, and in His time, He will raise up a useful man.

verses.latin: In manu Dei prosperitas hominis, et faciem scribae glorificabit super illum.
verses.english: The prosperity of man is in God's hand, and God will bring honor to the face of a wise man.

verses.latin: Noli irasci pro proximo tuo in omni injuria, et ne facias aliquid in operibus injuriarum.
verses.english: Do not be angry with your neighbor for every wrong, and do not commit any deed of injustice.

verses.latin: Superbia odio est Deo et hominibus, et apud utrumque iniquitas.
verses.english: Pride is hateful to God and men, and injustice is hateful to both.

verses.latin: Regnum a gente in gentem transfertur propter injustitias, et contumelias, et pecunias.
verses.english: A kingdom is transferred from nation to nation because of injustices, insults, and greed.

verses.latin: Nihil est superbus super hominem: omnia enim haec cinis et pulvis.
verses.english: Nothing is more proud than man: for all these things are ash and dust.

verses.latin: Quid superbus super illud quod est cinis, et cor ejus plenum est foetoris?
verses.english: What is so proud about being ash, when your heart is full of stench?

verses.latin: Aegrotatio medicorum abscidit: et qui hodie rex, cras morietur.
verses.english: The doctor’s sickness is incurable: and the one who is king today will die tomorrow.

verses.latin: Cum mortuus fuerit homo, hereditabit serpentes, et bestias, et vermes.
verses.english: When a man dies, he will inherit serpents, wild beasts, and worms.

verses.latin: Initium superbiae hominis apostatare a Deo: quoniam a conditore recessit cor ejus.
verses.english: The beginning of man's pride is to turn away from God: because his heart has withdrawn from his Creator.

verses.latin: Quoniam initium omnis peccati est superbia: qui continet illam, implebitur maledictione, et evertet illum in fine.
verses.english: Because the beginning of all sin is pride: he who embraces it will be filled with a curse, and it will destroy him in the end.

verses.latin: Propterea Deus contristavit contumeliosos, et contrivit eos usque in fundamentum.
verses.english: Therefore, God has afflicted the arrogant, and has crushed them even to their foundation.

verses.latin: Deos de terra exturbavit: et eorum memoria non est.
verses.english: God has cast out those who were thought to be gods from the earth: and their memory is no more.

verses.latin: Superbia non est creata cum hominibus, neque ira cum his qui de mulieribus gignuntur.
verses.english: Pride was not created with men, nor was wrath created with those who are born of women.

verses.latin: Sed a principio superbia et ira fuerunt illorum, qui a Deo recesserunt.
verses.english: But from the beginning, pride and wrath have existed in those who departed from God.

verses.latin: Peccatum detestabile utraque: qui tenuerit illas, plenus erit impietate.
verses.english: Sin and wrath are both detestable: he who clings to them will be filled with impiety.

verses.latin: Propterea Deus intulit tribulationes contumeliosis: et eos dissipavit usque in finem.
verses.english: Therefore, God brought tribulations to the arrogant: and He has scattered them to the end.

verses.latin: Sicut ignis exardescit, sic ira impii: et sicut flamma comburit, sic cor ejus.
verses.english: As fire rages, so does the wrath of the wicked: and as a flame consumes, so does his heart.

verses.latin: Quomodo iratus homo faciet contra creatorem suum? et quomodo stultus credet Deum?
verses.english: How will an angry man act against his Creator? And how will a fool believe in God?

verses.latin: Omnis patientia hominis in tempore modico: et postea gaudium infidelis mutabitur.
verses.english: All patience of man is for a short time: and afterwards, the joy of the unfaithful will be changed.

verses.latin: Usque ad tempus patientur, et postea mala illorum exprolabuntur illis.
verses.english: They will suffer for a time, and afterwards, their evils will be thrown back at them.

verses.latin: Bona illorum in conspectu hominum abscondentur, et in auditione impiorum exterminabuntur.
verses.english: Their good deeds will be hidden from the sight of men, and in the hearing of the wicked they will be destroyed.

verses.latin: Filius iniquus non habet radices validas: et semen impiorum non habebit fundamentum.
verses.english: The wicked son does not have strong roots: and the seed of the wicked will not have a foundation.

verses.latin: Et si germinaverit in ramis, ramuli ejus non stabunt: et vento ventorum convelletur, et radicitus evelletur.
verses.english: And if it sprouts in branches, its shoots will not last: and it will be torn down by the wind, and uprooted.

verses.latin: Imperfecta fructificatio ejus: et fructus ejus inutiles ad esum: et ad nihilum apti.
verses.english: Its fruit is imperfect: and its fruits are useless to eat: and good for nothing.

verses.latin: Aram impiorum, non est in filiis, neque in radicibus putredinis.
verses.english: The altar of the wicked is not in the children, nor in the roots of rottenness.

verses.latin: Filii autem impiorum non multiplicabuntur: et generatio infidelis non habebit firmamentum.
verses.english: But the children of the wicked will not multiply: and the generation of the unfaithful will not have a foundation.

verses.latin: Generatio filiorum impiorum exterminabitur.
verses.english: The generation of the children of the wicked will be destroyed.

verses.latin: Filii impiorum, quasi rami, non habebunt radicem firmam: et quasi ventus, fructus illorum.
verses.english: The children of the wicked, like branches, will not have a firm root: and their fruit will be like the wind.

verses.latin: Frondes impiorum non florebunt: et quasi pulvis, et fumus malorum, et non stabunt.
verses.english: The leaves of the wicked will not flourish: and like dust and the smoke of evils, they will not endure.

verses.latin: Qui diligit Deum, permanebit in sapientia: et lex ejus, sicut lux, illuminabit.
verses.english: He who loves God will remain in wisdom: and His law will illuminate, like light.

verses.latin: Si benefeceris, scito cui benefeceris, et erit gratia bonis tuis.
verses.english: If you do good deeds, know who receives them, and the benefit will go to those who deserve it.

verses.latin: Fac bonum justo, et invenies mercedem magnam, et si non ab ipso, certe a Sancto.
verses.english: Do good for a righteous person, and you will get a great reward. If not from them, certainly from God.

verses.latin: Non est bonum ei, qui perseverat in malis, et non dat eleemosynam: et ipse quoque in quo facta est miserebitur.
verses.english: It's not good for the one who insists on doing evil and refuses to give to the poor. He will also be pitied by those to whom he shows no mercy.

verses.latin: Da misericordi, et ne susceperis peccatorem: et impiorum ne detineas.
verses.english: Give to the merciful, but don’t receive a sinner. Don’t give hospitality to the wicked.

verses.latin: Fac bonum humili, et non da impio: prohibe panem, et ne tribuas illi, ne forte exinde plus accipiat.
verses.english: Do good for the humble, but not for the wicked. Refuse the bread, and don't give it to him, lest he uses it for evil purposes.

verses.latin: Da bono, et non susceperis peccatorem.
verses.english: Give to the good, but don’t receive a sinner.

verses.latin: Amplius da justo, et non retineas impio.
verses.english: Give more to the righteous, and don’t hold back from the wicked.

verses.latin: Melius est enim dare justo, quam accipere: et impio non dabitur utrumque.
verses.english: It is better to give to the just man than to receive. Neither one will be given to the wicked.

verses.latin: Pariter enim utrumque abominabile est Deo, et utriusque iniquitas similiter.
verses.english: Both are equally detestable to God, and the injustice of each is the same.

verses.latin: In tribulationibus probabitur justus: quasi aurum in camino ignis.
verses.english: The righteous will be tested in times of trial, like gold in a furnace.

verses.latin: Cor contristatus mutabit faciem, et cor malum contrabit.
verses.english: A sad heart will change one's face, and a wicked heart will contract.

verses.latin: Cor bonum in gaudio, et cogitationes ejus semper in lucem.
verses.english: A good heart is joyful, and its thoughts are always in the light.

verses.latin: Ne timeas verba impii: quia gloria ejus in stercore erit.
verses.english: Don't fear the words of the wicked because his glory will be in the dung.

verses.latin: Hodie florens, cras non invenietur: et revertetur pulvis ejus in pulverem, et memoria ejus peribit.
verses.english: Flourishing today, he will not be found tomorrow. His dust will return to dust, and his memory will perish.

verses.latin: Custodi mandata, et disces cogitationem, et in malis non conturbaberis.
verses.english: Keep the commandments, and you will learn how to think. You will not be disturbed by evil.

verses.latin: Cor justorum cogitabit fidem, et justitiam, et timorem Dei.
verses.english: The heart of the righteous meditates on faith, and justice, and the fear of God.

verses.latin: Cor peccatorum cogitabit iniqua, et in conturbationibus et offensionibus.
verses.english: The heart of sinners meditates on wickedness, in disturbances and offenses.

verses.latin: Opus viri boni in judicio Deus illuminat, et in tenebris inveniet.
verses.english: God illuminates the work of a good man in judgment and finds it in darkness.

verses.latin: Non est bonum impii divitias habere, et justum pauperem.
verses.english: It is not good for the wicked to have riches, and the just to be poor.

verses.latin: De transitu justi in morte non contristabitur: et impii transitum sperat.
verses.english: The righteous person will not be sad about death, but the wicked person hopes for it.

verses.latin: De sermone sapientis agnoscetur sapientia, et os imprudentis contritum.
verses.english: Wisdom is recognized from the speech of the wise, and the mouth of the fool is crushed.

verses.latin: Sermo impii in conturbationibus: ipse vero in gaudio confodietur.
verses.english: The speech of the wicked is in disturbance, but he will be pierced in joy.

verses.latin: Quando mortuus est homo, hereditabit serpentes, et bestias, et vermes.
verses.english: When a man dies, he inherits serpents, wild beasts, and worms.

verses.latin: Initium superbiae hominis apostatare a Deo: qui recessit a Conditore suo, cor ejus a se recessit.
verses.english: The beginning of pride in man is to turn away from God. He who departs from his Creator, his heart departs from himself.

verses.latin: Quoniam initium omnis peccati est superbia: qui eam tenuerit, replebitur maledictis, et subvertet eum in fine.
verses.english: Because the beginning of all sin is pride. He who holds onto it will be filled with curses, and it will ruin him in the end.

verses.latin: Propterea contristatus est Dominus flagella impiorum, et penitus destruxit eos.
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord was grieved by the scourges of the wicked and utterly destroyed them.

verses.latin: Radix superbiae, iniquitas hominis: et qui eam tenuerit, effundet eam quasi aquam.
verses.english: The root of pride is the iniquity of man. He who holds it will pour it out like water.

verses.latin: Propterea tradidit illos Deus in perditionem: et subvertit illos in finem.
verses.english: Therefore, God delivered them to destruction and overthrew them in the end.

verses.latin: Sicut flumina aquarum, sic exusta est terra a superbis: et periit ab eis gloria eorum.
verses.english: Like the flow of waters, so was the earth burned by the proud, and their glory perished from them.

verses.latin: Gratia est sapientiae justo: et sacrificium peccatorum abominabile.
verses.english: Wisdom is a grace to the just, but the sacrifice of sinners is abominable.

verses.latin: Qui tetigerit picem, coinquinabitur ab ea: et qui cominiscebatur superbum, seminabit superbum.
verses.english: Whoever touches pitch will be dirtied by it, and whoever is involved with the proud will share in their pride.

verses.latin: Noli aequare te illi: et non perieris.
verses.english: Don't become one of them, and you won't perish.

verses.latin: Quid magnum? qui argillam tangit? et quid mundum? qui propinquat illi?
verses.english: What's so great about handling clay? And who is kept pure by touching it?

verses.latin: Quid est magnum? qui homini similis est? et quid gloriosum? qui iniquus est?
verses.english: What's so great about someone who is like everyone else? What's glorious about someone who does wrong?

verses.latin: De homine, qui est iniquus, glorificabitur justus, et iniqui et peccatoris odium habet.
verses.english: The just will be glorified over the wicked. The proud and the sinner are to be hated.

verses.latin: A principio Deus hominem creavit de terra, et in illam reducit illum iterum.
verses.english: From the beginning, God created man from the earth and will return him to it again.

verses.latin: Dies hominum numerati sunt, et in brevi tempus illorum.
verses.english: The days of mankind are numbered, and their time is brief.

verses.latin: Quasi vas figuli figmentum ejus, et in finem ejus.
verses.english: Man is like a vessel formed by a potter, and he will end up in the potter's hands.

verses.latin: Omnis homo de terra factus est, et de terra sumptus est.
verses.english: Every man is made of the earth, and from the earth he was taken.

verses.latin: Quid ergo plus conturbas? nihil est, quod magis conturbat quam homo, qui de terra factus est.
verses.english: Why then be so troubled? There is nothing more troubling than man, who is made of the earth.

verses.latin: Quid superbus est? et quid putredo et cinis?
verses.english: Why be proud? What is man but decay and ash?

verses.latin: Pro longitudine morbi contristatus est medicus: et qui hodie rex est, cras morietur.
verses.english: The doctor is saddened by the length of the sickness, and the king of today will die tomorrow.

verses.latin: Homo, quare superberis, et quid iniquum es?
verses.english: Man, why be proud? Why do evil things?

verses.latin: In morbo et in perditione omnis homo, et de bestia et vermis peccatoris animam accipit.
verses.english: In sickness and destruction is every man; and from the beast and the worm comes the soul of the sinner.

verses.latin: Omnis superbus initium peccati est: qui invenit illud, effundit scaturientes iras.
verses.english: Pride is the beginning of sin; the one who finds it pours out overflowing anger.

verses.latin: Propterea Dominus intulit illis plagas mirabiles, et destruxit illos usque ad fundamentum.
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord brought upon them terrible plagues and destroyed them utterly.

verses.latin: Sedes superborum conturbavit Deus, et proiciet illos.
verses.english: God has thrown down the thrones of the proud and will cast them out.

verses.latin: Radix superbiæ, odium hominum: et propter quod iniquitatem committit, perdet illum.
verses.english: The root of pride is the hatred of men, and because of sin, it will destroy him.

verses.latin: Superbiæ detraxerunt Deo, et maledixerunt: et postremo dolore passi sunt.
verses.english: The proud blasphemed God and cursed Him, and at the end, they suffered in pain.

verses.latin: Illis autem, qui timent Deum, bona omnia; et his, qui in timore ejus sunt, pacem.
verses.english: But for those who fear God, all things are good; and for those who are in His fear, there is peace.

verses.latin: Anima timoris Dei, quaerens et probans justitias suas.
verses.english: The soul of the fear of God seeks and tests its own righteousness.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, parabit cor suum, et in conspectu Dei sanctificabit animam suam.
verses.english: He who fears God will prepare his heart and sanctify his soul in the sight of God.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, observat mandata ejus, et patientiam præparabit in timore suo.
verses.english: He who fears God observes His commandments, and he will prepare patience in his fear.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, quæret placita ejus, et qui diligunt eum, implebunt ea.
verses.english: He who fears God seeks his will, and those who love Him will fulfill it.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, præparabit cor suum, et humiliabitur in conspectu ejus.
verses.english: He who fears God prepares his heart, and he is humbled in His sight.

verses.latin: Incidamus in manus Dei, et non in manus hominum: quia secundum magnitudinem ipsius et misericordia ejus est.
verses.english: Let us fall into the hands of God, and not into the hands of men, because His mercy is great.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, faciet bona; et qui continens est, dimittet peccata.
verses.english: The one who reveres God will do good works, and through doing those works, he will be forgiven for his sins.

verses.latin: Qui continens est, sustinebit patientiam, et in illis, qui peccare possunt, manebit laetitia.
verses.english: The one who has self-control will endure with patience. In those who may sin, joy will remain.

verses.latin: Cor illius cogitabitur bona, in judicio non corrumpetur.
verses.english: The heart of the self-controlled man will consider good things and won't be corrupted in the judgment.

verses.latin: Beato viro, qui in malis non perseverat.
verses.english: Happy is the man who perseveres in good things, and not in evil.

verses.latin: Vir malus non figitur in tentationibus: et sapientia viro peccatori non placuit.
verses.english: A bad man is not found in the temptations that beset good men, and wisdom is not pleasing to a sinful man.

verses.latin: Sapiens est in verbo sapientiae; et justus stabilitur quasi sol.
verses.english: The wise man is in the word of wisdom, and the just man stands firm like the sun.

verses.latin: Cordis mali contio quasi onus gravi: et sensus ipsius exacerbat illos.
verses.english: The counsel of an evil heart is a heavy burden, and his mind exasperates those around him.

verses.latin: Accepta est ab eo impietas, et non emundabitur; quia detraxit Deus ab eo timorem.
verses.english: Wickedness is accepted by the wicked man, and he is not cleansed, because God has taken away his fear.

verses.latin: Cor sapiens intelligitur in verbis sapientiae: et sicut nox in die, sic homo stultus in sensu.
verses.english: The wise heart is understood in the words of wisdom, and as night in day, so is a foolish man in understanding.

verses.latin: Non contristaberis cor justi, quia judicat, et non odisti hominem peccatorem.
verses.english: You shall not grieve the heart of a just man, because he judges, and does not hate a sinful man.

verses.latin: Averte animam tuam a peccato, et modicum corrige iniquitatem.
verses.english: Turn your soul away from sin, and correct iniquity a little.

verses.latin: Da eleemosynam de substantia tua; et noli avertere faciem tuam a paupere.
verses.english: Give alms from your possessions, and do not turn your face away from the poor.

verses.latin: Averte faciem tuam a pauperis, et non avertet a te oculos suos.
verses.english: Turn away your face from the poor, and he will not turn away his eyes from you.

verses.latin: In conviviis, mensa tecum sit; et quidquid præparatur, esto prior.
verses.english: In banquets, let your table be with you, and whatever is prepared, be first.

verses.latin: Esto sicut homo scitus, qui rapit quod præparatur, et propter hoc non comedas plurimum.
verses.english: Be like a learned man who grabs what is prepared, and because of this, do not eat too much.

verses.latin: Si multum es, noli insidiari, et si in mediis es, non sis imprudens.
verses.english: If you are plentiful, do not be greedy, and if you are in the midst of those who are not, do not be imprudent.

verses.latin: Satietas bona moderata; et contristat insomnium.
verses.english: Moderation is good in fullness, and sleeplessness causes sorrow.

verses.latin: Somnus in terra frigida quietus est; et mediocris homo comedet, et saturabitur.
verses.english: Sleep is quiet in a cold land, and the mediocre man will eat and be satisfied.

verses.latin: Sapiens obaudivit verba sapientiæ, et adprobavit ea; et qui sensatus est, laudavit ea.
verses.english: The wise man has heeded the words of wisdom, and has approved them, and the one who is sensible praises them.

verses.latin: Sapiens et qui didicit, in doctrina sapientiæ occurret: et qui insipiens est, non permanet in ea.
verses.english: The wise man and the one who has learned in the doctrine of wisdom will encounter wisdom, but the one who is foolish does not remain in it.

verses.latin: Sensus stulti quasi rotae currus: et quasi impetus fortis in judicio.
verses.english: The understanding of the fool is like the wheel of a chariot, and is like a strong impulse in judgement.

verses.latin: Fili, ne opereris plurima, et si multiplicare te volueris, ne justus eris.
verses.english: Son, do not work too much, and if you want to multiply yourself, you will not be just.

verses.latin: Si fueris magnus, in te humiliaberis: et coram Deo invenies gratiam.
verses.english: If you are great, you will be humbled in yourself, and before God, you will find grace.

verses.latin: In secreto scrutare, et invenies: et in his, quæ quæris, impleberis.
verses.english: Search in secret, and you will find, and in the things that you seek, you will be filled.

verses.latin: Multis enim laboribus non indiges; si scrutatus fueris.
verses.english: For you do not need many labors if you have searched.

verses.latin: Multi enim decepti sunt, in sua opinione: et mala suspicio avertit illos.
verses.english: For many have been deceived in their own opinion, and an evil suspicion turns them away.

verses.latin: Cor durus male successit; et qui contempsit ea, in malis inplicabitur.
verses.english: A hard heart has not succeeded, and the one who has despised it will be entangled in evil.

verses.latin: Qui in malis perseverat, cumulabit peccata.
verses.english: The one who perseveres in evil will accumulate sins.

verses.latin: Abstine te a desideriis, et non facias voluntatem tuam: et abstine te a voluptatibus.
verses.english: Abstain from desires and do not do your own will, and abstain from pleasures.

verses.latin: Si dederis animæ tuæ concupiscentias, faciet te in gaudium inimicis tuis.
verses.english: If you give your soul to desires, it will make you a joy to your enemies.

verses.latin: Noli deliciis abundare, et noli conjungere te illis.
verses.english: Do not abound in delights and do not be joined to them.

verses.latin: Noli paupertatem fieri ex conviviis, cum parva expensa.
