verses.english: Do not become poor from banquets with little expense.

verses.latin: Timet Deum, et faciet mandata illius: et qui diligit illum, conservabit vias illius.
verses.english: Fear God, and you will do what He commands. Whoever loves God, will maintain his ways.

verses.latin: Qui credit illi, habet vitam aeternam: et qui diligit illum, recipiet misericordiam.
verses.english: Those who have faith in God, will have eternal life. Those who love Him, will receive mercy.

verses.latin: Initium sapientiæ timor Domini: et cum fidelibus in vulva conpositus est, confirmabitur in illis.
verses.english: To fear the Lord is the beginning of wisdom. The Lord will be with those who are faithful.

verses.latin: Sapientia et disciplina in intellectu justi: oculus Domini super eos qui diligunt eum.
verses.english: Wisdom and discipline are in the understanding of the righteous. The eye of the Lord is upon those who love Him.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, faciet bona: et qui continens est, propitiabitur illi justitia.
verses.english: Whoever fears God will do good, and those who are self-controlled will have the mercy of God.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, parat cor suum: et in conspectu illius humilians animam suam.
verses.english: Those who fear God will prepare their heart and soul before Him with humility.

verses.latin: In manibus Dei et sapientia et veritas, et scientia legis: omnia opera illius in fide.
verses.english: Wisdom, truth, and the knowledge of the Law are in the hands of God. All the works of the Lord are done with faith.

verses.latin: Scientia et intellectus timoris, custodiet mandata ipsius.
verses.english: Knowledge and understanding of the fear of God, is keeping His commandments.

verses.latin: Peccatorem non suscipiet, et superbum non respiciet: quoniam Deus est judex omnium.
verses.english: God will not receive the sinner or regard the proud, for God is the judge of all.

verses.latin: Non est personarum acceptio apud Deum: nec ad pauperes respicit precationem.
verses.english: God does not show favoritism, nor does he disregard the prayer of the poor.

verses.latin: Exaudit orationem oppressi, et injurias faciet defensoris sui.
verses.english: He hears the prayer of the oppressed and will bring judgement on their oppressors.

verses.latin: Non fastidiosus erit in precibus pupilli, nec viduæ, si effuderit querelam.
verses.english: God will not get tired of the prayers of the orphan or the widow when they pour out their complaints.

verses.latin: Nonne lacrimae viduæ descendunt in maxillam, et clamor ejus super eum qui illas fecerit cadit?
verses.english: Do not the tears of the widow fall on the cheek, and does her cry fall on the one who caused them?

verses.latin: Qui servit Deo, benigne suscipietur: et oratio ejus usque ad nubem pertinget.
verses.english: Whoever serves God will be received with kindness, and his prayer will reach to the clouds.

verses.latin: Oratio humiliabit se plagas: et exivit de ore Dei: et usque ad altitudinem pertinget.
verses.english: The prayer of the humble will pierce the clouds, and it will not depart until God has considered it.

verses.latin: Et non recedet, donec altissimus respiciat, et judicium justorum faciat, et judicium faciet.
verses.english: It will not depart until the Most High has looked upon it, and will bring righteous judgment, and will consider it.

verses.latin: Et non tardabit: usque dum perficiat judicium.
verses.english: And it will not delay until He has finished the judgment.

verses.latin: Maledictus qui spernit Deum: et cor avarum: et qui blasphemat, non justificabitur.
verses.english: Cursed is he who rejects God, whose heart is greedy, and those who blaspheme will not be justified.

verses.latin: Qui abundant malis, reservabuntur in malis: et peccata illorum non abscondentur.
verses.english: Those who abound in evils, will be reserved for evil, and their sins will not be hidden.

verses.latin: Liberatio timere Deum, et spes illius, qui cognoscit illum.
verses.english: The deliverance of those who fear God, and the hope of those who know Him.

verses.latin: Qui timet Dominum, nihil pavebit, et non expavescet: quoniam ipse est spes ejus.
verses.english: Whoever fears the Lord will fear nothing, and will not be afraid, because He Himself is their hope.

verses.latin: Timor Domini vita est: et qui habuerit, requiescet in nocte.
verses.english: To fear the Lord is life, and those who have it, will rest in the night.

verses.latin: Timor Domini optatus: et corona exultationis: faciens laetitiam et diem exultationis.
verses.english: The fear of the Lord is the desired crown of rejoicing, making joy and the day of exultation.

verses.latin: Timor Domini, radix sapientiæ: et rami illius, longævitatis.
verses.english: To fear the Lord is the root of wisdom, and its branches are of long life.

verses.latin: Timor Domini repellit peccata: et qui habuerit illum, convertet omnem iram.
verses.english: To fear the Lord drives away sins. Whoever has it, will turn away from all anger.

verses.latin: Qui sine timore est, non poterit justificari: iracundia enim conturbationis illius subvertet eum.
verses.english: He who is without fear will not be justified, for the anger of his disturbance will destroy him.

verses.latin: Patientem usque in tempus sustinebit: et post, reddetur illi laetitia.
verses.english: He who is patient will sustain until the end, and after that, joy will be given to him.

verses.latin: Bonus est qui potest abscondere nequitiam: et qui habet bonam gratiam, enarrabit justitias.
verses.english: It is good to hide iniquity, and those who have good grace will recount the just deeds.

verses.latin: Bonus est qui potest continere linguam, et qui non est expertus in tristitia.
verses.english: It is good to control the tongue and to not have been experienced in grief.

verses.latin: Omnis sapientia a Domino Deo est, et cum illo est semper, et ante saecula.
verses.english: All wisdom comes from the Lord God. God has had wisdom always, and for all time before the world began.

verses.latin: Arenam maris, et guttas pluviae, et dies saeculi quis dinumerabit?
verses.english: Who can count the sand of the sea, the raindrops, or the days of eternity?

verses.latin: Altitudinem caeli, et latitudinem terrae, et profundum abyssi, quis investigabit?
verses.english: Who can understand the height of the sky, the width of the earth, or the depth of the abyss?

verses.latin: Sapientiam ante omnia creata est, et intellectus prudentiae ab aeterno.
verses.english: Wisdom was created before all things, and prudence has existed eternally.

verses.latin: Fons sapientiae verbum Dei in excelsis, et semitas illius mandata aeterna.
verses.english: The word of God in the highest heavens is the source of wisdom, and His paths are the eternal commandments.

verses.latin: Cui revelata est radix sapientiae? et scientiam illius quis agnovit?
verses.english: To whom has the root of wisdom been revealed? Who has known His knowledge?

verses.latin: Unus est excelsus, creator omnipotens, rex potens, terribilis valde, sedens super thronum ejus, et dominans.
verses.english: There is only one Most High, the almighty Creator, a powerful king, greatly to be feared, sitting on His throne, and ruling.

verses.latin: Qui creavit illam in spiritu sancto, et vidit illam, et dinumeravit, et mensus est illam.
verses.english: He created wisdom in the Holy Spirit. He saw, numbered, and measured wisdom.

verses.latin: Et effudit illam super omnia opera sua, et super omnem carnem secundum donum suum, et praebuit illam diligentibus se.
verses.english: And He poured out wisdom on all His works, and on all mankind, according to His gift. He gave wisdom to those who love Him.

verses.latin: Timor Domini gloria, et gloriatio, et laetitia, et corona exultationis.
verses.english: Fear of the Lord is glory, boasting, joy, and a crown of exultation.

verses.latin: Timor Domini delectabit cor, et dabit laetitiam, et gaudium, et longitudinem dierum.
verses.english: Fear of the Lord delights the heart and gives joy, gladness, and length of days.

verses.latin: Timenti Deum bene erit in extremis, et in die consummationis benedicetur.
verses.english: It will be well for those who fear God in their final days, and they will be blessed on the day of their completion.

verses.latin: Initium timoris Dei est, justificatio, et cum natis est fidelium in utero.
verses.english: The beginning of the fear of God is justification, and it exists with the faithful from birth.

verses.latin: Sapientia thesaurum scientiae, et operum justorum, abominabilis est Deo sacrificium impii.
verses.english: Wisdom is the treasure of knowledge and of the works of the just, but the sacrifice of the wicked is abominable to God.

verses.latin: Offerens munera injusta, maculata est oblatio, et non sunt placita delicta impiorum.
verses.english: The offering of unjust gifts is defiled, and the sins of the wicked are not pleasing.

verses.latin: Dominus judex est, et non acceptator personarum.
verses.english: The Lord is the judge and does not accept persons.

verses.latin: Non acceptat personam contra pauperem, et precationem laesi exaudiet.
verses.english: He does not accept anyone against the poor, and He will hear the prayer of the injured.

verses.latin: Non despicies gemitum pauperis, et non irriteris in preces viduae.
verses.english: Do not despise the groaning of the poor, and do not be annoyed by the prayers of the widow.

verses.latin: De lacrymis enim viduae excurrent genae, et clamans contra eum qui illas fecerit.
verses.english: The tears of a widow fall on her cheeks, and she cries out against him who caused them.

verses.latin: Qui deservit Deo, acceptabilis est, et precatio illius pervenit usque ad nubes.
verses.english: He who serves God is acceptable, and his prayer reaches even to the clouds.

verses.latin: Oratio humilis pertransiet nubes, donec perveniat, et non discedet, donec Altissimus aspexerit,
verses.english: A humble prayer passes through the clouds until it arrives, and it will not depart until the Most High looks upon it,

verses.latin: et judicabit justos, et faciet judicium, et exaudiet.
verses.english: and He will judge the just and will perform judgment and hear it.

verses.latin: Et non tardabit, et non sustinebit, donec consummaverit.
verses.english: And He will not delay, nor will He endure until He has completed it.

verses.latin: Dominus enim judex est, et in judicio non est acceptio personarum.
verses.english: For the Lord is the judge, and there is no favoritism in judgment.

verses.latin: Non acceptabit personam contra pauperem: quoniam precationem oppressi exaudiet.
verses.english: He will not accept anyone against the poor, because He hears the prayer of the oppressed.

verses.latin: Et non contemnet deprecationem pupilli, et non contristabitur de gemitu viduae.
verses.english: And He will not despise the supplication of the orphan, nor will He be saddened by the groaning of the widow.

verses.latin: Numquid non defluent genae viduae, et clamor ejus super eum qui illas fecerit?
verses.english: Do not the widow’s cheeks flow with tears, and her cries against him who caused them?

verses.latin: Qui enim deservit Deo, suscipietur benigne, et placabuntur petitiones illius usque ad nubes.
verses.english: For he who serves God will be received kindly, and his requests will be placated even to the clouds.

verses.latin: Oratio humilis pertransiet regiones. Donec perveniat: et non recedet, donec Altissimus respiciat,
verses.english: A humble prayer passes through regions, until it arrives, and it will not depart until the Most High looks upon it,

verses.latin: et judicabit justos, et faciet judicium, et proferet judicium.
verses.english: and He will judge the just, and He will perform judgment, and He will bring forth judgment.

verses.latin: Dominus creavit ex terra hominem, et secundum imaginem suam fecit illum.
verses.english: The Lord fashioned man out of the earth, and made him according to His own image.

verses.latin: Et in virtutem suam redegit illum.
verses.english: He gave man dominion over himself, over his mind, and over his body.

verses.latin: Et posuit illum in timore suo,
verses.english: God made man to be awestruck before Him, and gave man a duty to love and serve God.

verses.latin: ut cognosceret majestatem ejus.
verses.english: Man was made so that he might come to know God's infinite greatness.

verses.latin: Oculos ejus implens, ut videret cor ejus, et doctrinam intelligentiae ostendit illi.
verses.english: He filled man's eyes with understanding, so that man could see God's plan, and he showed him the knowledge of understanding.

verses.latin: Scientiam mentis dedit illi, et gloriam ostendit illi.
verses.english: He gave man knowledge of his mind, and showed him His glory.

verses.latin: Super scientiam posuit oculos eorum, et ostendit illis magnitudinem operum suorum.
verses.english: He put understanding into man's eyes, and showed him the greatness of His works.

verses.latin: Et opera eorum in aeternum glorificavit.
verses.english: And He made their works glorious forever.

verses.latin: Et ordinavit illis testamentum aeternum, et justitiam suam ostendit illis.
verses.english: He made an eternal covenant with them, and showed them His justice.

verses.latin: Misericordia ipsius in omni carne.
verses.english: His mercy is upon all flesh.

verses.latin: Misericordiam suam effudit super omnem terram.
verses.english: He pours out His mercy over all the earth.

verses.latin: Misit eis hominem, qui esset in virtute sua.
verses.english: God sent man on a mission, and he was given dominion over all things.

verses.latin: Et dedit potestatem animae suae.
verses.english: And He gave man power over his own soul.

verses.latin: In timore et tremore.
verses.english: He gave man the duty to love God with fear and trembling.

verses.latin: Et super proximum suum, et in malum suum.
verses.english: He gave man the duty to love his neighbor, and to understand his own sin.

verses.latin: Generatio hominum sicut folia viridia, et folium ligni, quod decidit, et folium cadit.
verses.english: The generations of men are like the green leaves, and the leaves of a tree, which fall off, and another falls.

verses.latin: Hujusmodi et generatio carnis et sanguinis; alius homo nascitur ex muliere, alius homo moritur.
verses.english: Thus also is the generation of flesh and blood. One man is born from a woman, another man dies.

verses.latin: Omne opus hominum corrumpitur, et opera illorum sequuntur illos.
verses.english: Every work of man is corrupted, and their works follow them.

verses.latin: Et sicut in vasis fictilibus.
verses.english: And it is like the work of a potter.

verses.latin: Sic et justi viri et impii.
verses.english: So also the just and the wicked.

verses.latin: Quid est super solem? et quid super lucem? et quid super vitam? et quid super mortem?
verses.english: What is above the sun? And what is above the light? And what is above life? And what is above death?

verses.latin: Omnia ista ex terra veniunt.
verses.english: All these things come from the earth.

verses.latin: Terra enim ex terra creata est, et justus ex impio venit.
verses.english: For the earth was created out of the earth, and the just man comes from the wicked.

verses.latin: Universa vero in Domino benedicentur.
verses.english: But all things shall be blessed in the Lord.

verses.latin: Vita dierum hominis numerabilis est, dies autem Israel innumerabiles.
verses.english: The days of man's life are numbered, but the days of Israel are without number.

verses.latin: Quis enim enarrabit magnalia Dei? Et qui annuntiabit opera ejus?
verses.english: For who will declare the great things of God? And who will announce His works?

verses.latin: Quis enim mensurabit magnitudinem ejus?
verses.english: For who can measure His greatness?

verses.latin: Quid pretiosius auro? Omnia enim quae auro fiunt, bonum est.
verses.english: What is more precious than gold? For all things that are made of gold are good.

verses.latin: Et quid dulcius melle? et quid melius melle?
verses.english: And what is sweeter than honey? And what is better than honey?

verses.latin: Sapiens autem et disciplina melior auro.
verses.english: But wisdom and discipline are better than gold.

verses.latin: Et sicut sapientia et doctrina dirigunt vitam, sic et misericordia Dei super virum justum.
verses.english: And as wisdom and doctrine direct life, so also is the mercy of God upon the just man.

verses.latin: Qui dat doctrinam, dat et gloriam.
verses.english: He who gives doctrine gives also glory.

verses.latin: Custodi justitiam, et conserva te, et justificaberis.
verses.english: Keep justice, and preserve yourself, and you shall be justified.

verses.latin: Et fidem tuam, et permanebis.
verses.english: And keep your faith, and you shall remain.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, faciet bona: et qui continet justitiam, apprehendet illam, et quasi a matre suscipiet illam.
verses.english: The one who reverences God will act well. The one who holds onto justice will fully understand it, and will be embraced by it as if it were his mother.

verses.latin: Cibo justitiæ pascet illum, et in aquis vitæ potabit illum.
verses.english: He will be nourished by the food of justice, and drink from the waters of life.

verses.latin: In quo timore Domini est scientia et disciplina: et qui faciunt ea, cum justis hereditatem accipient.
verses.english: In the fear of the Lord is knowledge and discipline. Those who act accordingly will receive an inheritance with the just.

verses.latin: Non desideraveris opera impiorum: sed diliges timorem Domini.
verses.english: Do not desire the works of the wicked, but instead love the fear of the Lord.

verses.latin: Non contristaberis, et non pertimesces: et non accedes ad illos.
verses.english: Do not be distressed, and do not be afraid. Do not associate with those people.

verses.latin: A toto enim corde diliges Deum, et qui ei adhaeret, similis illi erit.
verses.english: Love God with your whole heart, and whoever clings to Him will become like Him.

verses.latin: Omnis timor Domini, honor est: et gloria, et gaudium, et corona exultationis.
verses.english: The reverence of the Lord is an honor, glory, joy, and a crown of exultation.

verses.latin: Timorem Dei eligens, delectaberis in illis: et qui diligunt illum, cum vita sanctificabuntur.
verses.english: If you choose the fear of God, you will be delighted in them. Those who love Him will be sanctified in life.

verses.latin: Qui timent Dominum, parant corda sua, et in conspectu illius humiliaverunt animas suas.
verses.english: Those who fear the Lord prepare their hearts and humble their souls in His sight.

verses.latin: Qui timent Dominum, servant mandata ejus, et patientiam habebunt in ipso.
verses.english: Those who fear the Lord keep His commandments and will be patient in Him.

verses.latin: Dicent: Præparabimus corda nostra, et sanctificabimus nos, quoniam post hæc justificabimur.
verses.english: They will say, "We will prepare our hearts and sanctify ourselves, because after this, we will be justified."

verses.latin: Et qui timent Dominum, invenient misericordiam, et in judicio justificabuntur.
verses.english: Those who fear the Lord will find mercy and will be justified in judgment.

verses.latin: Qui timent Dominum, sperabunt in illum, et qui diligunt eum, permanebunt in eo.
verses.english: Those who fear the Lord will hope in Him, and those who love Him will remain in Him.

verses.latin: Qui timent Dominum, quærent quæ placent illi: et qui diligunt eum, implebuntur legibus ejus.
verses.english: Those who fear the Lord will seek what pleases Him. Those who love Him will fulfill His laws.

verses.latin: Qui timent Dominum, parant corda sua, et in conspectu Altissimi humiliaverunt animas suas.
verses.english: Those who fear the Lord prepare their hearts and humble their souls in the sight of the Most High.

verses.latin: Qui timent Dominum, obedient mandatis ejus, et patientiam habebunt: et qui confidunt in illum, non deficient.
verses.english: Those who fear the Lord will obey His commandments and will have patience. Those who trust in Him will not fail.

verses.latin: Væ cordi duplici, et labiis immundis, et manibus operantibus malum, et peccatori ambulanti in duabus viis.
verses.english: Woe to the double-hearted, to impure lips, to hands that do evil, and to the sinner walking on two paths.

verses.latin: Væ cordi timido, quia non credit: et idcirco non protegetur.
verses.english: Woe to the timid heart, because it does not believe and therefore will not be protected.

verses.latin: Væ illi qui perdit patientiam, et avertit semitas rectas, et ascendit vias perversas.
verses.english: Woe to the one who loses patience, turns away from the right paths, and ascends the perverse ways.

verses.latin: Quid facient timentes Deum? Et qui servant leges illius, in illis habebunt vitam.
verses.english: What will those who fear God do? Those who keep His laws will have life in them.

verses.latin: Qui timent illum, præparabunt corda sua, et in conspectu ejus humiliaverunt animas suas.
verses.english: Those who fear Him will prepare their hearts and humble their souls in His sight.

verses.latin: Cadent in manus Dei, et in judicio Deus visitabit illos.
verses.english: They will fall into the hands of God, and in judgment, God will visit them.

verses.latin: Qui contempsit modica, paulatim decidet.
verses.english: Whoever scorns small things will fall little by little.

verses.latin: Agnoscens justa, auferet gloriam iniquitatis: et conversus judex improborum, extorquebit ea.
verses.english: A judge who understands justice will take away the glory of the wicked and will turn away from the evildoers, thus judging them.

verses.latin: Ignis ardens, et procellosus ventus, et fames, proeliatores.
verses.english: Fire and a violent wind are the agents of destruction, as is famine.

verses.latin: Malo quam malum, et inimico quam inimicus; et pejor dolus inimici.
verses.english: It is better to fall into the hands of the wicked, not into their deceits, for their deceit is more dangerous than their malice.

verses.latin: Quoniam omnis caro sicut foenum, et gloria ejus quasi flos agri.
verses.english: Every human being is like grass, and their glory is like the flowers of the field.

verses.latin: Hic et ille, sicut foenum exarescent, et flos decidit.
verses.english: They wither and fall like grass, and the flower falls from the stem.

verses.latin: Antequam judicetur, ne promitte: et antequam cognoveris, ne responde.
verses.english: Do not make promises before you are judged, and do not speak before you have understood.

verses.latin: Ne respondeas iniquo juxta iniquitatem ejus: et ne similis illi fueris.
verses.english: Do not answer a wicked person according to their wickedness, lest you become like them.

verses.latin: Dic bonis, et bona: et ne reprehenderis super verbis tuis.
verses.english: Speak well to the good, so that you will not be reproached for your words.

verses.latin: Ne dic: Ego attendam in vindictam mali. Et spera in Domino, et ipse adjuvabit te.
verses.english: Do not say, “I will take vengeance on the wicked.” Instead, trust in the Lord, and He will help you.

verses.latin: Misericordiam proximo tuo fac: et memor esto, Dominum timentem.
verses.english: Do good to your neighbor, and remember to fear the Lord.

verses.latin: Memento mortis, et desine iniquitatem. Memor esto mandatorum, et ne intumescas in malitia.
verses.english: Remember your death and cease from wickedness. Remember the commandments, and do not be puffed up in malice.

verses.latin: Qui humiliat se, in sapientia invenietur: et qui deficit, iniquitatem celabit.
verses.english: Whoever humbles themselves will be found wise, and whoever hides evil will conceal iniquity.

verses.latin: Sicut qui tacet, in sapientia honorabitur.
verses.english: Whoever is silent will be honored with wisdom.

verses.latin: Aurum et argentum probat ignis: et homines probantur in fornace humiliationis.
verses.english: Fire tests gold and silver, and people are tested in the furnace of humility.

verses.latin: Credite Deo, et adjuvabit vos: dirigite viam vestram, et sperate in eum.
verses.english: Trust in God, and He will help you; direct your way and hope in Him.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, nihil trepidabit, et non pavebit: quoniam ipse est spes illius.
verses.english: Whoever fears God will not tremble or be afraid, because God is their hope.

verses.latin: Beatus anima quae timet Deum.
verses.english: Blessed is the soul that fears God.

verses.latin: Timorem Dei quaerens, obtinebit prudentiam: et qui respicit illum, inveniet benedictionem.
verses.english: Whoever seeks the fear of God will obtain prudence, and whoever looks to Him will find a blessing.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, bene erit ei in extremis, et in die consummationis benedicetur.
verses.english: Whoever fears God will be blessed in the end, and will be blessed on the day of their death.

verses.latin: Principium timoris Dei, est electio Dei: et cum sanctis justificabitur.
verses.english: The beginning of the fear of God is the choice of God, and through that, they will be justified with the saints.

verses.latin: Qui timuerit Deum, honorem accipiet: et honorabitur in conspectu hominum, et in conspectu ipsius Dei.
verses.english: Whoever fears God will receive honor; they will be honored in the sight of men and in the sight of God Himself.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, in voluntate illius permanebit: et in patientia illius, quasi mater.
verses.english: Whoever fears God will persevere in His will and, with patience, will be like a mother.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, diliget eum: et qui diligit illum, clarificabitur.
verses.english: Whoever fears God loves Him, and whoever loves Him will be glorified.

verses.latin: Spiritus timorem Dei, creavit omnia: et omnia creata sunt in timorem.
verses.english: The Spirit of the fear of God created all things, and all things were created for the sake of fear.

verses.latin: Beatus qui timet Deum, et qui tenet vias ejus.
verses.english: Blessed is the one who fears God and keeps His ways.

verses.latin: Quoniam Deus, intuens eos, qui timent eum, benedicet illis.
verses.english: Because God, looking upon those who fear Him, will bless them.

verses.latin: Animam qui timet Deum, benedicet, et visitabit: et in die consummationis suscipiet illum.
verses.english: God will bless and visit the soul that fears Him and will receive it on the day of its death.

verses.latin: Timor Dei, initium est dilectionis illius: fides autem, initium est adhaesionis illius.
verses.english: The fear of God is the beginning of His love, and faith is the beginning of clinging to Him.

verses.latin: Disciplinam et custodiam, et patientiam, in se habent: et qui non habent illas, derelinquuntur.
verses.english: They hold discipline, protection, and patience within themselves, and those who do not have these are forsaken.

verses.latin: Peccatorum vita brevis: et impii cito tollentur.
verses.english: The life of sinners is short, and the wicked will quickly be taken away.

verses.latin: Qui contristatur, festinat malum: et qui laetus est corde, festinat mala.
verses.english: Whoever is afflicted hastens to evil, and whoever is joyful in heart hastens to evil.

verses.latin: Abominationes sunt cordis, et conturbationes, et irae viri injusti.
verses.english: The abominations of the heart, the unrest, and the anger of a wicked man are all abominations.

verses.latin: Vir justus sustinebit: usque ad tempus; et erit illi gaudium in novissimo.
verses.english: A just man endures until the appointed time, and at the end, he will have joy.

verses.latin: Bonus vir dissimulabit mala: et inimicus odiorum deteget semitas illius.
verses.english: A good man hides evil, and the enemy of the hateful will uncover his ways.

verses.latin: In sensu viri prudentis, cognoscuntur sapientiae verba: et justus suscipiet ea.
verses.english: In the understanding of a prudent man, the words of wisdom are known, and the righteous will receive them.

verses.latin: Sapientiae verba, sunt sicut flumina aquarum: justitiae fons perennis.
verses.english: The words of wisdom are like rivers of water; the source of justice is everlasting.

verses.latin: Stultus, quasi navigans maris fluctibus, non capit gubernationem.
verses.english: A fool, like a ship tossed about by the waves, does not know how to steer.

verses.latin: Sapiens, quasi bonus gubernator, timorem Domini meditatur: et dirigit gressus suos, et in lege illius semper est.
verses.english: The wise man, like a good helmsman, meditates on the fear of the Lord, directs his steps, and is always in His law.

verses.latin: Omnis homo super terram, a sua conditione, ut homo factus est.
verses.english: Every human being upon the earth is as they were created, just a human.

verses.latin: Qui dat operam legi Altissimi, acquiret illam, et qui operatur in illis, glorificabitur.
verses.english: Those who are studious of the law of the Most High will acquire it, and those who act by it will be glorified.

verses.latin: Qui docentur in illa, inveniant quid respondeant: et qui agunt in illa, invenient, ut respondeant.
verses.english: Those who are taught by the law will find something to respond with; those who act by it will find the words they need to respond.

verses.latin: Qui diligit illam, diligit vitam: et qui mane surgunt ad illam, replebuntur gaudio.
verses.english: Those who love the law love life, and those who rise early to learn it will be filled with joy.

verses.latin: Qui tenuerit illam, hereditabit illam: et quicumque transierit per illam, hereditabit vitam.
verses.english: Those who hold fast to the law will inherit it; whoever passes through it will inherit eternal life.

verses.latin: Qui convertuntur ad illam, habitabunt in ea: et qui diligunt illam, ambulabunt in viis ejus.
verses.english: Those who turn toward the law will dwell in it, and those who love it will walk in its ways.

verses.latin: Qui credunt illi, hereditabunt illam: et qui confidunt in illo, possidebunt illam.
verses.english: Those who believe in the law will inherit it; those who trust in it will possess it.

verses.latin: Nam initio iniquitatis, separatus est ab eo: qui recedit a Deo, detestabitur illam.
verses.english: Evil begins when you are separated from the law; those who withdraw from God will hate it.

verses.latin: Filiorum impiorum cogitationes, tanquam ventus: et tanquam navis, quae per transitum fluctuum.
verses.english: The thoughts of wicked people are like the wind or like a ship passing through waves.

verses.latin: Quasi iter navis per aquas, pertransiens, cujus non invenitur vestigium, nec semita carinae ejus in undis:
verses.english: Like a ship's path through water, they pass by, and their path is not found, nor is there any sign of their passing in the waves.

verses.latin: sic et impius, cum mortuus fuerit, non invenietur: quoniam in nihilum commutatus est, et tanquam pulvis dissipatus est.
verses.english: So too, the wicked person will not be found when they die. They will be turned to nothing and scattered like dust.

verses.latin: Memoria illius exterminata est, et transibit vita ejus tanquam vestigium nubis, et tanquam nebula fugata a radiis solis.
verses.english: Their memory is erased, and their life passes like a cloud, like a mist scattered by the sun.

verses.latin: Qui relinquunt illam, et non cognoscunt eam, incidunt in malum: et qui tenent illam, diliguntur a Deo.
verses.english: Those who abandon the law and do not know it fall into evil; those who hold to it are loved by God.

verses.latin: Sapientia, tanquam mater, obviavit illis, et sicut uxor juvenis suscepit illos.
verses.english: Wisdom meets them like a mother, and receives them like a young wife.

verses.latin: Cibavit illos pane intellectus, et potavit illos aquis sapientiae.
verses.english: Wisdom feeds them with the bread of understanding and gives them to drink from the waters of wisdom.

verses.latin: Fundavit super illos et firmavit, et non vacillabunt: et confirmavit illos.
verses.english: Wisdom establishes and strengthens them, so they will not be shaken. It confirms them.

verses.latin: Deinde probavit illos: et invenit eos dignos sui.
verses.english: Then Wisdom tests them and finds them worthy.

verses.latin: In auro quasi ignis, probavit eos: et in vasis tentationis, examinavit illos.
verses.english: Like fire refining gold, Wisdom tests them, and examines them in the vessel of temptation.

verses.latin: Usque in tempus, statuentur, et tanquam aurum in fornace probabuntur.
verses.english: Until a set time, they will be established and proven like gold in a furnace.

verses.latin: In tempore visitationis eorum splendescent, et tanquam scintillae in arundineto current.
verses.english: In the time of their visitation, they will shine and will run like sparks through the reeds.

verses.latin: Judicabunt gentes, et dominabuntur populis, et regnabit Dominus illorum in aeternum.
verses.english: They will judge the nations and rule the peoples, and the Lord will reign over them forever.

verses.latin: Fili, si accesseris ad servitutem Dei, praepara animam tuam ad tentationem.
verses.english: My son, if you want to serve God, prepare yourself for the trials that come with it.

verses.latin: Cor tuum corrige, et constanter sustine, et ne festines in tempore afflictionis.
verses.english: Keep your heart on the right path, be steady in your faith, and do not be in a hurry when trouble comes.

verses.latin: Adhaere illi, et ne discedas, ut ex extremis augearis.
verses.english: Cling to Him, and do not leave, so that you may grow at the end.

verses.latin: Omne quod tibi applicitum fuerit, suscipe, et in dolore sustine: et in humilitate tua patientiam habe.
verses.english: Accept everything that comes to you, and endure it in sorrow. Be patient in your humility.

verses.latin: Quoniam in igne probatur aurum, et in camino fornacis probantur homines justi.
verses.english: Because gold is tested in fire, and righteous men are tested in the furnace of suffering.

verses.latin: Crede illi, et ipse adjuvabit te: dirige vias tuas, et spera in illum.
verses.english: Trust in Him, and He will help you. Make straight your ways, and hope in Him.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, nihil trepidabit, neque pavebit: quoniam ipse est spes ejus.
verses.english: He who fears God will not tremble or be afraid, because God is his hope.

verses.latin: Beatus animae illius, quae timuit Deum.
verses.english: Blessed is the soul of the one who fears God.

verses.latin: De timore enim Dei, haec omnia: et cui adhaeserit, cum quo glorificabitur?
verses.english: All of this comes from fearing God. And who clings to it, with whom will he be glorified?

verses.latin: Timorem Dei, et custodiam mandatorum, omnis caro eliget.
verses.english: All flesh will choose the fear of God and the keeping of the commandments.

verses.latin: Mandata Domini, mandata honesta, et laetificantia cor: et illuminantia oculos.
verses.english: The Lord's commandments are good, and they make the heart rejoice, and they enlighten the eyes.

verses.latin: Timor Domini, sanctificatio cordis, et dat jucunditatem et laetitiam et longam vitam.
verses.english: The fear of the Lord sanctifies the heart, and gives joy, and gladness, and a long life.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, bene erit in extremis, et in die consummationis benedicetur.
verses.english: He who fears God will be well in the end, and will be blessed on the day of his death.

verses.latin: Initium timoris Dei, est timere Deum: et cum fide confirmatus est, magnificabitur in gloria.
verses.english: The beginning of the fear of God is to fear God. And when it is established in faith, he will be magnified in glory.

verses.latin: A timore Dei, declinabit omnis iniquitas.
verses.english: From the fear of God, all iniquity will depart.

verses.latin: Qui non timet Deum, non poterit justificari: iracundia enim cordis illius, subvertet illum.
verses.english: He who does not fear God cannot be justified, for the wrath of his heart will destroy him.

verses.latin: Patientia in tempore, consolabitur: et iterum gaudium, germinabit illi.
verses.english: Patience in time will console you, and again will bring joy to him.

verses.latin: Cogitationes ejus, quasi vasorum figuli: in tempore, visitabit illos.
verses.english: His thoughts are like the vessels of a potter. In due time, He will visit them.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, nihil unquam contristabitur.
verses.english: He who fears God will never be sad.

verses.latin: Sperans in Deum, non confundetur.
verses.english: He who hopes in God will not be ashamed.

verses.latin: Bonus animus in paupertate, melior est quam aurum.
verses.english: A good spirit in poverty is better than gold.

verses.latin: Melius est habitare cum homine stulto, quam habitare cum muliere litigiosa.
verses.english: It is better to live with a foolish man, than to live with a quarrelsome woman.

verses.latin: Voluntatem suam facit impius in diebus suis: verum electus, sustinebit usque in finem.
verses.english: The impious man does his own will in his days, but the chosen one will endure until the end.

verses.latin: Cor prudens, sciet tempus et judicium: et in rebus peccatorum, et in delictis.
verses.english: A prudent heart will know the time and judgment. Both in the matters of sinners and in their faults.

verses.latin: Ab impio elongabitur omnis via, et justus novit viam.
verses.english: Every way will be far from the wicked, but the just man knows the way.

verses.latin: Qui diligit judicium, diliget vitam: et qui odium habet correptionem, stultus est.
verses.english: He who loves justice, loves life, and he who hates reproof is foolish.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, faciet bona: et qui continet justitiam, adquiret illam.
verses.english: The one who reveres God will do good things, and the one who holds fast to what is right will obtain goodness.

verses.latin: Qui cognoscit illam, pariter et custodit: et qui diligit illam, vivet.
verses.english: The one who knows goodness keeps it safe. And the one who loves goodness will have life.

verses.latin: Qui tenet illam, hereditabit illam: et qui se defendit ab ea, peribit.
verses.english: The one who holds fast to goodness will inherit it, and the one who rejects goodness will perish.

verses.latin: Initium sapientiae timor Domini: et cum fidelibus in vulva conposita est.
verses.english: Reverence for the Lord is the beginning of wisdom, and it is made firm with the faithful in their mother's womb.

verses.latin: Cum hominibus autem firmat fidem, et cum electis et iustis conparabitur.
verses.english: Wisdom strengthens faith with all people, and the good will be compared with the elect and the righteous.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, habebit bonum: et sicut bonus fructus, ita spes illius.
verses.english: The one who reveres God will have what is good, and his hope is like good fruit.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, bene aget, et sicut opera illius, ita conparabuntur illi.
verses.english: The one who reveres God will do well, and his deeds will be compared with his state.

verses.latin: Vindictam Deus faciet timentibus se: et in conspectu eius visitabit illos.
verses.english: God will bring justice to those who revere Him, and He will visit them in His sight.

verses.latin: Qui timuerit Dominum, parabit cor suum, et in conspectu illius sanctificabit animam suam.
verses.english: The one who reveres the Lord prepares his heart and sanctifies his soul in His sight.

verses.latin: Qui timet Dominum, custodit mandata eius: et patientiam habebit usque ad visionem illius.
verses.english: The one who reveres the Lord keeps His commandments and will have patience until He is seen.

verses.latin: Dicens: Si non credideris, vade a me: et qui gloriatur in eo, conpactum est illi.
verses.english: Saying, "If you do not believe, go away from Me." And for the one who boasts in Him, it is made clear to him.

verses.latin: Qui timet Dominum, timet amicitiam: quoniam qualis est, talis et proximus eius.
verses.english: The one who reveres the Lord reveres friendship, because the friend is like him.

verses.latin: Fili, ex tota anima tua time Deum, et diliges sacerdotes eius.
verses.english: Son, revere God with all your soul, and love His priests.

verses.latin: Ex tota virtute tua diliges eum, et non derelinques ministros eius.
verses.english: Love Him with all your strength, and do not abandon His ministers.

verses.latin: Timorem Dei quaere, et in iustitia vivens: et obtinebis ea, et coronaberis in die visitationis.
verses.english: Seek the reverence of God and live in righteousness, and you will obtain it, and be crowned on the day of His visitation.

verses.latin: Omnis qui timet Deum, sperat in illum: et qui tenent eum, non derelinquetur.
verses.english: Everyone who reveres God hopes in Him, and the one who holds to Him will not be forsaken.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, nihil pavebit: et non metuet, quoniam ipse est spes eius.
verses.english: The one who reveres God will fear nothing, and he will not be afraid, for He is his hope.

verses.latin: Beatus animae quae timet Deum.
verses.english: Blessed is the soul that reveres God.

verses.latin: Cui enim? et cuius est gloria? et quis est gloriosus? qui timens Deum.
verses.english: For to whom? And whose is the glory? And who is glorious? The one who reveres God.

verses.latin: Timor Domini, initium est dilectionis eius: fides autem est initium adhaesionis illius.
verses.english: Reverence for the Lord is the beginning of His love, and faith is the beginning of adhering to Him.

verses.latin: Contritionem cordis et humilitatem exquirite, et in die tribulationis propitius erit vobis.
verses.english: Seek contrition of heart and humility, and He will be merciful to you in the day of tribulation.

verses.latin: Qui timet Dominum, faciet bona, et qui continet justitiam, exaudiet orationes suas.
verses.english: The one who reveres the Lord will do good things, and the one who holds fast to what is right will hear his prayers.

verses.latin: Sicut aquae extinguunt ignem, ita eleemosyna exstinguit peccatum.
verses.english: Just as water extinguishes fire, so almsgiving extinguishes sin.

verses.latin: Misericors faciet propitiationem pro peccatis.
verses.english: The merciful will make atonement for sins.

verses.latin: Ne timeas mori pro veritate, et Deus proeliabitur pro te.
verses.english: Do not be afraid to die for the truth, and God will fight for you.

verses.latin: Noli esse velox in lingua tua: et in operibus tuis negligens et remissus.
verses.english: Do not be quick with your tongue, and do not be negligent and careless in your works.

verses.latin: Noli esse quasi leo in domo tua, subvertens domesticos tuos: et terrens eos.
verses.english: Do not be like a lion in your house, overturning your household and terrifying them.

verses.latin: Non extendatur manus tua ad accipiendum, et ad dandum contrahe eam.
verses.english: Do not let your hand be extended to receive, and contract it when giving.

verses.latin: Domine, Pater et dominator vitae meae, ne derelinquas me in consilio eorum.
verses.english: Lord, Father, and Master of my life, don't let me be corrupted by the plans of other men.

verses.latin: Superbiam oculorum et desiderium ne dederis mihi, et a concupiscentia averte faciem meam.
verses.english: Don't give me the pride of life in my eyes, and don't let my desires control me. Turn my face away from worldly desires.

verses.latin: A concupiscentia ventris et voluptatis non me tradas, et ne concupiscentia linguae comprehendat me.
verses.english: Don't let me be consumed by the lusts of the flesh, the pleasures of the world, or the desires of the tongue.

verses.latin: Et flagitium et mendacium longe fac a me, et mendicitatem da mihi nec divitias: tribue mihi necessaria, ne forte abundans impius existam.
verses.english: Keep evil far from me. Protect me from lies. Give me neither poverty nor wealth: give me only the necessities, lest, if I have too much, I become a wicked man.

verses.latin: Ne forte satiatus obliviscar te, et dicam: Quis est Dominus? aut egestate coactus furer, et periurem nomen Dei mei.
verses.english: If I am full, I may forget you and say, "Who is the Lord?" Or, if I am forced by poverty, I may steal and ruin the name of my God.

verses.latin: Non deteges servo domino facta nequiter, quia scit.
verses.english: Don’t reveal the crimes of a servant to his master, because the servant is aware of his own crimes.

verses.latin: Quoniam ergo servus malus odit dominum suum, et odium in eo est.
verses.english: Because a wicked servant hates his master, and this hatred is within him.

verses.latin: Malo, et bono: et mala adorem, et bona non odi.
verses.english: I would rather be the servant of a good master than a bad master, and I should not hate what is good.

verses.latin: Ab adolescentia mea didici: et usque nunc quaero veritatem.
verses.english: From my youth I have learned, and even now I seek truth.

verses.latin: Per eam perveni usque ad consummationem, et cor meum in ea delectabitur.
verses.english: I have reached the fulfillment through truth, and my heart takes delight in it.

verses.latin: A parvulo coepi eam quaerere, et in manifestatione inveni illam.
verses.english: I sought truth from the beginning, and I have found it through its manifestation.

verses.latin: In labore quaesivi eam, et in operibus meis operatus sum pro ea.
verses.english: I have sought truth through labor, and in my works I have acted in accordance with it.

verses.latin: Manus mea elaboravit in ea, et vidi multa bona per eam.
verses.english: My hands labored for truth, and I have seen many good things through it.

verses.latin: Lingua mea confessa est illam, et gloria ipsius erat.
verses.english: My tongue has confessed the truth, and the glory of the truth is that it is manifest.

verses.latin: Ego adulescens adhuc, antequam migrarem, quaesivi illam in palam.
verses.english: I am still young, and before I depart this life, I have sought truth openly.

verses.latin: Et adhuc quaero eam, et non lassabor, donec inveniam eam.
verses.english: I continue to seek truth, and I will not tire until I find it.

verses.latin: Contristatus est cor meum in eo, et in conturbatione mea studui.
verses.english: My heart has been saddened, and in my confusion I have studied it.

verses.latin: Et aperui manum meam, et percussa est eam, quia operatus sum in bonis.
verses.english: I have opened my hand to truth, and I have been blessed by it, because I have acted in accordance with it.

verses.latin: Animam meam in ea disposui, et in scientia servavi illam.
verses.english: I have laid down my soul in truth, and I have guarded it with knowledge.

verses.latin: Accepi cum ea cordis pacem, et in ea conversatus sum.
verses.english: I received peace of heart with truth, and I have lived with it.

verses.latin: Exaltavit me Dominus, et propter hoc glorificabo illam.
verses.english: The Lord has exalted me, and because of this I will glorify truth.

verses.latin: Post meam conturbationem reddidit mihi retributionem bonam.
verses.english: After my confusion, truth has given me a good reward.

verses.latin: Et adpropinquavit mihi cor meum: et ego operatus sum in bonis.
verses.english: My heart has drawn near to truth: and I have acted in accordance with it.

verses.latin: Reddat mihi Deus mercedem meam.
verses.english: May God give me my reward.

verses.latin: Date, et accipietis.
verses.english: Give, and you will receive.

verses.latin: Diligite proximum vestrum, et nolite confidere in inimicum.
verses.english: Love your neighbor, and do not trust your enemy.

verses.latin: Sapientia Domini exaltaverit humilem, et de malis liberabit gentes.
verses.english: The wisdom of God raises up those who are humble, and delivers them from the evils of the world.

verses.latin: Firmata est mihi cor meum in Domino, et honorifice locuta sum in conspectu illius.
verses.english: My heart is made firm in the Lord, and I speak with honor in His presence.

verses.latin: Magna opera Domini: exquirenda in omnes voluntates ejus.
verses.english: Great are the works of the Lord, all of which are sought after by those who love Him.

verses.latin: Qui diligit Deum, diliget illum; et qui diligunt illum, requirent voluntates illius.
verses.english: Those who love God will love Him; and those who love Him will seek His will.

verses.latin: Qui credit in illum, haereditabit vitam, et justi possidebunt illam.
verses.english: He who believes in Him will inherit life, and the just will possess it.

verses.latin: Parate vobis cor, et cogitate vias illius.
verses.english: Prepare your heart, and consider His ways.

verses.latin: Qui enim operatur ea, in via illius salvabitur.
verses.english: For those who do His works, will be saved.

verses.latin: Qui diligit Dominum, diliget filium, et quicumque obedit illi, diliget eum.
verses.english: He who loves the Lord loves His Son, and whoever obeys Him will love Him.

verses.latin: Super hoc visitabo omnes gentes, et unicuique sicut opera sua.
verses.english: For this, I will visit all nations, and each one according to his works.

verses.latin: Sicut enim mandavit mihi facere, et sicut locutus est, ita et factum est.
verses.english: For as He commanded me to do, so it has been done.

verses.latin: Veniens ego, quasi fluvius de fluvio, et quasi magna aqua prope mare.
verses.english: I came forth like a river from a river, and like a great wave near the sea.

verses.latin: Adhuc ergo effundam doctrinam quasi profluentem aquam, et revelabo illam sicut speculum, et quasi imago.
verses.english: Therefore, I will still pour out doctrine like flowing water, and I will reveal it like a mirror, and like an image.

verses.latin: Dicam: Docebo adhuc doctrinam sicut mane, et illuminabo eam usque ad lucem.
verses.english: I will say: I will teach doctrine still in the morning, and I will illuminate it until the light.

verses.latin: Fuso sicut propugnaculum aquae, doctrinam quasi prophetiam, et testamento aeterno.
verses.english: I will pour out doctrine like a fortification of water, like prophecy, and like an eternal testament.

verses.latin: Videbunt adhuc gentes, et scient quoniam qui indiget Deo, non est deficiens.
verses.english: The gentiles will see still and they will know that those who are in need of God will not be lacking.

verses.latin: Dominus magnus, et excelsus, et in aeternum virtus illius.
verses.english: The Lord is great, and exalted, and His power is forever.

verses.latin: Non est mirabilis operari in operibus suis, et quis investigabit opera illius?
verses.english: It is not amazing to work in His works, and who will investigate His works?

verses.latin: Quis enarrabit fortitudinem gloriae illius, et quis audebit loqui opera ejus mirabilia?
verses.english: Who will recount the strength of His glory, and who will dare to speak of His marvelous works?

verses.latin: Sapientia, omnia ista praecedens: et cujus intellectus est a saeculo.
verses.english: Wisdom precedes all of these things and His understanding is from eternity.

verses.latin: Radix sapientiae cui revelata est? et prudentiam ejus quis agnovit?
verses.english: The root of wisdom—to whom has it been revealed? And who has known His prudence?

verses.latin: Unus est altissimus creator omnipotens, rex potens, et timendus valde, sedens super thronum ejus, et dominans.
verses.english: There is only one Most High, the omnipotent Creator, the powerful king, and greatly feared, who sits upon His throne, and reigns.

verses.latin: Creator, qui creavit illam in spiritu sancto, et vidit illam, et dinumeravit, et mensus est illam.
verses.english: The Creator created her in the Holy Spirit, and saw her, and numbered, and measured her.

verses.latin: Et effudit illam super omnia opera sua, et super omnem carnem secundum donum suum, et praecipue super eos qui diligunt illum.
verses.english: And He poured her out over all His works, and over all flesh according to His gift, and especially over those who love Him.

verses.latin: Timor Domini, gloria, et gloriatio, et laetitia, et corona exultationis. Timor Domini, delectat cor, et dat laetitiam, et gaudium, et longitudo dierum.
verses.english: The fear of the Lord is glory, and boasting, and joy, and the crown of exultation. The fear of the Lord delights the heart, and gives joy, and gladness, and length of days.

verses.latin: Timienti Deum bene erit in extremis, et in die defunctionis suae benedicetur.
verses.english: It is good for those who fear God, both in the end times, and in the day of their death they will be blessed.

verses.latin: Initium timoris Dei, electio sapientiae: et cum sanctis fidelibus generabitur cum timore.
verses.english: The beginning of the fear of God is the election of wisdom and with the holy faithful it will be born with fear.

verses.latin: Timor Dei, plenitudo sapientiae: et replevit fructus suos.
verses.english: The fear of God is the fullness of wisdom, and fills its fruits.

verses.latin: Omnem domum illius implebit a bonis, et thesauri ejus fructibus.
verses.english: It will fill His entire house with good things, and His treasures with fruits.

verses.latin: Corona sapientiae, timor Domini: implens pacem et salutis fructum.
verses.english: The crown of wisdom is the fear of the Lord; filling peace and the fruit of salvation.

verses.latin: Utrumque misit Deus, scientiam et intellectum gloriae: et exaltavit gloriam eorum qui tenent illam.
verses.english: Both God sent, knowledge and understanding of glory, and exalts the glory of those who hold to it.

verses.latin: Radix sapientiae, timere Deum: et rami ejus, vita.
verses.english: The root of wisdom is fearing God; and its branches are life.

verses.latin: Thesaurus sapientiae, timere Deum.
verses.english: The treasure of wisdom is fearing God.

verses.latin: Sapientia, et eruditio justitiae: et dilectio sunt custodientes.
verses.english: Wisdom and the discipline of justice, and love, are guardians.

verses.latin: Opera mandatorum ejus, vita, et in fide illius, sicut lux.
verses.english: The works of His commandments are life, and in His faith, like light.

verses.latin: Non est mendacium in eo: sed fides ejus permanet in aeternum.
verses.english: There is no lie in it, but its faith remains forever.

verses.latin: Mendacium et vana, stulti homines: sapientia autem, quasi flumen in plenitudine, prudentibus, et manet sicut testamentum in illis.
verses.english: Lies and vanity are for foolish men; but wisdom, like a river in its fullness, is for the prudent, and remains like a testament in them.

verses.latin: Non crediderunt gentes in illam: et non cognoverunt vias ejus, nec audierunt illam.
verses.english: The gentiles did not believe in it, and did not know its ways, nor did they hear it.

verses.latin: Sed illi qui timent Deum, agnoverunt illam.
verses.english: But they who fear God have known it.

verses.latin: Quoniam illa est vita, et in timore Domini posita.
verses.english: For that is life, and is found in the fear of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et initium illius, est placere Deo, et dilectio illius, est custodia legum illius.
verses.english: And its beginning is to please God, and its love is the keeping of His laws.

verses.latin: Disciplina mandatorum illius, est dilectio vitae: et opera illius, dilectio.
verses.english: The discipline of His commandments is the love of life: and His works are love.

verses.latin: Ut faciamus per quae exultemus, et cum timore illius ambulemus, et in viis ejus ambularemus.
verses.english: So that we may rejoice in the things that we do, and walk with fear of Him, and walk in His ways.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, faciet bona, et qui continet iustitiam, apprehendet eam, et ex illa, sicut vas, implebitur.
verses.english: The person who has reverence for God will do good things, and anyone who clings to justice will grasp it, and it will fill them completely like a vessel.

verses.latin: Et occurret illi quasi mater filios, suscipiens eum, et quasi uxor virum virginem.
verses.english: And it will greet them like a mother greets her children, embracing them as a wife embraces her husband.

verses.latin: Cibabit illum pane vitae et intellectus, et aqua sapientiae salutaris potabit illum.
verses.english: It will feed them with the bread of life and understanding, and will give them to drink of the life-giving water of wisdom.

verses.latin: Firmabitur in illo, et non movebitur, et confidet in illo, et non confundetur.
verses.english: They will be strengthened by justice and will not be shaken, they will trust in it, and they will not be humiliated.

verses.latin: Et exaltabit illum super proximum suum, et in medio ecclesiae aperiet os illius.
verses.english: It will exalt them above their neighbor, and in the midst of the assembly, it will open their mouth.

verses.latin: Gaudium et corona et honor illi dabit sempiternus.
verses.english: Joy, a crown, and honor will be given to them forever.

verses.latin: Impii autem non suscipient sapientiam, nec manebunt in ea, et non poterunt sustinere eam.
verses.english: But the wicked will not receive wisdom, nor will they remain in it, and they will not be able to grasp it.

verses.latin: Sicut enim lapis, probatio illis: et super lapidem scandalizabuntur, et reprobabit illos.
verses.english: For they are like a stone, a test to them: and they will stumble over that stone, and it will cast them away.

verses.latin: Sapientia enim quasi nomen est illis; et non cognoverunt eam.
verses.english: For wisdom is like a name to them; and they have not known it.

verses.latin: Melius est enim non cognoscere sapientiam, quam cognoscentem eam, et non agnoscere virtutem illius.
verses.english: For it is better not to know wisdom than to know it and not to recognize its power.

verses.latin: Melius est enim nesciens eam ambulare in via, quam et scire, et a via declinare.
verses.english: For it is better for a person who does not know wisdom to walk along the road, than to know it and turn away from the road.

verses.latin: Quid est enim iniquitas, nisi peccatorum mors? aut quid est malum, nisi vitare Deum?
verses.english: What is iniquity, except the death of sinners? Or what is evil, but to turn away from God?

verses.latin: Quae est enim super terram creatura melior homine? aut quae est in homine sensus major?
verses.english: For what creature on earth is better than a human being? Or what is a greater sense within a human being?

verses.latin: Omnis caro sicut vestimentum vetustabit: dies enim saeculi, dies boni.
verses.english: All flesh grows old like a garment: for the days of the world are the days of the good.

verses.latin: Sicut folia in flore verni: alii cadunt, alii proveniunt. Sic et generationes carnis et sanguinis, una moritur, et alia nascitur.
verses.english: Like leaves in the springtime: some fall, others come forth. So also generations of flesh and blood, one dies, and another is born.

verses.latin: Omne opus corruptibile finem habebit, et qui operatur illud, cum illo ibit.
verses.english: Every corruptible work will have an end, and the person who does that work will go with it.

verses.latin: Bonum est enim super omnia diligere Deum: qui enim diligit illum, et vitam habebit.
verses.english: For it is good above all things to love God: for whoever loves Him will have life.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, respiciet ad omnia, et in patientia manebit.
verses.english: Whoever fears God will consider all things, and will remain in patience.

verses.latin: Omnis tentatio et tribulatio veniet super illum.
verses.english: Every temptation and tribulation will come upon them.

verses.latin: Et qui Deum timet, conservabit mandata, et diriget cordis sui vias.
verses.english: And whoever fears God will keep the commandments, and will direct the paths of their heart.

verses.latin: In verbo suo credet, et in eo sicut in patre confidet.
verses.english: They will believe in his word, and will trust in him as in a father.

verses.latin: Omnis timor Domini timor est, et in omni iustificatione est sapientia.
verses.english: All fear of the Lord is fear, and in all justice there is wisdom.

verses.latin: Qui autem non timet Deum, non potest iustificari, quoniam ira illius conturbatio illius.
verses.english: But the one who does not fear God cannot be justified, because his wrath is his disturbance.

verses.latin: Omnis misericordia faciet locum unicuique secundum merita operum suorum.
verses.english: All mercy will make a place for each person according to the merits of their works.

verses.latin: Qui offert sacrificium ex iniquo, maculat sacrificium: et munera iniustorum non probantur.
verses.english: The person who offers a sacrifice from iniquity, defiles the sacrifice: and the gifts of the unjust are not approved.

verses.latin: Non respiciet Altissimus dona impiorum, nec in multitudine sacrificiorum eorum propitiabitur pro peccatis.
verses.english: The Most High does not look at the gifts of the wicked, nor will He be propitiated for sins in the multitude of their sacrifices.

verses.latin: Qui offert sacrificium ex pauperum substantia, quasi qui victimat filium in conspectu patris sui.
verses.english: The person who offers a sacrifice from the substance of the poor is like one who slaughters a son in the sight of his father.

verses.latin: Panis egenorum, vita pauperum est: qui defraudat illum, homo sanguinis est.
verses.english: The bread of the needy is the life of the poor: the one who defrauds them is a person of blood.

verses.latin: Qui aufert vicini sui vitam, occidit eum: et qui fraudem operatur mercennario, sanguinis est.
verses.english: The one who takes away the life of their neighbor kills them: and the one who defrauds a hired worker is a person of blood.

verses.latin: Cum aedificat, et ille destruit: et cum plantat, ille eradicat.
verses.english: The wicked build and then destroy: and when they plant, they uproot.

verses.latin: Qui dat, et qui accipit, respiciunt in laborem eorum.
verses.english: The giver and the receiver look upon their labor.

verses.latin: Qui jejunat, et non implet, quid prodest illi humilitas sua?
verses.english: What is the use of humility to the one who fasts and does not fulfill the commands of God?

verses.latin: Qui non implet praecepta, quid prodest illi, si orat?
verses.english: What is the use if the person prays and does not keep the commandments?

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, faciet bona: et qui continens est in justitia, comprehendet eam, et effundetur quasi lux.
verses.english: Whoever reveres God will do good deeds. And the one who endures in justice will understand it and be enlightened like light.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, habebit bona, et sicut incensum acceptum, odorem bonum.
verses.english: Whoever reveres God will have good things and a good reputation, just like pleasing incense.

verses.latin: Qui Deum timet, bene habebit, et, quasi mater, honorabitur parentes.
verses.english: Whoever reveres God will be well-regarded and will honor his parents, like a mother.

verses.latin: In timore Domini vita ejus: et in spe illius non transibit.
verses.english: In reverence of God is his life and hope, and it will never pass away.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, non timebit, neque pavebit: quoniam ipse est spes ejus.
verses.english: Whoever reveres God will have no fear, nor will he be afraid, because He is his hope.

verses.latin: Beatus animae quae timet Deum.
verses.english: Blessed is the soul of the one who reveres God.

verses.latin: Quoniam in visitatione Dei salvabitur.
verses.english: For in the visitation of God, he will be saved.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, sperat in illum, et justi, et in spe ejus non deficiet.
verses.english: Whoever reveres God hopes in Him, and the just will not be lacking in His hope.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, odit peccata, et qui operatur injustitiam, expiabit pro peccatis.
verses.english: Whoever reveres God hates sins, and the one who commits injustice will atone for his sins.

verses.latin: Vir impius non permanet in voluntatibus suis.
verses.english: A wicked man does not persevere in his wicked desires.

verses.latin: Quia odibilis est illi Deus: et iniquitas illi non est abscondita.
verses.english: Because God finds wickedness hateful, wickedness will not be hidden from Him.

verses.latin: Justus autem faciet opera bona, et implebit mandata Domini.
verses.english: But a just man will do good works and will fulfill the commandments of God.

verses.latin: Et cognoscet quod Deus ejus est, et in consilio illius permanebit, et in timore illius.
verses.english: And he will know that God is his, and he will remain in His counsel and reverence.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, praeparat cor suum, et in conspectu illius humiliavit animam suam.
verses.english: Whoever reveres God prepares his heart and humbles his soul in the sight of God.

verses.latin: In manus Dei cademus, et non in manus hominum.
verses.english: We fall into the hands of God and not into the hands of men.

verses.latin: Secundum enim magnitudinem ipsius et misericordia ejus: quia sicut est magnificatus, ita et misericordia ejus.
verses.english: For according to His greatness is also His mercy; because as He is magnified, so also is His mercy.

verses.latin: Non omnia hominibus: sed in rebus misericordia Dei.
verses.english: Not everything belongs to men, but the mercy of God belongs to all things.

verses.latin: Bonum est quod datur misericordia in tempore tribulationis, quasi nubes pluviae in tempore siccitatis.
verses.english: It is good to show mercy in the time of tribulation, like clouds of rain in the time of drought.

verses.latin: Qui dat, offerens in justitia, memor erit sacrificii ejus, et florebit gloria illius.
verses.english: He who gives, offering in justice, will remember his sacrifice, and his glory will flourish.

verses.latin: Non est enim melius munus quam misericordia, et eleemosyna.
verses.english: For there is no better offering than mercy and almsgiving.

verses.latin: Misericordia et eleemosyna, relaxant peccata.
verses.english: Mercy and almsgiving forgive sins.

verses.latin: Aversabitur ab iniquitate: et propter iniquitatem, avertetur Deus.
verses.english: He will turn away from iniquity, and God will turn away because of iniquity.

verses.latin: Non judicans personam pauperis, et qui in angustiis est, audiet preces.
verses.english: He will not judge the person of the poor, and he will hear the prayers of those in distress.

verses.latin: Cor suum in Deo, praeparabit, et orationes suas, quasi aedificans lapides.
verses.english: He will prepare his heart in God and his prayers as if building with stones.

verses.latin: Stultus sicut faber, qui excidit inutile: ita et qui stultus est, sicut homo qui dispergit.
verses.english: A fool is like a craftsman who cuts useless things, and so too is the one who is foolish like a man who scatters.

verses.latin: Melior est filius qui peccat, et habet sensum, quam filius justorum, et consuetudinem.
verses.english: A son who sins but has sense is better than a son of the just who has custom.

verses.latin: Melior est vir sapiens, et cor sciens, quam vir stultus, et stultus.
verses.english: A wise man and a knowing heart are better than a foolish man and a fool.

verses.latin: Melior est modicus, et habens sensum, quam qui magnitudinem affectat, et indiget.
verses.english: One who is moderate and has sense is better than one who seeks greatness and lacks it.

verses.latin: In omni opere tuo considera novissima tua, et in aeternum non peccabis.
verses.english: In all your work, consider your last things, and you will not sin for eternity.

verses.latin: Noli errare in substantia tua, et noli ire in viis, in quibus peccas.
verses.english: Do not err in your substance, and do not go on the ways in which you sin.

verses.latin: Qui diligit misericordiam, diligit Deum: et qui tenet illam, replebitur.
verses.english: Those who love mercy, love God, and those who hold it, will be filled with grace.

verses.latin: Qui diligit timorem, magnus erit: et qui custodit illum, ut radix erit.
verses.english: Those who love fear, will be great, and those who keep it, will be like the very roots of a tree.

verses.latin: Sapientiae timor est: et gloria in timore illius et spes in illo: et fortitudo in illo.
verses.english: Fear is the beginning of Wisdom: and glory is in the fear of God, and hope and strength is in Him.

verses.latin: Timorem Dei timens, nihil pavebit, et non expavescet: quoniam ipse est spes illius.
verses.english: He who fears God will fear nothing, and will not be afraid, for he is the hope of that person.

verses.latin: Anima timoris Dei beata est, in deliciis ejus, et consolatio illius.
verses.english: The soul of the person who fears God is blessed, with joy and consolation.

verses.latin: Timorem Dei timentis bene erit in novissimo: et in die defunctionis suae benedicetur.
verses.english: He who fears God, it will be well with him at the end: and on the day of his death he will be blessed.

verses.latin: Inimicus timoris Dei, non justificabitur: quoniam zelus illius illi perdet.
verses.english: The enemy of the fear of God, will not be justified: for his zeal will destroy him.

verses.latin: Vir sapiens, in verbis agnoscetur: et sensatus, in operibus suis probabitur.
verses.english: A wise man will be recognized in his words, and a sensible man will be proven in his works.

verses.latin: Opera hominis probabuntur: et sicut ignis probat vas figuli, sic homines justi probantur in tentatione tribulationis.
verses.english: A man's works will be proven, and as a fire tests the potter's vessel, so are just men tested in the trial of tribulation.

verses.latin: Qui credit in Deum, attendit mandatis: et qui confidit in illum, non deficiet.
verses.english: He who believes in God, attends to the commandments: and he who trusts in Him, will not fail.

verses.latin: Qui timet Dominum, nihil timebit: et non pavebit, quoniam ipse est spes ejus.
verses.english: He who fears the Lord will fear nothing, and will not be afraid, for He is his hope.

verses.latin: Beatus animae timoris Dei: cui et cui respicit.
verses.english: Blessed is the soul of the person who fears God, to whom and towards whom he looks.

verses.latin: Timor Dei, initium dilectionis ejus: fides autem illius, in operibus bonis.
verses.english: The fear of God is the beginning of His love, but faith in Him is in good works.

verses.latin: Tota diligere, timere Deum: et custodire mandata ejus.
verses.english: To love Him fully, is to fear God and keep His commandments.

verses.latin: Hic est sensus doctrinae: qui enim viderunt eum, in vita aeterna permanebunt.
verses.english: This is the sense of doctrine: for those who have seen Him, will remain in eternal life.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, praeparabit cor suum: et in conspectu illius sanctificabit animam suam.
verses.english: He who fears God, will prepare his heart, and in His sight will sanctify his soul.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, custodit mandata illius: et qui confidit in illum, exaudietur.
verses.english: He who fears God, keeps His commandments, and he who trusts in Him, will be heard.

verses.latin: Deus enim requirit corda et animas: et in dilectione operatur.
verses.english: For God seeks hearts and souls: and He works in love.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, desiderat placere Deo: et qui diligit illum, implebit leges ejus.
verses.english: He who fears God, desires to please God, and he who loves Him, will fulfill His laws.

verses.latin: Qui timet Dominum, praeparabit cor suum: et humiliabit in conspectu illius animam suam.
verses.english: He who fears the Lord, will prepare his heart, and humble his soul in His sight.

verses.latin: Cadentes in manus hominum, in manus Dei cademus: et secundum misericordiam illius, ita et judicium illius.
verses.english: Falling into the hands of men, we fall into the hands of God: and according to His mercy, so is His judgment.

verses.latin: Loquere coram Domino, et dic: Secundum quod est voluntas tua super me, Domine, et doce me disciplinam tuam.
verses.english: Speak before the Lord, and say: "According to what is Your will for me, Lord, and teach me Your discipline."

verses.latin: Et dirigat oculus meus in mandatis tuis, et da mihi timorem tuum.
verses.english: And direct my eye toward your commandments, and give me your fear.

verses.latin: Ostende mihi quid bonum est, et quid tibi placeat: quoniam bonum est, et custodiam illud.
verses.english: Show me what is good, and what pleases you: for it is good, and I will keep it.

verses.latin: Omne opus quod est, super me inpendis: et in mandatis tuis erudiam.
verses.english: Everything that is, You have put upon me: and I will be instructed in Your commandments.

verses.latin: Quoniam omnis operatio secundum judicium est: et propter hoc, in aeternum, non glorificaberis.
verses.english: For every operation is according to judgment: and because of this, You will not be glorified for eternity.

verses.latin: Et post haec, omnia opera mea viventia: et unusquisque in tempore suo, laudabitur.
verses.english: And after these things, all my works will live: and each in his time will be praised.

verses.latin: Qui vindictam requirit, inveniet a Deo vindictam, et memor erit peccatorum suorum.
verses.english: The one who wants vengeance will find vengeance from God, and the sinner will remember all his sins.

verses.latin: Dimitte proximo tuo nocenti te, et tunc deprecanti tibi peccata solventur.
verses.english: Forgive your neighbor who has wronged you, and when you pray, your sins will be forgiven.

verses.latin: Homo homini iram reservat, et a Deo expetit curationem?
verses.english: Does a man hold anger against another man, and then expect healing from God?

verses.latin: In hominem similem sibi non habet misericordiam, et de peccatis suis deprecatur?
verses.english: Does a man not have mercy on another man, and then pray for his own sins to be forgiven?

verses.latin: Ipse, cum caro sit, iram reservat; et propitiationem pro peccatis suis deprecatur?
verses.english: He himself, being flesh, holds anger; and does he pray for forgiveness for his own sins?

verses.latin: Memor esto novissimorum, et desine inimicari; de corruptione et morte cogita, et permanebis in mandatis.
verses.english: Remember your last days, and stop being angry; think about corruption and death, and you will keep the commandments.

verses.latin: Cogita in praeceptis, et non irasceris proximo tuo.
verses.english: Think about the commandments, and you will not be angry with your neighbor.

verses.latin: Memor esto testamenti Altissimi, et ignosce offensioni.
verses.english: Remember the covenant with the Most High, and forgive the offense.

verses.latin: Abstine a conturbatione, et minues peccata.
verses.english: Avoid provocation, and you will lessen your sins.

verses.latin: Neque inique irascaris proximo, neque aliquid facias in contumeliam illius.
verses.english: Do not be unjustly angry with your neighbor, nor do anything to insult him.

verses.latin: Superbia odibilis est apud Deum et homines, et ex utrisque, qui illam habent, iniquitas.
verses.english: Pride is hateful to God and men, and from both, those who have pride have iniquity.

verses.latin: Gentes, regna, et principatus superborum.
verses.english: Nations, kingdoms, and the rulers are all proud.

verses.latin: De genere hominum genus superbum: et de gentibus gens superba, et superba gens contemnetur.
verses.english: From the race of men comes the proud race: and from the nations, the proud nation, and the proud nation will be despised.

verses.latin: Sicut aquae, quae fluunt, ita et divitiae a superbo: et supergrediuntur supra se.
verses.english: Like flowing waters, so are riches from the proud: and they overflow beyond themselves.

verses.latin: Qui deserit, et qui irascitur, et qui perit: quod autem est, et qui contristatus est.
verses.english: The one who abandons, and the one who is angry, and the one who perishes: but as for what is, and the one who is sad.

verses.latin: Omnia in terra de pulvere, et rex a solo homine.
verses.english: All things on earth are from dust, and the king comes from the same man.

verses.latin: Quis est maior opere, quam qui diligit?
verses.english: Who is greater in his work, than he who loves?

verses.latin: Sapientia et fortitudo, et divitiae, et paupertas, et timor Domini, gloria.
verses.english: Wisdom and strength, and riches, and poverty, and the fear of the Lord are all glory.

verses.latin: Melior est pauper in statu suo, et fortis et sanus in opere, quam dives infirmus corpore.
verses.english: Better is the poor man in his state, and strong and healthy in his work, than the rich man infirm in body.

verses.latin: Sanitas animae super omnem aurum, et corpus fortis super divitias infinitas.
verses.english: The health of the soul is above all gold, and a strong body is above infinite riches.

verses.latin: Non est divitiarum super melius, quam sanitas corporis.
verses.english: There is nothing better than the health of the body, beyond riches.

verses.latin: Non est voluptatis super gaudium cordis: et non est vitae super corpus sanum.
verses.english: There is no pleasure beyond the joy of the heart: and there is no life beyond a healthy body.

verses.latin: Mors, nomen pessimum: super omnia bona, eam optimum.
verses.english: Death is the worst name: above all good things, it is the best.

verses.latin: Non dabit ei beatus vita, neque mortuus respicit, ad viventem operari.
verses.english: A blessed life will not be given to death, nor does the dead look back, to act toward the living.

verses.latin: Sapiens in verbis, in corde firmus est, sicut mons in altitudine constitutus.
verses.english: The wise man is firm in his words, in his heart, like a mountain standing in its height.

verses.latin: Stultus in verbis, quasi navis in mari turbata.
verses.english: A fool in his words, is like a ship tossed about in the sea.

verses.latin: Sapiens tacens, donec tempus est, quasi signa nubium in tempore venti.
verses.english: The wise man is silent, until the time is right, like the signs of clouds in a time of wind.

verses.latin: Homo sapiens tacebit, donec videat tempus: stultus autem et timidus, non observat tempus.
verses.english: The wise man will be silent until he sees the right time: but the fool and the coward do not observe the time.

verses.latin: Qui habet cor, dolet in verbis: et vir prudens tacet usque in tempus.
verses.english: He who has a heart, sorrows in words: and the prudent man is silent until the time.

verses.latin: Sapiens in verbis suis, obumbrabit se, et prudens in corde, delectabitur.
verses.english: The wise man in his words, will cover himself, and the prudent man in his heart, will be delighted.

verses.latin: Qui loquitur in verbo, odibilis erit: et qui sibi audaciam assumit, inveniet odium.
verses.english: He who speaks in word, will be hateful: and he who takes audacity upon himself, will find hatred.

verses.latin: Qui miseretur proximo, praestat illi; et qui dat ei, proficit illi.
verses.english: Whoever helps their neighbor lends to God, and what is given to God profits the giver.

verses.latin: Da pauperi, et non requiraris; et ne avertas faciem tuam a paupere, et Deus a te non avertet faciem suam.
verses.english: Give to the poor, and you shall not be found wanting. Don't turn your back on the poor, and God will not turn His back on you.

verses.latin: Proximo tuo, juxta facultates tuas, fac bonum, et accipe munera.
verses.english: Do good for your neighbor, to the best of your ability, and accept gifts.
