verses.latin: Ne auferas diem hodiernum, et: Crastino non differas.
verses.english: Don't put off until tomorrow what you can do today. Don't delay.

verses.latin: Ne dicas: Crastino quaeram, et quando venerit, dabo; et ignoras quid pariat dies crastinus.
verses.english: Don't say, “I'll seek and give tomorrow.” You do not know what tomorrow will bring.

verses.latin: Peccator enim malum in die mali parat, et justus in die mali liberabitur.
verses.english: The sinner prepares evil for an evil day, but the just will be delivered on the day of misfortune.

verses.latin: Diviti, et potenti, et honorato non contristaberis oculo.
verses.english: Don't look at the rich, the powerful, or the honorable, with envy.

verses.latin: A faciem hominis ne respicias in judicio injuste.
verses.english: Don’t look at anyone's face when judging unjustly.

verses.latin: Proximo tuo malum non cogites, et ne tentes eum fraudulenter.
verses.english: Don’t plot evil against your neighbor, and don’t try to trick him.

verses.latin: Superbum odiunt anima et Deus.
verses.english: God and all good people hate pride.

verses.latin: Utrique detestabilis est iniquitas, et a peccatore utraque vindicabitur.
verses.english: Both injustice and the one who commits it are detestable to God, and both will be punished by the sinner.

verses.latin: Ne revertaris iniquitatem iniquitate, et ne injuriam injuriae respondeas.
verses.english: Don't return evil for evil, and don't answer an insult with an insult.

verses.latin: Ab homine impio fuge, et a malitia.
verses.english: Flee the wicked man and his wickedness.

verses.latin: Justum justifica, et innocentes retine.
verses.english: Uphold the just, and defend the innocent.

verses.latin: Justum pro impio ne condemnes, et impios justifica.
verses.english: Don’t condemn the just along with the wicked, and don’t treat the wicked as just.

verses.latin: Misericors esto cum justis, et justa faciens, et confidere eris in justitia tua.
verses.english: Show mercy to the just, and do what is right; then you will be confident in your righteousness.

verses.latin: Non respicias oculos hominum, et in judicio ne timeas.
verses.english: Don't look at men's faces, and don't be afraid in judgment.

verses.latin: Quod justum est, facito pauperem.
verses.english: Do what is right to help the poor.

verses.latin: Non inclineris in lingua tua, et ne inpedias viam tuam.
verses.english: Don't let your tongue cause you to stumble, and don't block your own path.

verses.latin: Non sis in malis, et ne accipias faciem potentium.
verses.english: Don’t be evil, and don't accept the favors of the powerful.

verses.latin: De peccato tuo ne dubites confiteri, et non coneris pro eo celare.
verses.english: Don't hesitate to confess your sin, and don’t try to hide it.

verses.latin: Ante Deum enim et homines non te negas, et ne accipias pro peccato te confundere.
verses.english: Don't deny yourself before God and men, and don't be ashamed to admit your sin.

verses.latin: Ne dicas in corde tuo: Propter multitudinem donorum abscondam peccata mea: quia et Deus non ignorat.
verses.english: Don't say in your heart, “Because of my many gifts, I will hide my sins,” because God knows everything.

verses.latin: Ne dicas: Propter magnitudinem munerum meis miserationibus, offeram; et donabit mihi Deus.
verses.english: Don’t say, “Because of my many charitable deeds, God will give me mercy.”

verses.latin: Ne timeas, quia non est apud Deum vindicta, et non erit apud illum in ira tua.
verses.english: Don't be afraid, because vengeance is not with God, nor will He be angry with you.

verses.latin: Post proximum tuum irasceris, et memento altissimi: et ira tua non erit apud te.
verses.english: Be angry with your neighbor, but remember the Most High, and your anger will not be with you.

verses.latin: Memento novissima, et cessabis in odium; corrupcio, et mors manent in praeceptis.
verses.english: Remember your last days, and you will stop hating; corruption and death will remain in the commandments.

verses.latin: Memento timoris Dei, et non irascaris proximo tuo.
verses.english: Remember the fear of God, and don’t be angry with your neighbor.

verses.latin: Memento testamenti altissimi, et ignosce proximo tuo injuriam.
verses.english: Remember the covenant of the Most High, and forgive your neighbor’s injuries.

verses.latin: Fuge a luxuria; quia mors persequetur te.
verses.english: Flee from lust, because death will pursue you.

verses.latin: Memora in mandatis mandatorum, et ne respicias mandata superba.
verses.english: Remember the commandments of the Lord, and don’t pay attention to the proud commands of men.

verses.latin: Ajustificaberis in die mortis, et in die tribulationis, et in hora retribucionis convertentur super te filii impiorum.
verses.english: You will be justified on the day of your death, on the day of tribulation, and in the hour of retribution, the children of the wicked will turn against you.

verses.latin: Superbum ne timeas in cogitationibus suis; quia potentia impiorum sicut pulvis.
verses.english: Don't fear the proud in their thoughts, for the power of the wicked is like dust.

verses.latin: Deus est qui loquitur, et propter se disperdet illos; qui enim tangit, et non timebit?
verses.english: It is God who speaks, and He will destroy the proud. For who will touch and not fear?

verses.latin: Et omnis qui timuit Deum, et fecit mandata ejus, diligetur ab eo.
verses.english: And everyone who fears God and does His commandments is loved by Him.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, sperat; et qui ei adhaeret, non conturbabitur.
verses.english: Those who fear God trust Him, and those who cling to Him will not be shaken.

verses.latin: Qui diligit filium, flagellat frequenter: ut gaudeat in novissimo.
verses.english: The one who loves a child will often discipline him, so that he may rejoice in the end.

verses.latin: Qui erudit filium, inemundabit illum: et in inimicis suis gloriabitur in illum.
verses.english: The one who teaches his son will give joy, and will rejoice in him among his enemies.

verses.latin: Qui erudit stultum, inimicus sibi est: et qui diligit stultum, contristabitur in illum.
verses.english: The one who educates a fool is an enemy to himself; and the one who loves a fool will be saddened by him.

verses.latin: Qui credit stultis, cognoscit vanitatem: et qui credit illis, damnum sustinebit.
verses.english: The one who believes fools acknowledges futility; and the one who trusts them will suffer harm.

verses.latin: Qui exultare credit malum, scandalum sibi congregat: et qui odit correptiones, minorabitur vita.
verses.english: The one who takes delight in wickedness gathers scandal for himself; and the one who hates corrections will have a diminished life.

verses.latin: Qui se confidit in stulto, similis est sibi: et qui non potest resistere, in malum incidet.
verses.english: The one who trusts in a fool is like himself; and the one who cannot resist temptation falls into evil.

verses.latin: Non est dolor super dolorem, et tristitia super tristitiam: divitiarum et stultorum.
verses.english: There is no sorrow greater than sorrow, and sadness greater than sadness: the sorrow of riches and fools.

verses.latin: Non est sapientia in homine qui operatur in vanitate: et homo stultus, ad nihilum est.
verses.english: There is no wisdom in a man who works in vanity; and a foolish man amounts to nothing.

verses.latin: Melius est operari, et habere sufficientiam in omnibus: quam ambulare et indigere.
verses.english: It is better to work and have sufficiency in all things, than to walk in idleness and be in need.

verses.latin: Melius est habitare in terra solitaria, quam cum muliere rixosa et iracunda.
verses.english: It is better to dwell in a solitary land than with a quarrelsome and angry woman.

verses.latin: Melius est operari, et habere quod necessarium est: quam gloriari et indigere.
verses.english: It is better to work, and to have what is necessary, than to boast and be in need.

verses.latin: Sapiens in rebus suis tacebit, quasi dormiens: et qui videt, manifestabit illum.
verses.english: A wise man in his own affairs will be silent, as if sleeping; and he who sees, will reveal him.

verses.latin: Melius est abscondere stultitiam suam, quam abscondere sapientiam.
verses.english: It is better to hide one's folly than to hide wisdom.

verses.latin: Miserum est filium stultum habere: et sine gaudio est filius impiorum.
verses.english: It is miserable to have a foolish son; and the son of the wicked is without joy.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, diligit mandata ejus: et qui custodit illius, habebit vitam.
verses.english: The one who fears God loves His commandments; and the one who keeps them will have life.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, suscipiet doctrinam: et qui vigilaverit ad illam, lucescet in matutino.
verses.english: The one who fears God will receive instruction; and the one who watches over it, will be enlightened in the morning.

verses.latin: Qui quaerit legem, replebitur illa: et qui fictus est in via ejus, recipiet illam.
verses.english: The one who seeks the law will be filled with it; and the one who is feigned in its ways will receive it.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, parabit cor suum: et in conspectu illius humiliavit animam suam.
verses.english: The one who fears God will prepare his heart; and in His sight he humbles his soul.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, custodiet mandata ejus: et sustinebit in patientia, quasi in aqua.
verses.english: The one who fears God keeps His commandments, and endures in patience as if in water.

verses.latin: Verbum istud principium timoris Dei: et conspectus illius, probatio cordis.
verses.english: This word is the beginning of the fear of God; and His sight, the test of the heart.

verses.latin: Omnis plaga magna et omnis plaga parva: est in impiis, et venia peccatorum ex Deo.
verses.english: Every great plague and every small plague is upon the wicked; and the forgiveness of sins comes from God.

verses.latin: Qui offert munera injuste, quasi qui mactat filium in conspectu patris sui.
verses.english: The one who offers gifts unjustly is like one who slaughters his son in the sight of his father.

verses.latin: Panis egentium, vita pauperum est: qui detinuerit illud, homo sanguinis est.
verses.english: The bread of the needy is the life of the poor; the one who withholds it is a man of blood.

verses.latin: Qui aufert panem de sudore, similis est illi qui occidit proximum suum.
verses.english: The one who takes away bread by fraud is like the one who kills his neighbor.

verses.latin: Qui effundit sanguinem, et qui fraudem facit, fratres sunt.
verses.english: The one who sheds blood and the one who commits fraud are brothers.

verses.latin: Cum exstruxeris, et aedificaveris, quid remanebit tibi? In tempore.
verses.english: When you have built, and erected, what will remain for you? In time.

verses.latin: Cum congregabis, et collegeris, quid supererunt tibi? In tempore.
verses.english: When you have gathered, and collected, what will remain for you? In time.

verses.latin: Qui bonus est in malis, non reputabitur bonus: et malus in bonis, non coronabitur.
verses.english: The one who is good in evils will not be considered good; and the wicked in good things will not be crowned.

verses.latin: Qui confidet in divitiis, exultabit: et qui diligit dona, peribit.
verses.english: The one who trusts in riches will rejoice, and the one who loves gifts will perish.

verses.latin: Qui detrahit amicis, perdet: et qui impius est, invidebit.
verses.english: The one who detracts from friends, will perish; and the one who is impious will envy.

verses.latin: Vigilans dives, breve somnium est: stultus vero quasi in somnis vigilat.
verses.english: A rich man watching over his wealth is but a short sleep: a fool, though awake, is still dreaming.

verses.latin: Quasi dormiens, nihil habet: et quasi evigilans, semper mendicat.
verses.english: A fool, even when awake, has nothing: he is always begging.

verses.latin: Stultus in verbis, quasi mulier in partu.
verses.english: A foolish man's words are like a woman in labor.

verses.latin: Cor stulti quasi vas fractum: omnem sensum non continebit.
verses.english: The heart of a fool is like a broken vessel: it cannot retain any wisdom.

verses.latin: Sapiens in verbo quasi plenus fluminibus: et quasi saturus, semper sitit.
verses.english: The wise man is full of speech, as if a river: and, like one ever thirsty, always has more to learn.

verses.latin: Qui addit doctrinae, auget se: qui autem detestatur disciplinam, cito morietur.
verses.english: He that adds to his learning increases himself: but he that hates discipline shall die quickly.

verses.latin: Qui stultus est, male aget, et vir sensatus sustinebit ea.
verses.english: A fool will act foolishly, and a wise man will bear it patiently.

verses.latin: Sermo stulti, quasi onus in via.
verses.english: The words of a fool are a burden on the road.

verses.latin: Os stulti, quasi annuntiator inconvivii.
verses.english: The mouth of a fool is like a herald of a banquet.

verses.latin: Os stultorum, cito contristatio.
verses.english: The mouth of fools quickly leads to sorrow.

verses.latin: Convivium peccatoris, non bene conjunctum.
verses.english: The banquet of a sinner is not well-ordered.

verses.latin: Stultus non erit stabilis in doctrina, sed quasi flos transiet.
verses.english: A fool will not be steadfast in doctrine, but will pass away like a flower.

verses.latin: Homo stultus, quasi domus diruta: et sensus insipientis, quasi incognita via.
verses.english: A foolish man is like a ruined house: and the understanding of the unwise is like a path unknown.

verses.latin: Qui indoctus est, quasi lapides in via.
verses.english: He that is untaught is like stones on the way.

verses.latin: Sensus insipientis, quasi onera in via.
verses.english: The understanding of the unwise is like a weight on the road.

verses.latin: Sapiens in doctrina, quasi in vita: et qui contempserit eam, similis morituro.
verses.english: A wise man is like a life in learning: and he that despises it is like one about to die.

verses.latin: Qui bonus est verbo, saturabitur bonis: et fructus labiorum ejus replebitur.
verses.english: He that is good in word shall be filled with good things: and the fruit of his lips shall be fulfilled.

verses.latin: Non gloriari in malis, est stultitia: et homo mendax, quasi in aqua profundus.
verses.english: To glory in evil is foolishness: and a man of lies is like deep water.

verses.latin: Quasi saxa in alto, ita corda impiorum: et quasi qui contempserit Deum, ita vindicta illorum.
verses.english: Like stones in deep water, so are the hearts of the wicked: and as he that has despised God, so is their vengeance.

verses.latin: Qui contemnit legem, peccat: et qui custodit mandatum, retribuet ei.
verses.english: He that despises the law sins: and he that keeps the commandment shall be recompensed.

verses.latin: Gratia Domini, quasi in terra sicca: et qui respicit misericordiam, adimplens mandata.
verses.english: The grace of the Lord is like water in a dry land: and he that looks to mercy fulfills the commandments.

verses.latin: Quid est? Quid est? Quid est? Quid est? Quid est? Quid est? Et quid est? Septies in ore stulti.
verses.english: What is it? What is it? What is it? What is it? What is it? What is it? And what is it? Seven times in the mouth of a fool.

verses.latin: Sermo malus, in ore impii: sed in ore electorum, placebit.
verses.english: Evil speech is in the mouth of the wicked: but in the mouth of the elect it shall please.

verses.latin: Cor sapientis cogitabit de parabolis: et auris audientis desiderium sapientis.
verses.english: The heart of the wise man will think of parables: and the ear of the hearing desires wisdom.

verses.latin: Sapiens et sensatus, cavebit se a malis: et inter stultos commorabitur.
verses.english: The wise and the understanding man will beware of evil: and will dwell among the fools.

verses.latin: Stultus mutabit, quasi rota currus: et cogitatio ejus, quasi rota in caelo.
verses.english: A fool will change like a wheel on a cart: and his thought is like a wheel in the sky.

verses.latin: Amicus, quasi equus, qui dicit: super quem ascendes?
verses.english: A friend is like a horse, saying: "Upon which will you mount?"

verses.latin: Quasi avis, contra solem, sic et cor superborum: et super humili, quasi gladius conversus.
verses.english: Like a bird against the sun, so is the heart of the proud: and against the humble, as a sword turned.

verses.latin: Superbus diligit casus: et vir superbus, contra mala, non stabit.
verses.english: The proud man loves destruction: and the proud man will not stand against evils.

verses.latin: In corde prudentium, verbum sapientiae: et quasi fluvius vita, justitiae.
verses.english: In the heart of the prudent, is the word of wisdom: and like a river of life, righteousness.

verses.latin: Sapiens in corde, scit tempora, et judicium: et in malis non paulum laborat.
verses.english: A wise man knows the times and judgement: and in evils he does not labor a little.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, faciet bona, et qui continet justitiam, apprehendet eam, et quasi mater filios suscipiet illam.
verses.english: The one who fears God will do good works, and the one who upholds justice will obtain it; he will receive it as a mother receives her children.

verses.latin: Cibabit illum in panibus vitæ, et dabit illi intellectum, et pluviam doctrinæ.
verses.english: God will feed him with the bread of life and give him understanding and a rain of doctrine.

verses.latin: Et fiduciam ejus adimplet, et gloriam æternam.
verses.english: He will fulfill his confidence and give him eternal glory.

verses.latin: Mala sensus mali, et perversiones cordis, et nequitiæ perdunt omnes.
verses.english: Evil thoughts, perversions of the heart, and wickedness destroy all.

verses.latin: Spiritus sanctus ab omnibus recessit, et sapientia cum his quae sine sensu sunt.
verses.english: The Holy Spirit departs from all, and wisdom goes away from things without understanding.

verses.latin: Sapiens enim agnoscit verba sapientiæ, et suscipiet eam, et auditus desiderii est judicium legis.
verses.english: The wise man knows the words of wisdom and receives it, and the hearing of the desire is the judgment of the law.

verses.latin: Sicut aqua extinguit ignem, ita eleemosyna exstinguit peccatum.
verses.english: Just as water puts out a fire, so almsgiving extinguishes sin.

verses.latin: Qui reddit gratiam, memor est futurorum, et in tempore suo inveniet favorem.
verses.english: He who gives thanks is mindful of the future, and in due time will find favor.

verses.latin: Sicut aqua extinguit ardentem ignem, ita eleemosyna resistit peccatis.
verses.english: As water puts out a blazing fire, so almsgiving resists sins.

verses.latin: Qui facit gratiam, memor est futurorum, et in tempore suo inveniet favorem.
verses.english: He who gives grace is mindful of the future, and in due time will find favor.

verses.latin: Multi dant et non habent, et qui aliena accipiunt, male faciunt.
verses.english: Many give but do not have, and those who receive what is not theirs do evil.

verses.latin: Multi parvi facti sunt et ex magna gloria, et honorati sunt propter manus alienas.
verses.english: Many become poor from great glory and are honored because of the hands of others.

verses.latin: Multi sunt qui in necessitatibus laboraverunt, et pauperiem habent in vita.
verses.english: Many have toiled in needs and have poverty in their life.

verses.latin: Hi sunt qui sperant in seipsis: et gloriam ipsorum respiciunt.
verses.english: These are those who trust in themselves and look to their own glory.

verses.latin: Major est qui in paupertate honoratur, et in abundantia qui inhonorat gloriam.
verses.english: Greater is he who is honored in poverty, and he who dishonors glory in abundance is less.

verses.latin: Qui justificatur in paupertate, bonus est: et qui dives est, et contristatur iniquus.
verses.english: He who is justified in poverty is good, and he who is rich and becomes sad is wicked.

verses.latin: Qui diligit animam suam, flagellat, et qui diligit filium suum, assidue castigat eum.
verses.english: He who loves his soul flagellates it, and he who loves his son constantly chastises him.

verses.latin: Qui flectit virgam suam, filium suum molestat: et in eo gaudebit in novissimo suo.
verses.english: He who bends his rod burdens his son, and will rejoice in him in the end.

verses.latin: Qui erudit filium suum, utilitatem habebit in illo, et in medio notorum gloriabitur de illo.
verses.english: He who teaches his son will have profit from him, and will glory in him among his acquaintances.

verses.latin: Qui erudit filium suum, invidebit inimicus ejus: et in medio amicorum gloriabitur de illo.
verses.english: He who teaches his son will be envied by his enemy and will glory in him among his friends.

verses.latin: Qui moritur filio suo, quasi non mortuus est: reliquit enim post se vindicem.
verses.english: He who dies for his son is as if he had not died, for he has left a protector after him.

verses.latin: Qui relinquit testamento filium suum, quasi de thesauris suis, reliquit ei, et in eo confidet.
verses.english: He who leaves a son as an heir in his testament leaves him as if he had left him from his treasures and trusts in him.

verses.latin: Qui generat filium, servavit se ab inimicis: et in eo inimicus gloriabitur.
verses.english: He who begets a son saves himself from his enemies, and the enemy will glory in him.

verses.latin: Qui diligit filium suum, flagellat illum frequenter, ut gaudeat de illo in novissimo suo.
verses.english: He who loves his son frequently flagellates him, so that he may rejoice in him in the end.

verses.latin: Qui continet filium suum, ligat vulnera: et conturbabitur super omnem vocem.
verses.english: He who restrains his son binds up wounds, and is troubled by every sound.

verses.latin: Equus indomitus evadit durus: et filius remissus evadit voluntate.
verses.english: An untamed horse becomes harsh, and a son neglected becomes willful.

verses.latin: Delecta pueri emenda, et conturbabis lumbos ejus.
verses.english: Correct a boy and you will trouble his loins.

verses.latin: Festuca equo, et virga asino, et filio flagella.
verses.english: A goad for a horse, a rod for a donkey, and whips for a son.

verses.latin: Erudi filium tuum, et operaberis eum, et non confundaris in conversatione ipsius.
verses.english: Teach your son, and you will work with him, and you will not be ashamed of his behavior.

verses.latin: Ne derelinquas animam tuam in concupiscentiis, et ne affligas teipsum cogitationibus tuis.
verses.english: Do not abandon your soul to your desires, and do not afflict yourself with your own thoughts.

verses.latin: Si dederis animæ tuæ voluntatem in id, quod desiderat, faciet te in gaudium inimicis tuis.
verses.english: If you give your soul its desire in the thing it wants, it will make you a cause of joy to your enemies.

verses.latin: Noli gloriari in divitiis, si perdideris te, et noli dicere: Sufficiunt mihi, et nihil mali patiar.
verses.english: Do not glory in riches if you lose yourself, and do not say, “I have enough, and I will suffer nothing bad.”

verses.latin: Noli sequi animam tuam in concupiscentiis ejus: a concupiscentiis tuis avertere te.
verses.english: Do not follow your soul in its desires; turn away from your desires.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, nihil faciet mali, et qui tenet mandata, sanabit se.
verses.english: One who fears God will avoid all evils, and by keeping His commandments, he protects himself.

verses.latin: Sapiens cor norabit legem, et verbum justitiae sicut luna implebitur.
verses.english: A wise heart will know the law, and justice will grow like the moon.

verses.latin: Cor impii scrutabitur mala: sicut funeus conatus pertransiet.
verses.english: The heart of the wicked seeks evil, but like a shadowy attempt, it vanishes.

verses.latin: Homo pius persistet in sapientia sicut sol, et justitia ejus sicut luna firmabitur.
verses.english: A man of piety will be strong in wisdom like the sun, and his righteousness will be as firm as the moon.

verses.latin: Cor impii scrutabitur iniqua, et mala mala, et non remittet usque ad iram.
verses.english: The wicked heart scrutinizes iniquity, seeking evil, and will not cease until wrath descends.

verses.latin: Perfecto viro odibilis est impius, et justus exsecratur impium.
verses.english: The wicked are hated by the perfect man, and the just man curses the wicked.

verses.latin: Filius probatus, absconditus thesaurus, et qui diligit honorabit eum.
verses.english: A proven son is a hidden treasure, and one who loves him will honor him.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, nihil deficiet: et quomodo opera ejus fient, sic et merces illius.
verses.english: One who fears God lacks nothing: and as his works are, so shall his reward be.

verses.latin: Qui sperat in Domino, non deficiet: nec morabitur, et non transibit.
verses.english: He who hopes in the Lord will not fail: nor will he delay, and will not pass away.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, nihil timebit: et non pavebit, quoniam ipse est spes ejus.
verses.english: He who fears God fears nothing: and he will not be afraid, because He is his hope.

verses.latin: Anima timentis Deum, non timebit quis? et in quo spes ejus?
verses.english: The soul that fears God, whom will it fear? And in whom is his hope?

verses.latin: Oculus Domini super eos qui timent eum: protector virtutis, firmamentum spei, et umbraculum solis a dextera, et protectio a ruina, et defensio a casu.
verses.english: The eye of the Lord is upon those who fear Him: a protector of strength, the foundation of hope, and a shadow from the sun on the right, a protection from ruin, and a defense against falling.

verses.latin: Illuminans oculos, et dans gratiam, et sanitatem, et vitam.
verses.english: Enlightening the eyes, and giving grace, health, and life.

verses.latin: Qui immolat ex iniquo, sacrificium maculatum offert: et non sunt complacita sacrificia injustorum.
verses.english: He who sacrifices unjustly offers a stained sacrifice: and the sacrifices of the unjust are not pleasing.

verses.latin: Non delectatur Altissimus in oblationibus impiorum, et in multitudine sacrificiorum eorum non propitiabitur peccatis.
verses.english: The Most High does not delight in the offerings of the wicked, nor will He be appeased for sins by the multitude of their sacrifices.

verses.latin: Qui offert sacrificium ex pauperum substantia, quasi qui filium occidit in conspectu patris sui.
verses.english: He who offers a sacrifice from the substance of the poor is like one who kills his son in the sight of his father.

verses.latin: Panis egentium vita pauperum: qui defraudat illum, vir sanguinis est.
verses.english: The bread of the poor is the life of the needy: he who defrauds him is a man of blood.

verses.latin: Qui aufert panem de labore, quasi qui proximi sui occidit.
verses.english: He who takes away bread from labor is like one who kills his neighbor.

verses.latin: Qui effundit sanguinem, et qui fraudem facit mercenario, fratres sunt.
verses.english: Those who shed blood, and those who defraud a hired worker, are brothers.

verses.latin: Cum aedificaveris, et cum destruxeris, quid proficies? Orationem quare? qui fastidio est tibi.
verses.english: When you build, and when you destroy, what will you gain? Why pray if it is a burden to you?

verses.latin: Cum jejunaveris, et iterum jejunaveris, et cum jejunaveris ter, quid proficis? Quoniam jejunare non es dilectus Domino.
verses.english: When you fast, and again fast, and when you fast a third time, what do you gain? Because fasting is not pleasing to the Lord.

verses.latin: Qui jejunat, pro peccatis: et qui dimittit peccata, caveat ne faciat ea amplius: et qui orat pro peccatis, stultus est.
verses.english: He who fasts for sins: and who puts away sins, let him beware lest he do them again: and he who prays for sins is foolish.

verses.latin: Qui offert sacrificium de substantia pauperum, quasi qui filium occidit in conspectu patris sui.
verses.english: He who offers sacrifice from the substance of the poor, is like one who kills his son in the sight of his father.

verses.latin: Pauperis vita panis, qui defraudat illum, vir sanguinis est.
verses.english: The bread of the poor is life, he who defrauds him is a man of blood.

verses.latin: Qui aufert de labore panem, proximi sui sanguinem derogat.
verses.english: He who takes away bread from labor takes away the blood of his neighbor.

verses.latin: Cum aedificaveris, iniqui tunc aedificas, et qui aedificas, iniqui destruis: et cum oraveris, quid orabis?
verses.english: When you build, the wicked then build, and you who build, the wicked destroy: and when you pray, what will you pray for?

verses.latin: Cum jejunaveris, non es delectatus: et cum obtuleris, non accipies.
verses.english: When you fast, you are not delighted: and when you offer, you will not be received.

verses.latin: Quid enim habet vita, et quid opera, et quid laborem?
verses.english: What is the value of life, and what of works, and what of labor?

verses.latin: Noli contendere in prole tua, neque adhibeas verbum contra impios.
verses.english: Do not contend with your children, nor use words against the wicked.

verses.latin: Recede ab homine iniquo, et a sensu impiorum.
verses.english: Turn away from the wicked man, and from the understanding of the impious.

verses.latin: Esto mihi in judicio, et defende me: et libera me.
verses.english: Be to me in judgment, and defend me: and deliver me.

verses.latin: Da mihi fiduciam in sensu tuo: et ne confundas me in timore.
verses.english: Give me confidence in your understanding: and do not confound me in fear.

verses.latin: Docete timorem Domini filios, et inimicos vestros humiliabit Deus.
verses.english: Teach the fear of the Lord to your children, and God will humble your enemies.

verses.latin: Quanto major es, tanto humilia te in omnibus, et invenies gratiam ante Deum.
verses.english: The more you are exalted, the more humble yourself in all things, and you will find grace before God.

verses.latin: Multi enim potentes, et incogniti, et generosi, et inopes, et gratiam Dei requirentes.
verses.english: For there are many powerful, and unknown, and noble, and poor, all seeking the grace of God.

verses.latin: Qui timuerunt Dominum, et timuerunt, et non contempserunt mandata ejus.
verses.english: Those who feared the Lord, and feared, and did not despise his commandments.

verses.latin: Qui timuerunt Dominum, speraverunt in illum: et non sunt derelicti.
verses.english: Those who feared the Lord, hoped in him: and they were not abandoned.

verses.latin: Qui timuerunt Dominum, non contempserunt verba illius: et non fuerunt contumaces illi.
verses.english: Those who feared the Lord did not despise his words: and they were not disobedient to him.

verses.latin: Qui timuerunt Dominum, et inquirent placitum illius, et diligunt eum.
verses.english: Those who feared the Lord, and sought his pleasure, and loved him.

verses.latin: Qui timuerunt Dominum, parant corda sua, et in conspectu illius humiliaverunt animas suas.
verses.english: Those who feared the Lord, prepare their hearts, and humbled their souls in his sight.

verses.latin: Cademus in manus hominum, et non in manus Dei: quia secundum magnitudinem ipsius et misericordia ejus, ita et correptio ipsius.
verses.english: Let us fall into the hands of men, and not into the hands of God: for according to his greatness and his mercy, so also is his rebuke.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, faciet bona: et qui continet iustitiam, adprehendet eam.
verses.english: The one who fears God will do good things, and the one who holds onto justice will grasp it fully.

verses.latin: Et occurret illi iustitia quasi mater honorifica, et quasi uxor nubentis occurret illi.
verses.english: And justice will meet him like an honorable mother, and she will meet him as a new wife does her husband.

verses.latin: Cibum panis dat vivis, et sapientia dat cordi intelligentiam.
verses.english: Bread gives food to the living, and wisdom gives understanding to the heart.

verses.latin: In sapientia confortabitur cor ejus quasi in diebus pluviæ, et sicut flumen magnum, ita redundabit scientia.
verses.english: In wisdom, his heart will be made strong, as if in the days of rain, and like a great river, his knowledge will overflow.

verses.latin: Sicut diluvium emittet flumina, ita ira irascentium: sicut ignis comburet ligna, ita ira superborum.
verses.english: Just as a flood sends forth rivers, so too does the anger of the angry. As fire burns wood, so too does the anger of the arrogant.

verses.latin: Bonus est misericors Deus, et ipse miserabitur: et in diebus afflictionis quasi nubes pluviae ostendet gratiam.
verses.english: God is merciful and good, and He will have mercy. In the days of affliction, He will show favor like the rain clouds.

verses.latin: Qui confidet in eo, non pavebit: neque timebit, quoniam ipse est spes sua.
verses.english: The one who trusts in Him will not be afraid or fear, because He is his hope.

verses.latin: Anima timentis Deum non timebit: neque enim spes illius in ipsis est alienis.
verses.english: The soul of the one who fears God will not fear. Indeed, his hope is not in strangers.

verses.latin: Quis timuit Dominum, et ipse eum reliquit? Aut quis invocavit eum, et ipse illum despexit?
verses.english: Who has feared the Lord, and He has abandoned him? Or who has called upon Him, and He has despised him?

verses.latin: Quoniam Deus miserator et misericors est, et dimittet peccata in die tribulationis, et proteget omnes confitentes se.
verses.english: For God is compassionate and merciful, and He will forgive sins in the day of tribulation and protect all who confess themselves.

verses.latin: Væ cordi timido, quia non credit: ideo non protegetur.
verses.english: Woe to the cowardly heart, because it does not believe; therefore, it will not be protected.

verses.latin: Væ illi qui perdit patientiam: et quæ fecit, quid faciet?
verses.english: Woe to the one who loses patience, and what will he do with what he has done?

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, non contristabitur, et qui diligit eum, conservabit legem ejus.
verses.english: The one who fears God will not be saddened, and the one who loves Him will keep His law.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, præparabit cor suum, et in conspectu illius sanctificabit animam suam.
verses.english: The one who fears God will prepare his heart and sanctify his soul in His sight.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, quæret placere illi, et qui diligunt eum, implebunt legem ejus.
verses.english: The one who fears God will seek to please Him, and those who love Him will fulfill His law.

verses.latin: Qui timent Dominum, parant corda sua, et in conspectu Altissimi humiliaverunt animas suas.
verses.english: Those who fear the Lord prepare their hearts and humble their souls in the sight of the Most High.

verses.latin: Cadent in manus Dei peccatores, et peribunt secundum iram illius.
verses.english: Sinners will fall into the hands of God and will perish according to His wrath.

verses.latin: Homo impius non permanebit in poenitentia, et non manebit peccator in longum.
verses.english: The impious man will not remain in repentance, and the sinner will not remain long.

verses.latin: Peccator et impius loquuntur verba dura, et scribunt opera sua iniqua.
verses.english: The sinner and the impious speak harsh words and write their wicked deeds.

verses.latin: Sicut est generatio, sic et opera illorum.
verses.english: As is the generation, so too are their works.

verses.latin: Opera superborum detestabilis est Deo, et irascibilis est super illos.
verses.english: The works of the proud are detestable to God, and He is angry with them.

verses.latin: Vindicta terribilis super gentes impias.
verses.english: Terrible vengeance is upon the impious nations.

verses.latin: Judicium diei mortis filios hominum.
verses.english: The judgment of the day of death is for the sons of men.

verses.latin: Memorare novissima tua, et in æternum desines peccare.
verses.english: Remember your last things, and you will cease to sin forever.

verses.latin: Quid pulchrius sole et luna? Quoniam et stella lucens, et in tempore suo mutatio.
verses.english: What is more beautiful than the sun and the moon? For even the shining star changes in its time.

verses.latin: Et quid pulchrius quam vas in bono splendens? Quoniam et aurum et lapis smaragdus, et quid pulchrius quam decor mulieris speciosae?
verses.english: And what is more beautiful than a vessel shining in goodness? For even gold and the emerald stone; and what is more beautiful than the beauty of a beautiful woman?

verses.latin: Nihil supergreditur speciem mulieris, et quid magis delectat quam homo bonus?
verses.english: Nothing surpasses the beauty of a woman, and what is more delightful than a good man?

verses.latin: Sicut sol in exortu mundi, sic species mulieris in ornatu domus suae.
verses.english: As the sun when it rises in the world, so is the beauty of a woman in the adornment of her home.

verses.latin: Lucerna lucens super candelabrum sanctum, sic facies in statura speciosa.
verses.english: A lamp shining on a holy lampstand is how a face is in a beautiful stature.

verses.latin: Sicut columnæ aureæ super basim argenti, sic pedes super stabilibus plantis.
verses.english: As golden pillars upon a silver base, so are the feet upon stable soles.

verses.latin: Quid valet contra oculos hominis solis, sicut pulchritudo in aspectu?
verses.english: What is the value against the eyes of a man who is alone, like beauty in appearance?

verses.latin: Melius est utraque, qui custodit utramque: quia et qui de eo laudatur, et qui diligit, amicus est.
verses.english: It is better for both, the one who keeps both; because both the one who is praised by him, and the one who loves him, is a friend.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, habebit utramque: et sicut fructus illius, ita gloria illius.
verses.english: The one who fears God will have both, and as is his fruit, so too is his glory.

verses.latin: Non est bonum esse iniqui, et superbus non est honorabilis: cuius enim non est timor Domini, peribit.
verses.english: It is not good to be wicked, and the proud is not honorable. For the one who does not fear the Lord will perish.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, faciet bona: et qui continet justitiam, comprehendet eam, et quasi flamma accipiet eam.
verses.english: The one who honors God does good deeds, and the one who holds to the truth will grasp it like a fire, and he will hold to it.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, habebit bonam voluntatem, et quasi matris honorem recipiet benedictionem.
verses.english: The one who fears God will desire good, and he will receive the blessing as a mother's honor.

verses.latin: Cibabit illum panis vitæ et intellectus: et aqua sapientiæ potabit illum.
verses.english: He will nourish himself on the bread of life and understanding, and he will drink the water of wisdom.

verses.latin: Firmabit illum, et non movebitur: et adhaerebit illi, et non confundetur.
verses.english: God will make him strong, and he will not be shaken. He will hold fast to God, and he will not be put to shame.

verses.latin: Et exaltabit illum in medio ecclesiæ, et aperiet os ejus in plenitudine spiritus sapientiæ: et implebit illum spiritu intellectus.
verses.english: God will lift him up in the midst of the Church, and He will open his mouth with the fullness of the spirit of wisdom, and He will fill him with the spirit of understanding.

verses.latin: Et induet illum stolam gloriæ, et coronam jucunditatis.
verses.english: And God will clothe him in a garment of glory and a crown of joy.

verses.latin: Amici tui et proximi tui, non separentur a te: et cum potenti, et sciente Deum, assidue esto.
verses.english: Let your friends and your neighbors not separate from you. Be constantly with the powerful and the one who knows God.

verses.latin: A doctrina pietatis, adhaereas: et virum justum, et timentem Deum, suscipe tibi.
verses.english: Hold fast to the teaching of piety, and choose a just man and a God-fearing man.

verses.latin: Sit tibi cum eo spiritus justorum, et in timore Dei gloriaberis.
verses.english: May the spirit of the just be with you, and you will be glorified in the fear of God.

verses.latin: Sperare in Deum, magnum est: et non deficere a mandatis ejus, vita.
verses.english: To hope in God is a great thing, and not to abandon His commandments is life.

verses.latin: Qui timet Dominum, nihil timebit: et non pavebit, quoniam ipse est spes ejus.
verses.english: The one who fears the Lord will fear nothing, and he will not be afraid because He is his hope.

verses.latin: Animam timentis Deum, non despiciet Dominus: et in tentatione, non derelinquet eam.
verses.english: The Lord will not reject the soul of the one who fears God, and He will not abandon him in temptation.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, sperabit in illum: et oculi ejus, ad aspectum illius.
verses.english: The one who fears God will hope in Him, and his eyes are fixed on the Lord.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, non timebit virum: et non conturbabitur, quoniam ipse est spes ejus.
verses.english: The one who fears God will not fear men, and he will not be troubled because He is his hope.

verses.latin: Beatus anima, quæ timuit Deum.
verses.english: Blessed is the soul that fears God.

verses.latin: Cui autem, quomodo, et a quo, et a quo, et quid sperabit?
verses.english: To whom, in what manner, and by whom, and about what will he hope?

verses.latin: Oculi Domini super eos qui timent eum: protector potens, et firmamentum virtutis, et tegumentum a solis urentibus, et umbraculum a meridiano.
verses.english: The eyes of the Lord are upon those who fear Him. He is a powerful protector, the foundation of strength, and a shelter from the burning sun, and a shade from the midday heat.

verses.latin: A percutiente iram, et a offendente, protegit animam: et a casibus, eripit eam.
verses.english: From the one who strikes with anger, and from the one who offends, He protects the soul, and delivers it from the troubles of the world.

verses.latin: Qui immolat sacrificium ex iniquo, maculatus est: et oblationes injustorum non probabuntur.
verses.english: The one who offers a sacrifice unjustly is stained. The offerings of the wicked will not be accepted.

verses.latin: Bonus Dominus his qui diligunt eum.
verses.english: The Lord is good to those who love Him.

verses.latin: Qui faciunt quod justum est, et in judicio veritatis laborant.
verses.english: They do what is just and labor in the judgment of truth.

verses.latin: Ne declina iniquitatem, et noli sequi viam peccatorum.
verses.english: Do not turn to wickedness, and do not follow the path of sinners.

verses.latin: Omnis iniquitas a Deo abominabilis est: et a peccatoribus vindicabit eam.
verses.english: All wickedness is an abomination to God, and He will punish sinners for it.

verses.latin: Non sine causa ab iniquis separabis te: et a peccatis recesseris.
verses.english: You will not be separated from the wicked without cause, and you will depart from sins.

verses.latin: Filio inobedienti ne adjungas te: et a filiis peccatorum recede.
verses.english: Do not be joined to a disobedient son, and depart from the sons of sinners.

verses.latin: Agnosce tempus: et cave a malo.
verses.english: Recognize the time, and beware of evil.

verses.latin: Anima bona, omnia sustinebit: et pro patientia, coronabitur.
verses.english: A good soul will endure all things, and it will be crowned for its patience.

verses.latin: Si inveneris te in afflictione, permane: et in patientia tua, patientiam habe.
verses.english: If you find yourself in affliction, remain. In your patience, have patience.

verses.latin: Quicquid tibi acciderit, suscipe: et in dolore sustine: et in humilitate tua habe patientiam.
verses.english: Accept whatever happens to you, endure pain, and be patient in your humility.

verses.latin: Quoniam in igne probatur aurum et argentum: probati autem homines in camino humiliationis.
verses.english: For gold and silver are tested in fire, and men are tested in the furnace of humility.

verses.latin: Crede illi, et adjuvabit te: dirige vias tuas, et spera in illum.
verses.english: Trust in Him, and He will help you. Direct your ways, and hope in Him.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, nihil timebit: et non conturbabitur, quoniam ipse est spes ejus.
verses.english: The one who fears God will fear nothing, and will not be troubled because He is his hope.

verses.latin: Beatus anima, quæ timet Deum.
verses.english: Blessed is the soul that fears God.

verses.latin: Deus enim respicit eos qui diligunt eum.
verses.english: For God looks upon those who love Him.

verses.latin: Qui timent Deum, et qui in operibus ejus sustinent, invenient gratiam illi.
verses.english: Those who fear God, and who endure in His works, will find grace from Him.

verses.latin: Qui quærit legem, replebitur illa: et qui in opere illius insidit, glorificabitur.
verses.english: The one who seeks the Law will be filled with it, and the one who meditates on its work will be glorified.

verses.latin: Qui timent Dominum, parant corda sua, et in conspectu illius humiliaverunt animas suas.
verses.english: Those who fear the Lord prepare their hearts, and in His sight, they humble their souls.

verses.latin: Cadent in manus Dei, et peccata eorum, non tollentur.
verses.english: They will fall into the hands of God, and their sins will not be removed.

verses.latin: Miserere nostri, Deus omnium, et respice nos, et ostende faciem tuam super nos, et miserere nostri.
verses.english: God of all, show mercy to us and look upon us. Let Your face shine upon us, and have mercy.

verses.latin: Ut cognoscamus viam tuam et sciamus semitas tuas.
verses.english: So we may know Your ways and understand Your paths.

verses.latin: Ostende nobis misericordiam tuam, Domine, et da nobis salutare tuum.
verses.english: Show us Your mercy, Lord, and grant us Your salvation.

verses.latin: Loquar in tribulatione mea: Dominus speravit me.
verses.english: I will speak in my tribulation: The Lord has been my hope.

verses.latin: Conturbata est anima mea; propter hoc recordabor tui de terra Jordanis, et Hermoniim a parvo monte.
verses.english: My soul is troubled, and because of this, I remember You from the land of the Jordan, and from Hermon and the little mountain.

verses.latin: Abyssus abyssum invocat in voce cataractarum tuarum; omnia excelsa tua et fluctus tui super me transierunt.
verses.english: Deep calls to deep at the voice of Your cataracts; all Your high things and Your waves have passed over me.

verses.latin: In die mandavit Dominus misericordiam suam, et nocte canticum ejus.
verses.english: In the daytime the Lord commanded His mercy, and at night His song.

verses.latin: Apud me oratio Deo vitae meae.
verses.english: My prayer is to God, the life of my soul.

verses.latin: Dicam Deo: Susceptor meus es, et refugium meum, et Deus meus, quoniam miserator es mei.
verses.english: I will say to God: You are my protector and my refuge, my God, for You are merciful to me.

verses.latin: Quoniam Dominus dedit sapientiam, et prudentia et intellectus ex ore illius.
verses.english: For the Lord gives wisdom, and from His mouth comes prudence and understanding.

verses.latin: Qui de terra egreditur, et qui super terram est, in pulverem revertetur: et sic qui persequitur, et qui offert.
verses.english: Whoever comes from the earth and is upon the earth returns to dust, and so it is with those who pursue and those who offer.

verses.latin: Omnes homines quasi terra, et ex terra fabricatus est Adam.
verses.english: All men are like the earth, and Adam was fashioned from the earth.

verses.latin: In scientia Dei separavit illos, et dissipavit vias illorum.
verses.english: In the knowledge of God, He separated them and scattered their ways.

verses.latin: Qui facit iniquitatem, et abominatio, et qui facit superbiam, et iniquus est.
verses.english: Whoever does iniquity is an abomination, and whoever acts proudly is unjust.

verses.latin: Quid est superbum? Mortis ergo.
verses.english: What is pride? It is death.

verses.latin: Omnia quae moventur super terram, in pulverem convertentur; et qui creavit illa, et ipse de terra.
verses.english: All things that move upon the earth will turn to dust; and He who created them is also from the earth.

verses.latin: Corpus hominis ad tempus: quid super omne, quod natum est ex terra?
verses.english: The body of man lasts but a time: what is more than all that is born of the earth?

verses.latin: Nihil est super sol, et nihil magis vacuum quam lingua impii.
verses.english: Nothing is above the sun, and nothing is more empty than the tongue of the wicked.

verses.latin: Beati qui in sapientia, et qui in sensu, et qui in cogitatione sua meditantur in Deo.
verses.english: Blessed are those in wisdom, and those in understanding, and those who meditate on God in their thoughts.

verses.latin: Sapiens erit in corde suo, et doctrinas justitiae narrabit.
verses.english: The wise will be in their heart, and they will proclaim the teachings of justice.

verses.latin: Qui sapit, docebit etiam sapienter, et qui audit, judicabit.
verses.english: Whoever is wise will also teach wisely, and whoever listens will judge.

verses.latin: Quo magis sapies, eo major eris, et quo magis creveris, eo plura magna in te erunt.
verses.english: The more you are wise, the greater you will be, and the more you grow, the more great things will be in you.

verses.latin: Qui videbit multa, plus intelliget quam homo.
verses.english: He who sees much will understand more than a man.

verses.latin: Quis est qui investigaverit opera ejus? Et quis enarrabit mirabilia illius?
verses.english: Who has investigated His works? And who will declare His marvels?

verses.latin: Quid enim homo? Et quid est illi sensus? Et quid illi faciet?
verses.english: For what is man? What is his understanding? And what will he do?

verses.latin: Numerus dierum hominis, in optimo centum anni. Quid est illud in conspectu aeternitatis?
verses.english: The number of a man's days, at best, is one hundred years. What is that in the sight of eternity?

verses.latin: Quasi gutta maris, et quasi stilla pluviae: et quis potest numerare mare, et stillas, et dies saeculi?
verses.english: Like a drop of the sea, and like a drop of rain: and who can number the sea, and the drops, and the days of the age?

verses.latin: Tres sunt quas timuit anima mea, et quartum timui: Cum fama de civitate, et concursu multitudinis,
verses.english: There are three things my soul feared, and I feared a fourth: when a rumor about a city arises, and the gathering of a multitude,

verses.latin: et calumnia populi: horribile est super mortem.
verses.english: and the slander of the people: it is more horrible than death.

verses.latin: Miseria et dolor est, quando mulier zelotypat virum suum, et quando irascitur zelus.
verses.english: Misery and sorrow is when a woman is jealous of her husband, and when jealousy becomes angry.

verses.latin: Lingua gladius acutus, et ira et conturbatio iniqua.
verses.english: The tongue is a sharp sword, and anger and disturbance are unjust.

verses.latin: Qui diligit Deus, habebit vitam: et qui diligit eum, suscipiet disciplinam.
verses.english: He who loves God will have life, and he who loves Him will receive discipline.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, et erit in bona: et qui sperat in illum, non deficiet.
verses.english: He who fears God will be in good, and he who hopes in Him will not fail.

verses.latin: Timor Domini initium dilectionis ejus; et fides eligibilis cum justitia.
verses.english: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of His love; and faith is chosen with justice.

verses.latin: Spiritus ejus, vita, et refectio: visitabit eos qui diligunt eum, et apparebit eis in laetitia sua.
verses.english: His Spirit is life, and refreshment: He will visit those who love Him, and He will appear to them in His joy.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, parabit cor suum, et in conspectu illius humiliabit animam suam.
verses.english: He who fears God will prepare his heart, and in His sight he will humble his soul.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, sperabit in illum, et sicut in conspectu ejus, sic et inveniet illi misericordiam.
verses.english: He who fears God will hope in Him, and as in His sight, so also he will find mercy.

verses.latin: Qui quaerit legem, replebitur cum illa: et qui in via illius est, diligetur.
verses.english: He who seeks the law will be filled with it: and he who is on its way will be loved.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, et intelliget judicium: et illuminabit quasi lux.
verses.english: He who fears God will understand judgment, and he will be enlightened like light.

verses.latin: Peccator legem spernit: et in ea inveniet secundum voluntatem suam.
verses.english: The sinner despises the law: and he will find in it according to his own will.

verses.latin: Vir impius non dirigit cor, et ideo non prosperabitur.
verses.english: The wicked man does not direct his heart, and therefore he will not prosper.

verses.latin: Vir impius cum contristatus fuerit, maledicit: et in amaritudine cordis inveniet.
verses.english: When a wicked man is saddened, he curses: and he will find bitterness of heart.

verses.latin: Hominis superbi non implebitur doctrina: et sicut in vas imperitiae, sic in eo non erit.
verses.english: The proud man will not be filled with doctrine: and as in a vessel of ignorance, so it will not be in him.

verses.latin: Sapiens verba sapientiae audiet, et probabit; et parabola in doctrina, et sensum intelliget.
verses.english: The wise man will hear the words of wisdom, and will test them; and a parable in doctrine, and he will understand the sense.

verses.latin: Omnis sapiens timorem Domini requiret, et cum justitia et judiciis suscipiet doctrinam.
verses.english: Every truly wise man will seek reverence for God, and he will learn wisdom and justice, and embrace discipline.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, faciet bona, et qui continens est in justitia, exaudiet orationes suas.
verses.english: Whoever fears God will do good, and whoever is careful to be just, will have his prayers heard.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, honorat parentes suos, et quasi domino deserviet his qui se genuerunt.
verses.english: Whoever fears God honors his parents, and is like a servant to them who gave him life.

verses.latin: In facto et in verbo honorabis patrem tuum et matrem tuam, et in omni patientia.
verses.english: In deed and word, honor your father and your mother, and in all patience.

verses.latin: Ut benedicat tibi benedictio Dei et maneat in novissimo tui.
verses.english: So that God's blessing may come to you, and remain with you until the end of your life.

verses.latin: Fili, in senectute adjuva patrem tuum, et non contristes eum in vita illius.
verses.english: Son, assist your father in his old age, and do not grieve him during his life.

verses.latin: Etiamsi defecerit sensu, miserere ejus, et ne spernas eum in virtute tua.
verses.english: Even if his mind has failed, have mercy on him, and do not despise him when you are strong.

verses.latin: Eleemosyna enim patris non erit in oblivionem, et pro peccatis matris tuæ quasi in memoria habitabis.
verses.english: For the alms of your father will not be forgotten, and for the sins of your mother, you will have a store of merit.

verses.latin: In die tribulationis tui memoraberis illorum, et sicut glacies in calore, sic dissipabuntur peccata tua.
verses.english: In the day of your tribulation, you will remember them, and as ice melts in the heat, so will your sins be forgiven.

verses.latin: Filius maledictus est, qui relinquit patrem, et qui exacerbat eam, quæ illum genuit.
verses.english: A son is cursed who forsakes his father, and who embitters her who gave him birth.

verses.latin: Opera tua fac in mansuetudine, et super homines glorificaberis.
verses.english: Perform your works with gentleness, and you will be honored by men.

verses.latin: Quanto magnus es, humilia te in omnibus, et coram Deo invenies gratiam.
verses.english: The greater you are, humble yourself in all things, and you will find favor before God.

verses.latin: Multus enim in potentia, et placitus illi est humilis.
verses.english: For God is great in power, and He favors those who are humble.

verses.latin: Qui scrutatur majestatem, opprimetur a gloria.
verses.english: Those who seek to understand His majesty are overwhelmed by His glory.

verses.latin: In investigando enim scrutantium est gloria, et in potentia, gloriam abscondet.
verses.english: For in the searching of those who seek, glory is hidden, and in power, He conceals glory.

verses.latin: In operibus tuis observa tempus, et ab his mala cave.
verses.english: Observe the proper time for your tasks, and beware of evil.

verses.latin: Ne facias, quæ sunt displicentia illi, et ne credas mala.
verses.english: Do not do what is displeasing to Him, and do not believe evil.

verses.latin: Ante omnia opera tua, cognosce finem tuum, et sic facias.
verses.english: Before all your works, know your end, and then act accordingly.

verses.latin: Ante judicium, operare justitiam, et antequam exquiras, justifica teipsum.
verses.english: Before judgment, do what is just, and before you investigate, justify yourself.

verses.latin: Ante languorem cura teipsum, et ante judicium examina teipsum, et invenies in conspectu Dei gratiam.
verses.english: Before illness, take care of yourself, and before judgment, examine yourself, and you will find favor in the sight of God.

verses.latin: Ante mortem operare, et secundum tempus tuum, quasi in transitu hominis moriaris.
verses.english: Before death, work, and at the appointed time, you will die like a passing man.

verses.latin: Sicut folia in flore, et fructus in arboris, ita et generationes carnis humanæ.
verses.english: As leaves on a blooming tree, and fruits, so are the generations of human flesh.

verses.latin: Generatio unius hominis et alia nascitur, et sicut folium de arboris cadit, ita et generatio carnis et sanguinis.
verses.english: One generation of man is born, and another follows, and as a leaf falls from a tree, so too does the generation of flesh and blood.

verses.latin: Unus alium sequitur, et ipse in generatione sua remanet, et postea quid erit ei in operibus suis?
verses.english: One follows another, and he himself remains in his own generation, and after that, what will he gain from his works?

verses.latin: Omnia de terra in terram convertuntur, et sicut aquæ, sic et justi.
verses.english: All things return to the earth, and like water, so are the just.

verses.latin: Multa opera iniquorum dissipabuntur, et justitia permanebit in æternum.
verses.english: The many works of the wicked will be scattered, but justice will remain forever.

verses.latin: Divitiæ impiorum siccantur quasi torrens, et quasi tonitruum magnum in pluvia sonabunt.
verses.english: The riches of the wicked dry up like a torrent, and will resound like a great thunder in the rain.

verses.latin: Aperientes manus, lætabuntur: et transgressores consumentur.
verses.english: They open their hands, and rejoice: but transgressors will be consumed.

verses.latin: Radix impiorum non dabit ramos, et rami inmundi dabunt fructum.
verses.english: The root of the wicked will not produce branches, and the unclean branches will not bear fruit.

verses.latin: Filii impiorum non multiplicabuntur, et gens impia non habebit radicem.
verses.english: The children of the wicked will not multiply, and an impious people will not have a root.

verses.latin: Filii justorum sunt sicut rami, plantatio sancta.
verses.english: The children of the just are like branches, a holy planting.

verses.latin: Et semen electorum sicut radix firmata.
verses.english: And the seed of the elect is like a strengthened root.

verses.latin: De fructu suo cognoscetur justus, et memoria illius in æternum non auferetur.
verses.english: The just man is known by his fruit, and his memory will not be taken away forever.

verses.latin: In judicio non timebit: et in novissimo stabit confidenter.
verses.english: In judgment, he will not fear, and he will stand confidently at the end.

verses.latin: Cor timoris Deum timens, et in mandatis illius invenietur sapientia.
verses.english: A heart that fears God, and in His commandments, will find wisdom.

verses.latin: Qui non timet Deum, non justificabitur: quoniam irruit illi furor ejus.
verses.english: He who does not fear God will not be justified, because His wrath falls upon him.

verses.latin: Patientia hominis cum proximo illius, et opera illius cum sensu.
verses.english: The patience of a man is seen in his dealings with his neighbor, and his works are marked with sense.

verses.latin: Hominem superbum odit Deus, et detestabiles illi sunt omnes iniquitates.
verses.english: God hates the proud man, and all wickedness is detestable to Him.

verses.latin: Gentem de injustis transtulit Deus, et plantavit humiles loco illorum.
verses.english: God has removed nations from the unjust, and has planted the humble in their place.

verses.latin: Gentibus dedit Deus terram, et in hereditatem suscepit Israël.
verses.english: God gave the land to the nations, and He took Israel as an inheritance.

verses.latin: Omnia opera hominum coram illo, et oculis ejus, qui deinceps stabunt, non abscondentur.
verses.english: All the works of men are before Him, and those who will stand before Him will not be hidden from His eyes.

verses.latin: A sæculo usque in sæculum respicit, et nihil est mirabile coram illo.
verses.english: From age to age, He looks, and nothing is a marvel before Him.

verses.latin: Non est dicendum, Quid est hoc? Quare hoc? quoniam in omni voluntate sua, Deus faciet.
verses.english: It is not right to say, 'What is this?' or 'Why is this?', because in all His will, God will act.

verses.latin: Benedictio hominis sicut flos, et justi sicut fructus permanebit.
verses.english: The blessing of a man is like a flower, and the just man's fruit will remain.

verses.latin: Noli dicere, Quid est hoc? Quid est illud? quoniam omnia in tempore suo probabuntur.
verses.english: Do not say, 'What is this?' or 'What is that?' because all things will be tested in their time.

verses.latin: In verbo suo statim justificabit Deus, et in momento accelerabit judicium.
verses.english: God will immediately justify in His word, and in a moment He will hasten judgment.

verses.latin: Improbans impius et cor iniquum multiplicabunt mala sibi.
verses.english: The wicked man who rejects God and has an iniquitous heart will multiply evils for himself.

verses.latin: Honorificate medicum propter necessitatem, quia et ipse creavit illum Deus.
verses.english: Honor the doctor, for his service is a necessity, because God Himself created the doctor to heal.

verses.latin: Et ab excelso est omnis curatio: a Deo est donum, et a rege accipietur.
verses.english: And all healing comes from the Most High: it is a gift from God, and the doctor will receive it.

verses.latin: Doctrina medici exaltabit caput ejus, et in conspectu magnatorum mirabitur.
verses.english: The doctor's knowledge will lift up his head, and he will be admired by the great.

verses.latin: Deus creavit de terra medicamenta, et vir prudens non abhorrebit illa.
verses.english: God made medicines from the earth, and a prudent man will not reject them.

verses.latin: Nonne a ligno amaritudinis aquae dulcoratae sunt: virtus illius manifesta est in operibus illius.
verses.english: Wasn't bitter water sweetened by a tree? The power of the doctor is seen in his works.

verses.latin: Dedit hominibus scientiam, ut glorificaretur in mirabilibus suis.
verses.english: God gave knowledge to men, so that they might be glorified in His wonders.

verses.latin: In illis curat et alleviat dolorem: et de illis composuit pharmacum, ut conteratur opus ejus.
verses.english: With them he cures and alleviates pain: and with them he makes a medicine, so that his work may be perfected.

verses.latin: Filius, in infirmitate tua ne negligaris: sed ora Deum, et ipse te sanabit.
verses.english: Son, when you are sick, do not be negligent: but pray to God, and He will heal you.

verses.latin: Averte a peccato et dirige manus tuas, et ab omni delicto munda cor.
verses.english: Turn away from sin and direct your hands, and cleanse your heart from every fault.

verses.latin: Da incensum et memoriam similae, et pingues fac sacrificium.
verses.english: Offer incense and a memorial of fine flour, and make a fat sacrifice.

verses.latin: Et da medicum locum illi, quia et ipse est necessarius: quoniam et ipse creavit illum.
verses.english: And give the doctor his place, because he too is necessary: because God Himself created him.

verses.latin: Est enim tempus, quando sunt in manibus illorum prosperitates.
verses.english: For there is a time when there are prosperities in their hands.

verses.latin: Et ipsi orabunt Deum, ut dirigat eis viam, et ad profectum sanationis et ad vitam.
verses.english: And they will pray to God, that He may direct them on the way, and to the progress of healing and to life.

verses.latin: Qui peccat in conspectu ejus, qui fecit illum, incidat in manus medici.
verses.english: He who sins against Him Who made him, let him fall into the hands of the doctor.

verses.latin: Fili, super mortuum effunde lacrimas, et quasi patiens mala, coepera plangere.
verses.english: Son, pour out tears over the dead, and begin to mourn as if you were suffering evil.

verses.latin: Et sepeli corpus ejus secundum consuetudinem: et non desidias super sepulturam illius.
verses.english: And bury his body according to custom: and do not be idle over his burial.

verses.latin: Amare fle, et plange illam, quoniam dignus est: et fac luctum ejus secundum merita illius, unum diem, vel duos, propter maledictionem, et consolari, postea de dolore.
verses.english: Mourn with love, and lament for her, because she is worthy: and make mourning for her according to her merits, for one or two days, because of the curse, and then be consoled after your sorrow.

verses.latin: A dolore enim mors, et vita hominis peccatoris.
verses.english: For sorrow causes death, and the life of a sinful man.

verses.latin: Post mortem hominis, requiescit hereditas illius: et ante mortem ejus, vita illius.
verses.english: After the death of a man, his inheritance rests: and before his death, his life.

verses.latin: Cum vivit, et spirat, mutatur: et laborat, et turbatur.
verses.english: When he lives, and breathes, he is changed: and he labors, and is troubled.

verses.latin: Sapiens in doctrina, et in sapientia abundans, ipse operabitur justitiam.
verses.english: A wise man in doctrine, and abounding in wisdom, he will work righteousness.

verses.latin: Qui respicit ad legem Altissimi, acquiret illam: et qui versatur in illis, glorificabitur.
verses.english: He who looks to the law of the Most High, will acquire it: and he who is occupied with it, will be glorified.

verses.latin: Qui operantur in illa, dicent: Quoniam non est labor in illa: et filii sapientiae justificantur.
verses.english: Those who work in it, will say: Because there is no labor in it: and the children of wisdom are justified.

verses.latin: Qui praeparat verba, exaudiatur: et qui in orationibus suis perseverat, obtinebit.
verses.english: He who prepares his words, will be heard: and he who perseveres in his prayers, will obtain.

verses.latin: Cor illius scrutabitur mane: et in doctrina ejus perseverabit.
verses.english: His heart will search at dawn: and he will persevere in his doctrine.

verses.latin: Sapiens cor quaeret bona: et omnibus qui in illa versantur, non relinquetur.
verses.english: A wise heart will seek good things: and for all who are occupied with it, it will not be forsaken.

verses.latin: Sicut vas figuli, et opera illius: omnia opera illius in voluntate ipsius.
verses.english: Like the work of a potter, and his work: all his works are in his will.

verses.latin: Omnia opera illius in voluntate ipsius: et mandavit, et in voluntate ipsius fient.
verses.english: All his works are in his will: and He commanded, and they will be done in His will.

verses.latin: Dilectus est Dominus operibus sanctis: et de omnibus electis ejus, dilectionem habet.
verses.english: The Lord loves holy works: and He has love for all his chosen ones.

verses.latin: Aquae et ignis, et gladius et bella, et fames et pestilentia: haec omnia creata sunt in usum impiorum.
verses.english: Water and fire, and sword and wars, and famine and pestilence: all these were created for the use of the wicked.

verses.latin: In malum mutata sunt: et ad punitionem impiorum.
verses.english: They were changed for evil: and for the punishment of the wicked.

verses.latin: Omnia, quae creata sunt, in duo sunt: boni et mali.
verses.english: All things that are created are in two: good and evil.

verses.latin: Hujuscemodi sunt omnia opera impiorum: et contraria operibus sanctorum.
verses.english: Such are all the works of the wicked: and contrary to the works of the saints.

verses.latin: Non est mirabile quid gloria detur in ictu et in tempore: quippe cum adest, non est mirum.
verses.english: It is not wonderful that glory is given in a moment and in time: since when it is present, it is not wonderful.

verses.latin: Melius est ergo, ut in diebus bonis operetur in malis.
verses.english: It is better, therefore, that he should work in evil in good days.

verses.latin: Opera justi sicut sol: et opera impiorum, nox et tenebrae.
verses.english: The works of the just are like the sun: and the works of the wicked, night and darkness.

verses.latin: Melius est tibi, ut conservare animam tuam, quam in conspectu impiorum ambulare.
verses.english: It is better for you, to preserve your soul, than to walk in the sight of the wicked.

verses.latin: Vir sapiens in verbo detestabilis est: et insipiens non permanebit in eo.
verses.english: A wise man in speech is detestable: and a fool will not remain in it.

verses.latin: Sapiens in verbo, et in doctrina odibilis fiet.
verses.english: The wise man in speech, and in doctrine will become hateful.

verses.latin: Dedit sensum sapienti, et invenit thesaurum sapientiæ.
verses.english: He gave sense to the wise, and he found the treasure of wisdom.

verses.latin: Qui enim operatur in voluntate, non perficitur in opere: et qui irascitur, corrumpet animam.
verses.english: For he who works in the will, does not perfect himself in the work: and he who is angry, corrupts his soul.

verses.latin: Cor patientis, usque ad tempus: et postea illi reddetur gaudium.
verses.english: The heart of the patient, is until the time: and then joy will be returned to him.

verses.latin: Modica est, usque ad tempus, loquela ejus: et postea stillabit labia illius verba sapientiæ.
verses.english: His speech is brief, until the time: and afterwards his lips will drip words of wisdom.

verses.latin: In thesauris sapientiæ, verba sapientiæ.
verses.english: In the treasures of wisdom are the words of wisdom.

verses.latin: Thesaurus impietatis, odibilis est, qui enim in illis versatur, detestabilis est.
verses.english: The treasure of impiety is hateful, for he who is occupied with them is detestable.

verses.latin: Fili, si habueris, operare cum timore, et omnia fac in fide.
verses.english: Son, if you have, work with fear, and do all things in faith.

verses.latin: Omni opere tuo, respice ad novissimum tuum, et in aeternum non peccabis.
verses.english: In all your work, look to your end, and you will not sin for eternity.

verses.latin: Sapientia iusti enarrabit iudicium suum, et exaudiet congregatio laudem illius.
verses.english: The wisdom of the just will explain its judgment, and the assembly will hear his praise.

verses.latin: In ore impii non laudaberis, quoniam ipse est pater iniquitatis.
verses.english: You will not be praised by the mouth of the wicked, for he is the father of iniquity.

verses.latin: Laus in sensu iusti erit, et gentes loquentur sapientiam illius.
verses.english: Praise will be in the mind of the just, and the nations will speak of his wisdom.

verses.latin: Os impii quasi lignum mortui: ipsi autem viderunt et gaudebunt.
verses.english: The mouth of the wicked is like dead wood: they will see, and they will rejoice.

verses.latin: Non dabis impio divitias, et iustus non videbit iniquitatem.
verses.english: You will not give riches to the wicked, and the just will not see iniquity.

verses.latin: Odiabit impius iustum, et iustus odio habebit illum.
verses.english: The wicked will hate the just, and the just will hate him.

verses.latin: Simile est impio et iniquo simul.
verses.english: The wicked and the iniquitous are alike.

verses.latin: Tribulationes iusti de manu impii: flagella et mors.
verses.english: The tribulations of the just are from the hand of the wicked: scourges and death.

verses.latin: Viri sapientes intelligunt sapientiam, et proferunt in conspectu dominorum: et iudicium et doctrinam iustitiae et iudicii.
verses.english: Wise men understand wisdom and put it forth in the sight of lords: and judgement, and the teaching of justice and judgement.

verses.latin: Sperant in Deo, et salvabuntur: et custodiunt mandata ipsius, et invenient eum.
verses.english: They hope in God, and they will be saved: and they keep his commandments, and they will find him.

verses.latin: Qui timent Dominum, invenient iudicium, et illuminabunt iustitias suas sicut ignis.
verses.english: Those who fear the Lord will find judgement and will illuminate their justice like fire.

verses.latin: Peccator non respiciet sapientiam, sed vocabitur iniquitas sua.
verses.english: The sinner will not regard wisdom, but his iniquity will be called upon him.

verses.latin: Filius stulti disperdet patrem suum, et qui non habet intellectum, confundet matrem suam.
verses.english: The son of a fool will destroy his father, and he who has no understanding will shame his mother.

verses.latin: Va vobis, stulti, quoniam non observastis legem Dei: cum enim cecideritis, non eritis.
verses.english: Woe to you, fools, because you have not observed the law of God: when you fall, you will not be.

verses.latin: Melius est homini sine sapientia, et non habenti sapientiam, quam habenti et peccanti.
verses.english: It is better for a man without wisdom, and not having wisdom, than having it and sinning.

verses.latin: Melius est homini qui non habet sapientiam timere, quam habenti et contristare.
verses.english: It is better for a man who does not have wisdom to fear, than to have it and be saddened.

verses.latin: Melius est homini sine sapientia et peccanti, quam sapientiam et peccata multiplicare.
verses.english: It is better for a man without wisdom and sinning, than to multiply wisdom and sins.

verses.latin: Ipse te metuat, et sustineat in conspectu Dei, et in iudicio illius sapientia liberabit illum.
verses.english: Let him fear himself, and sustain himself in the sight of God, and in his judgement wisdom will liberate him.

verses.latin: Sapientia hominum est, cognoscere viam suam: et agnoscere virtutem ejus, qui fecit illam.
verses.english: The wisdom of men is to know their way: and to recognize the power of him who made it.

verses.latin: Qui vias suas novit, sciet leges illius, et in iudicio illius ostendet gloriam.
verses.english: He who knows his ways will know his laws, and will show glory in his judgement.

verses.latin: Qui non cognoscit sapientiam, nec virtutem illius, interibit in iudicio.
verses.english: He who does not know wisdom, nor its power, will perish in judgement.

verses.latin: Filius meus, noli in operibus tuis habere multa: et si multa feceris, non eris immunis a culpa: et si sequeris, non attinges.
verses.english: My son, do not have many things in your works: and if you do many things, you will not be free from blame: and if you follow after, you will not attain.

verses.latin: Ne festines ad divitias, nec ad potentem in iudicio.
verses.english: Do not hasten after riches, nor the powerful in judgement.

verses.latin: Ne contemnas pauperem in iudicio: quoniam humilis est, et gratiam illius, et non contristes pauperes in conspectu tuo.
verses.english: Do not despise the poor in judgement: because he is humble and you will be thankful to him, and do not grieve the poor in your sight.

verses.latin: Ne iniuriam facias contra animam esurientem: et ne irrites hominem in necessitate.
verses.english: Do not do injury against a hungry soul: and do not provoke a man in need.

verses.latin: Animum contristatum ne amplies: et noli differre propter indigentem.
verses.english: Do not add to a saddened mind: and do not delay because of the needy.

verses.latin: Pro anima pauperi ne inmorieris, et noli avertere oculos tuos ab egeno.
verses.english: Do not die for the soul of the poor, and do not turn your eyes away from the needy.

verses.latin: Aversaberis a lingua contumeliosa: et noli communicare cum eo qui detrahit, quia perditio operis ejus est.
verses.english: Turn away from a reviling tongue: and do not associate with him who slanders, because the ruin of his work is in his mouth.

verses.latin: Non quaerito peccatum, et de illis quae ad te non pertinent, noli scrutari.
verses.english: Do not seek sin, and do not scrutinize those things which do not pertain to you.

verses.latin: Fili, non sint tibi multa negotia: si enim multiplicaveris, non eris immunis a culpa: et si sequeris, non attinges, et non effugies, et non assequeris.
verses.english: Son, do not have many business dealings: for if you multiply them, you will not be free from blame: and if you follow after them, you will not attain, and you will not escape, and you will not succeed.

verses.latin: Multi laboraverunt ut ditarentur, et vita illorum ad nihilum: et qui sunt illi?
verses.english: Many have labored to become rich, and their life is for nothing: and who are they?

verses.latin: Alii autem laboraverunt et non festinaverunt, et alii profecerunt, et non invenerunt.
verses.english: But others have labored and did not hasten, and others progressed, and did not find.

verses.latin: Alii autem laboraverunt, et non habuerunt: et in hoc quoque laboraverunt.
verses.english: But others have labored and did not have: and in this too they labored.

verses.latin: Alii operati sunt, et curaverunt, et non curaverunt: et in hoc quoque laboraverunt.
verses.english: Others worked and were careful, and did not take care: and in this too they labored.

verses.latin: Vidi quendam qui laborabat in his quae praeparaverat, et non habebat ut comederet.
verses.english: I saw a certain man who labored in those things which he had prepared, and did not have food to eat.

verses.latin: Haec omnia in timore Dei: et in voluntate illius.
verses.english: All these things are in the fear of God: and in his will.

verses.latin: Sicut solis opera, et lunae, et stellarum, et nubium, et venti, et aquarum, et spirituum, et tonitruorum, et fulgurum.
verses.english: Like the works of the sun, and the moon, and the stars, and the clouds, and the wind, and the waters, and the spirits, and the thunders, and the lightnings.

verses.latin: Qui faciunt in tempore suo, et convertentur in die suo.
verses.english: Who do these in their time, and they will return on their day.

verses.latin: Qui de Deo agunt, et mandata illius, in operibus suis benedicentur.
