verses.english: Those who act from God, and his commandments, will be blessed in their works.

verses.latin: Magna creavit Dominus sapientiam, et adperfectus est in operibus suis.
verses.english: God made great wisdom, and is perfect in all His works.

verses.latin: Quis numerabit harenam maris, et guttas pluviae, et dies saeculi?
verses.english: Who can count the grains of sand in the sea, the drops of rain, and the days of the world?

verses.latin: Quis investigabit altitudinem caeli, et latitudinem terrae, et profundum abyssi?
verses.english: Who can measure the height of the sky, the breadth of the earth, or the depth of the abyss?

verses.latin: Sapientia prior omnia creata est: et intellectus prudentiae ex aeterno.
verses.english: Wisdom was created before everything: understanding of prudence comes from eternity.

verses.latin: Fons sapientiae verbum Dei in excelsis, et semita illius mandata aeterna.
verses.english: The source of wisdom is the Word of God in the highest heavens, and its path is eternal law.

verses.latin: Cui revelata est radix sapientiae, et quis cognovit astutias ejus?
verses.english: To whom was the root of wisdom revealed, and who has known its shrewdness?

verses.latin: Unus est altissimus creator omnipotens, rex potens, et timendus valde, sedens super thronum ejus et dominans.
verses.english: There is only one Almighty Creator, a powerful King, greatly feared, who sits on his throne and rules.

verses.latin: Qui creavit illam in spiritu sancto, et vidit illam, et dinumeravit, et mensus est illam.
verses.english: He created wisdom in the Holy Spirit, saw it, counted it, and measured it.

verses.latin: Et effudit illam super omnia opera sua, et super omnem carnem secundum datum suum, et praebuit illam diligentibus se.
verses.english: He poured wisdom out over all His works, over all flesh according to His gift, and gave it to those who love Him.

verses.latin: Timor Domini gloria, et gloriatio, et laetitia, et corona exsultationis.
verses.english: Fear of the Lord is glory, boasting, joy, and the crown of exultation.

verses.latin: Timor Domini delectabit cor, et dabit laetitiam, et gaudium, et longitudinem dierum.
verses.english: Fear of the Lord will delight the heart, give joy, gladness, and length of days.

verses.latin: Timenti Deum bene erit in extremis, et in die defunctionis suae benedicetur.
verses.english: It will go well for those who fear God in the end, and they will be blessed on the day of their death.

verses.latin: Initium timoris Dei, est electio illius: et diligunt eum per sanctificationem.
verses.english: The beginning of the fear of God is the choice of it: and they love Him through sanctification.

verses.latin: Sapientiae dilectio, honor est: et quibus apparuerit diligunt eam.
verses.english: The love of wisdom is honor: and those to whom she appears love her.

verses.latin: Timor Dei, mandatorum Dei est: et qui tenet illum, quasi in paradiso morabitur.
verses.english: Fear of God is the fulfillment of God's commandments: and whoever holds it, lives as if in paradise.

verses.latin: Omnis sensatus, et qui intelligit sapientiam, abominationem faciet malum.
verses.english: Every sensible person, and whoever understands wisdom, will hate evil.

verses.latin: Fons sapientiae, verbum Dei in excelsis: et semita illius, mandata aeterna.
verses.english: The source of wisdom is the Word of God in the highest heavens: and its path is eternal law.

verses.latin: Cui revelata sunt radices sapientiae, et quis cognovit astutias ejus?
verses.english: To whom are the roots of wisdom revealed, and who has known its shrewdness?

verses.latin: Unus est excelsus creator omnipotens, rex potens et timendus valde, sedens super thronum ejus, et dominans Deus.
verses.english: There is one most high, almighty creator, a powerful king greatly to be feared, sitting upon His throne, and ruling as God.

verses.latin: Qui creavit illam in Spiritu sancto, et vidit illam et dinumeravit, et mensus est illam.
verses.english: He created it in the Holy Spirit, and saw it, and counted it, and measured it.

verses.latin: Et effudit illam super omnia opera sua, et super omnem carnem secundum datum suum: et praebuit illam diligentibus se.
verses.english: And He poured it out over all His works, and over all flesh according to His gift: and He gave it to those who love Him.

verses.latin: Timor Dei gloria, et gloriatio, et laetitia, et corona exsultationis.
verses.english: Fear of God is glory, boasting, joy, and the crown of exultation.

verses.latin: Timor Dei delectat cor, et dat laetitiam, et gaudium, et longitudinem dierum.
verses.english: Fear of God delights the heart, and gives joy, gladness, and length of days.

verses.latin: Timenti Deum bene erit in extremis, et in die defunctionis suae benedicetur.
verses.english: It will be well for those who fear God in the end, and they will be blessed on the day of their death.

verses.latin: Initium timoris Dei, est electio illius: et diligunt eum per sanctificationem.
verses.english: The beginning of the fear of God is the choice of it: and they love Him through sanctification.

verses.latin: Sapientiae dilectio, honor est: et quibus apparuerit diligunt eam.
verses.english: The love of wisdom is honor: and those to whom she appears love her.

verses.latin: Timor Dei, mandatorum Dei est: et qui tenet illum, quasi in paradiso morabitur.
verses.english: The fear of God is the fulfillment of God's commandments: and whoever holds it, dwells as if in paradise.

verses.latin: Omnis sensatus et qui intelligit sapientiam, abominationem faciet malum.
verses.english: Every sensible person and whoever understands wisdom, will hate evil.

verses.latin: Fili, si susceperis animam tuam, serva illam a concupiscentia, et da illi quod placet illi.
verses.english: Son, if you receive your soul, keep it from lust, and give it what it desires.

verses.latin: Non dederis concupiscentiae animam tuam, et a voluntate tua averte te.
verses.english: Do not give your soul to lust, and turn away from your own will.

verses.latin: Si dederis animam tuam appetitui, faciet te gaudium inimicis tuis.
verses.english: If you give your soul to appetite, it will make your enemies happy.

verses.latin: Noli delectari in voluptatibus, et non te declinent sumptus illorum.
verses.english: Do not delight in pleasures, and do not let their expenses turn you aside.

verses.latin: Noli in paupertate fieri mendicus: melius est mori quam indigere.
verses.english: Do not become a beggar in poverty: it is better to die than to be in need.

verses.latin: Vita hominis qui in opera sua, et qui in agricultura sua, et qui in vineis sua, et qui in opere artificii, et in divitiis sua.
verses.english: The life of a man who is in his work, who is in his agriculture, who is in his vineyards, and who is in the work of artifice, and in his riches.

verses.latin: Melius est operari quam ire mendicare: et sub aliorum mensa sperare.
verses.english: It is better to work than to go begging: and to hope under the table of others.

verses.latin: In vita illorum qui in opera sua, et qui in agricultura sua, et qui in vineis sua, et qui in opere artificii, et in divitiis suis.
verses.english: In the life of those who are in their work, and who are in their agriculture, and who are in their vineyards, and who are in the work of artifice, and in their riches.

verses.latin: In opere suo omnes invenitur sapientia.
verses.english: In their work all find wisdom.

verses.latin: Pauper in opere suo, et qui in labore operatur, melior est ditis errantis.
verses.english: The poor in his work, and those who work in labor, is better than the rich who err.

verses.latin: Filius, custodi animam tuam in pace, et metue Deum.
verses.english: Son, keep your soul in peace, and fear God.

verses.latin: A splendore ejus, et spiritus sanctus, et timor ejus, et non est in praeceptis ejus.
verses.english: From His splendor comes the Holy Spirit, and His fear, and there is nothing in His precepts.

verses.latin: Omnis anima diligit sapientiam cum timore: et qui custodit eam, mirabitur.
verses.english: Every soul loves wisdom with fear: and whoever keeps it will be amazed.

verses.latin: Qui tenet sapientiam, vitam possidebit.
verses.english: Whoever holds wisdom will possess life.

verses.latin: Qui autem timuerit Deum, utraque obtinebit: et qui tenet illam, et illa illuminabitur.
verses.english: But whoever fears God will obtain both: and whoever holds it will be enlightened.

verses.latin: Qui tenet illam, et illa illuminabitur: et sicut mater occurret illi.
verses.english: Whoever holds her will be enlightened: and she will meet him like a mother.

verses.latin: Cibabit illum pane vitae, et aquam intellectus dabit illi bibere.
verses.english: She will feed him with the bread of life, and give him the water of understanding to drink.

verses.latin: Confidet in illa, et non confundetur: et exaltabit illam, et inter homines dominabitur: et aperiet os suum in oratione, et exaudietur usque ad Deum.
verses.english: He will trust in her, and will not be ashamed: and he will exalt her, and will rule among men: and will open his mouth in prayer, and will be heard even by God.

verses.latin: Et postea diriget mentem suam ad illam: et in scientia illius conversabitur.
verses.english: And afterwards he will direct his mind to her: and he will converse in her knowledge.

verses.latin: Si diligis, fili, animam tuam, custodi castitatem, et da illi quod placet.
verses.english: If you love your soul, son, keep chastity, and give her what pleases.

verses.latin: Si concupiscentiam animam tuam, recede a voluntate tua, et a voluntate tua.
verses.english: If you lust in your soul, depart from your will, and from your own will.

verses.latin: Hoc est bonum hominis bona conscientia, et in omni justitia honor est.
verses.english: This is the good of man, a good conscience, and honor is in all justice.

verses.latin: Mortis memoria, et vita, et sensus in malo, et bonum in omni tempore:
verses.english: Remembering death and life—this is the beginning of wisdom.

verses.latin: et bonum aduersus malos, et bonum in omni tempore.
verses.english: In life, be mindful of good things and avoid evil.

verses.latin: Mala peccatorum inimici sunt ipsis: et diligunt qui faciunt iniquitatem.
verses.english: The sins of the wicked are their enemies, and they love those who commit evil.

verses.latin: Omnis caro diligit sibi similem, et omnis homo diliget proximum suum.
verses.english: Every living creature loves its own kind, and every person loves their neighbor.

verses.latin: Omnis caro ad similem suum conjungitur, et omnis homo socio sibi.
verses.english: All living things associate with their own, and people associate with their equals.

verses.latin: Quid societas lupi et agni? Sic et peccator iusto.
verses.english: What fellowship can exist between a wolf and a lamb? So too, between a sinner and a righteous person.

verses.latin: Quid pax hyaenae et canis? Sic et peccatoribus pax.
verses.english: What peace is there between a hyena and a dog? That is how it is with sinners.

verses.latin: Quis mundus cum immundo? et quid communio veri et mendacii?
verses.english: Who can associate with the unclean? What common ground is there between truth and lies?

verses.latin: Non est pactum inter iustum et peccatorem, et nequaquam concordia in malis.
verses.english: There is no agreement between a righteous person and a sinner, and no harmony among the wicked.

verses.latin: Leo in praedam asinis: sic peccatores qui operantur iniquitatem.
verses.english: A lion stalks donkeys in search of prey; that's how sinners hunt those who do evil.

verses.latin: Suggillatio in impiis, et in peccatoribus exprobratio.
verses.english: Scorn is for the wicked, and reproach for sinners.

verses.latin: Ne contristes cor tuum, in luxuria:
verses.english: Do not let your heart be filled with sorrow.

verses.latin: et ne inclines te in viis eius.
verses.english: Do not stray onto their paths.

verses.latin: Ne adsideas in viis peccatorum, ne forte incidas in laqueos eorum.
verses.english: Don't linger on the paths of sinners, lest you fall into their traps.

verses.latin: Recede ab eis, et non deponaris: et eris a malis securus.
verses.english: Turn away from them, or you will be lost. You will be safe from evil.

verses.latin: Ne accedas ad illos, ne forte ames peccata eorum.
verses.english: Do not go near them, lest you come to love their sins.

verses.latin: et ne capiaris in perditionibus eorum.
verses.english: And you will be taken by their destruction.

verses.latin: Non intromittas animam tuam in potestatem illorum.
verses.english: Do not let your soul fall into their power.

verses.latin: et cave ne ingrediaris in semitas eorum.
verses.english: Be careful not to go down their paths.

verses.latin: Noli transgredi vias impiorum, ne pedes tui labantur.
verses.english: Do not stray from the paths of the wicked, lest your feet slip.

verses.latin: Omnia opera tua fac in fide: quia haec est via mandatorum.
verses.english: Do all your work in faith; this is the way of the commandments.

verses.latin: Fides est salutis conservatio.
verses.english: Faith is the preservation of salvation.

verses.latin: Opera iustitiae illuminant viam.
verses.english: Works of justice light the way.

verses.latin: Qui facit bene, parat sibi praemia.
verses.english: Those who do good will prepare rewards for themselves.

verses.latin: Qui operatur iusta, replebitur ex illis.
verses.english: Those who do what is right will be filled with them.

verses.latin: Quasi aqua sitiens, ita peccator.
verses.english: Like water for the thirsty, so is the sinner.

verses.latin: Contemplatur quasi amara, et sperat quod non potest obtinere.
verses.english: They look at bitter things, but hope for what they cannot obtain.

verses.latin: Qui relinquit legem, contemnit manum ipsius: et qui ambulat in viis impiorum, offendit illum.
verses.english: Those who forsake the law despise His hand, and those who walk in the ways of the wicked offend Him.

verses.latin: Qui convertit cor suum in vanitates, multiplicat delicta.
verses.english: Those who turn their hearts to vanity multiply their sins.

verses.latin: Bonis boni, et malis mali retribuuntur.
verses.english: Good is returned to the good, and evil to the evil.

verses.latin: Iniquitas peccatorum non expiatur, et vir pius gratiam accipiet.
verses.english: The iniquity of sinners is not wiped away, but a pious man will receive grace.

verses.latin: Bonum hominis bonum datur, et iniquitas impii reservatur.
verses.english: The good of a person is given, and the iniquity of the impious is reserved.

verses.latin: Noli dicere: A Deo recessi, et quid occultum habeo, et quis mei memoratur?
verses.english: Do not say: “I have turned away from God. What is hidden from Him? Who remembers me?”

verses.latin: Cogita, quia videor in conspectu eius, et opera mea omnia testimonium perhibent.
verses.english: Think that you are seen by Him, and all your works bear witness.

verses.latin: Noli dicere: Deus non aspicit, et aversis faciem suam, et non respicit vias meas.
verses.english: Do not say: “God does not see, and He has turned away His face, and does not look at my ways.”

verses.latin: Quia omnia opera tua coram illo, et in conspectu eius omnia disponuntur.
verses.english: Because all your works are before Him, and all things are arranged in His sight.

verses.latin: Ante faciem eius, in saeculum saeculi opera tua, et quae feceris, in illis glorificaberis.
verses.english: Your works will always be before Him. You will be glorified for what you have done.

verses.latin: De operibus manuum ejus, exquirent omnes sapientes, et omnis terra plena est gloria illius.
verses.english: The wise contemplate all of His works, and the entire world is filled with His glory.

verses.latin: Super aquas extendit manum suam, et per voluntatem suam composuit omnia. Dixit enim omnipotens, et facta sunt.
verses.english: He established the universe; through His will, He created everything. Indeed, the Almighty spoke, and all things were made.

verses.latin: Verbum omnium gloriosorum operum ejus, qui et, qualis est, quis enarrabit?
verses.english: Who can ever explain the beauty of all His glorious works, or the full measure of His glory?

verses.latin: Firmamentum caeli, altitudo et sedes, et spectaculum gloriae illius.
verses.english: The sky's vastness, its height, the foundations of its splendor are the wonders He created.

verses.latin: Sol, et aspectus ejus, nuntians in exitu, quam mirabile opus.
verses.english: The sun, when it appears in the universe, proclaims how wondrous is God's creation.

verses.latin: Meridies, et meridiana dies, aestus, et quiete in commutatione temporum.
verses.english: Midday's heat, and the sun's warmth in the changing seasons, is yet another example of His work.

verses.latin: Conpunit frigus, et gelu, et nix. Quae viis suis, et temporibus suis.
verses.english: He created frost and cold, and snow. They have their own courses, and their appointed seasons.

verses.latin: Spiritus, et ventus, et nebulae. Quae disponit Deus ad opera sua.
verses.english: The wind, the clouds, and the spirit are all at His command.

verses.latin: Deinde, et spiritus, qui creavit omnia. Quae creavit ad gloriam suam.
verses.english: All of these things give glory to God, who is the Spirit and Creator of all things.

verses.latin: Sonitus tonitrui, ad tempus dirigit, et procellas, quae furunt in virtute sua.
verses.english: God directs thunder at the appointed time, and creates tempests through His power.

verses.latin: Flumina, quoque ad tempus dirigit, et qui, operata sunt in judicio suo. Et dirigit eos.
verses.english: He created the rivers, too, and directs them to serve His judgment, so that they may never fail.

verses.latin: Opera, qua in operibus suis, et lucerna in die, et sol in mutando.
verses.english: Day and night display God's works, just as the sun always shines.

verses.latin: Animal, et cor, cogitationes, et sensus, qua, in die sua, et qua in noctu.
verses.english: All living creatures think and feel in their own time, both day and night.

verses.latin: Maris, qua in mari, et profunditas ejus, et qui exinde, et qui exinde, et qui exinde.
verses.english: The sea with its depths, and its creatures, shows us His wonders.

verses.latin: Spiritus, et ignis, et ventus, in die judicii, quae disponit Deus, ad vindictam.
verses.english: The Holy Spirit, fire, and wind are all at God’s disposal on the day of judgment for vengeance.

verses.latin: Aquam et nubium, et qui pro cibo, et qui pro operibus. Quibus homines abunde utantur.
verses.english: God created water and clouds to give food to men.

verses.latin: Semen est hominis, et vita in terra, et quibus, ad salutem.
verses.english: He created seeds, and gave life on earth to men and women for their salvation.

verses.latin: Misit in gentibus, qui multos operantur. Quae operantur in judicio suo.
verses.english: He sends His people among the nations. Through these people, God’s judgment is at work.

verses.latin: Quid, et opera hominis, et quid in eo opera, et quid in eo opera. Et quid in eo, qua, in eo.
verses.english: And what does the work of man accomplish? His works are within him.

verses.latin: Qui creavit, et ex hoc, et qui operatus est, in virtute sua.
verses.english: He created man from the earth, and gave him strength.

verses.latin: Qui dixit: Ego creavi, omnia. Et omnis terra plenum est.
verses.english: He said: “I created all things, and the whole earth is full of my power.”

verses.latin: Sapiens fortis, et justus, et timens Deum, et in diebus justorum, et in diebus justorum.
verses.english: He is wise, strong, just, and fears God. And in the days of the just, he will be honored.

verses.latin: Qui timens Deum, qua, in eo. Et scientia legis, qua, in lege.
verses.english: The man who fears God will be honored, and the knowledge of the Law will be in him.

verses.latin: Qui non timet Deum, non est timor in illo, et zelus in ira, et zelus in ira.
verses.english: There is no fear of God in those who do not fear Him; instead, there is wrath, envy, and conflict.

verses.latin: Omnis dies, qua, in malis. Et dies in impiis, et dies in impiis.
verses.english: Evil days are coming, and the wicked will be destroyed.

verses.latin: Omnia creata sunt, et qua, in diebus eorum.
verses.english: All things are created and will endure to their proper time.

verses.latin: Unus, et qui, in diebus iniquorum.
verses.english: For one is not like another, and one’s day of death is approaching.

verses.latin: Duo genera, et qui, et mala, et qui, et qui, et qui.
verses.english: There are two types of creation: good and evil.

verses.latin: Dominus judicavit, et qua, in diebus eorum.
verses.english: The Lord will judge, and each man will receive what he has done.

verses.latin: Quis, et qui, et in corde, et qui, in eo, et in eo.
verses.english: The Lord will also judge the heart and mind.

verses.latin: Et, et qui, et qui, et, et qui, et qui, et in eo.
verses.english: Those with good hearts will receive the reward of their goodness, but those with evil hearts will receive their punishment.

verses.latin: Malam est, et qui, et qui, et, et iniqua.
verses.english: Evil is the cause of all wicked deeds.

verses.latin: Et, et qua, et qui, et qui, et, et qui, et qui, et qui, et qui.
verses.english: All creation is subject to sin, and all that is done is to be judged according to what is done.

verses.latin: Mali est, et qua, et qui, et qui, et, et iniqua.
verses.english: The wicked will receive evil for evil.

verses.latin: Et et qui, et qui, et qui, et qui, et qui, et in eo.
verses.english: The good will receive good for their good deeds.

verses.latin: Et, et qui, et qui, et, et qui, et qui, et qui.
verses.english: The Lord sees with a discerning eye and will judge justly.

verses.latin: Dominus, qui, et, et qua, et qui, et in diebus eorum.
verses.english: The Lord will always remember what each person does, and in their days he will judge.

verses.latin: Non est, et qui, et qua, et qui, et qui, et iniqua, et qui, et qui.
verses.english: There is no remembrance of what has been done, and no respite from the punishment.

verses.latin: Fili, ne bona tua, et qui, et qui, et qui, et qui, et qui.
verses.english: My son, do good deeds, and seek the counsel of the wise.

verses.latin: Qui, et qui, et qui, et, et qui, et, et qui, et, et iniqua, et, et iniqua.
verses.english: Be cautious, and do not let your heart be swayed by any evil or wickedness.

verses.latin: In opere tuo, et adimples. Et, et qui, et qui, et, et qui, et qui, et qui.
verses.english: Carry out your work well, and do not hesitate. Perform what you have been assigned to do.

verses.latin: De his quae, et pudorem, et qui, et qui, et qui, et in eo.
verses.english: Do not be ashamed of these words; have no shame in keeping His commandments.

verses.latin: Ne qua, et qui, et qua, et, et iniqua, et, et iniqua, et, et iniqua.
verses.english: Do not be ashamed of the Lord’s truth and His covenant, and speak the truth in the sight of all men.

verses.latin: Et, et, et qua, et qua, et, et qua, et qui, et, et qui.
verses.english: Do not be ashamed to speak the truth, and do not conceal what you see.

verses.latin: Et, et, et qua, et qui, et iniqua, et, et iniqua.
verses.english: Do not be ashamed to be questioned, and never be afraid to be just.

verses.latin: Et, et, et qua, et qui, et iniqua, et, et iniqua.
verses.english: And do not be ashamed to keep the Sabbath and the Lord’s feasts.

verses.latin: Et, et qua, et qui, et, et qui, et qui, et qui.
verses.english: And do not be ashamed to pay your vows, and to offer what you promised.

verses.latin: Et, et qui, et qua, et qui, et iniqua, et, et iniqua, et, et iniqua.
verses.english: And do not be ashamed to pray to God and give alms, and to pay them.

verses.latin: Et, et qua, et qui, et qui, et, et qui, et qui, et qui.
verses.english: Do not be ashamed to visit the sick, and to care for your deceased.

verses.latin: Ne qua, et, et qui, et iniqua, et, et qui, et qui, et, et iniqua.
verses.english: Do not be ashamed to be counted among the blessed and just.

verses.latin: Ne qua, et qua, et qui, et qui, et, et qui, et, et qui.
verses.english: Do not be ashamed to speak boldly, and do not hesitate to speak the truth.

verses.latin: Mala, et et qua, et qui, et, et qui, et, et iniqua, et, et iniqua.
verses.english: But be ashamed of evil, wickedness, and injustice.

verses.latin: Et, et qui, et qua, et qui, et qui, et, et iniqua, et, et iniqua.
verses.english: Do not be ashamed to correct the foolish, or to rebuke those who are unjust.

verses.latin: Serva, et quibus, et qui, et, et qui, et, et qui.
verses.english: Follow your training, and do not be afraid to speak in the sight of all, and offer what is commanded.

verses.latin: Dominus, et qui, et qua, et qui, et qui, et qui, et iniqua.
verses.english: The Lord is always with you, and His word gives you strength.

verses.latin: Magnificus est sol in exitu suo, mirabilis aspectus eius, cum exiit.
verses.english: The sun is magnificent as it rises; its appearance is wonderful when it emerges.

verses.latin: Meridie exurit terram, et quis sustinebit calorem eius?
verses.english: At noon it scorches the land, and who can endure its heat?

verses.latin: Furnus est operans in aestu exhalationis: sol in montibus tribus.
verses.english: The sun is like a furnace that provides heat. It is in the mountains, radiating outwards.

verses.latin: Aurea corona circumdans illud: quod perficitur in tempore suo.
verses.english: The sun is like a golden crown. Its position is perfect in its season.

verses.latin: Narrat de operibus suis, et de ortu eius, nuntiat mirabile.
verses.english: The sun proclaims its own work and its rising, and it announces wonders.

verses.latin: Quam magnum opus Domini! Quae mirabilia eius abscondita!
verses.english: How great is the work of the Lord! His wonders are hidden!

verses.latin: Qui cognoscet fortitudinem eius?
verses.english: Who can know its strength?

verses.latin: Et quis poterit enarrare opera eius?
verses.english: And who can describe its works?

verses.latin: Magnifica est et luna in tempore suo, in mensibus, ad tempus: signum temporis.
verses.english: The moon is also magnificent at its time, in the months, to the season; it is a sign of the times.

verses.latin: A mensa est, ad decrementum: et mutatio in mensibus.
verses.english: The moon is from the table to the decrease and change in the months.

verses.latin: Signum est festivitatis, lucens in caelo: splendor caeli.
verses.english: The moon is a sign of the feast, shining in the sky: the splendor of the sky.

verses.latin: Gloria stellarum, decor splendoris sui in excelsis Domini.
verses.english: The glory of the stars is its beauty in splendor on high from the Lord.

verses.latin: In verbis Sancti, fulgent in firmamento caeli: et pulchri aspectu in gloria eorum.
verses.english: In the words of the Holy One, they shine in the expanse of the sky and are beautiful in their glory.

verses.latin: In jussu Sancti steterunt, et in statu suo: non defatigantur in vigiliis suis.
verses.english: By the command of the Holy One, they stand in their place and do not tire in their vigils.

verses.latin: Respice arcum, et benedic eum, qui fecit illum: valde speciosus est in irradiatione sua.
verses.english: Look at the rainbow, and bless the one who made it; it is very beautiful in its radiance.

verses.latin: Circumdat caelum in circuitu gloriae suae: manus Altissimi tetenderunt illum.
verses.english: The rainbow surrounds the sky with its glory; the hands of the Most High have stretched it out.

verses.latin: Imperium eius velociter emittit, et festinat ad exire: et non moratur in die suo.
verses.english: He quickly sends out his command and hastens to go out, and does not delay in his day.

verses.latin: Quis enarrabit fortitudinem nubis? Et quis festinationem tonitrui?
verses.english: Who can describe the strength of the clouds, and who can describe the speed of thunder?

verses.latin: In exitu suo comminuunt terram: et comminutione montium, intonabunt.
verses.english: As the thunder comes out, it crushes the earth, and the mountains will thunder.

verses.latin: In horrore suo cor cordis mei contremescit: et a frigore eius conturbatus sum.
verses.english: In its horror, the heart of my heart trembles, and I am disturbed by its cold.

verses.latin: Spiritu flante, glacies consolidatur: et tanquam avis volans, transit.
verses.english: When the spirit blows, ice solidifies, and like a flying bird, it passes.

verses.latin: In aspectu suo admirantur aquae: et super aquas, quasi foris, glacies consistit.
verses.english: In its appearance, the waters are amazed, and the ice is over the waters, almost like outside.

verses.latin: Omnia opera Domini bona: et in tempore suo dabit unumquodque.
verses.english: All the works of the Lord are good, and he will give each in its time.

verses.latin: Non est dicendum: Hoc pejus hoc, quoniam omnia in tempore suo probabuntur.
verses.english: We should not say, 'This is worse than that,' because all things will be tested in their time.

verses.latin: Nunc in verbis, laudate Deum: et magnificate eum, quam potes.
verses.english: Now, with words, praise God and magnify him as much as you can.

verses.latin: Et exaltet eum, et exaltate illum quam potes: et major est, et non fatigaberis.
verses.english: Exalt him, and exalt him as much as you can, for he is greater, and you will not tire.

verses.latin: Quis vidit eum, et enarrabit? Et quis magnificabit eum, sicut est in principio?
verses.english: Who has seen him and can describe him? And who will magnify him as he was in the beginning?

verses.latin: Multa abscondita sunt majora istis: pauca enim vidimus de operibus eius.
verses.english: Many hidden things are greater than these, for we have seen only a few of his works.

verses.latin: Deus enim fecit omnia: et impiis dedit sapientiam.
verses.english: For God made all things and gave wisdom to the impious.

verses.latin: Sapientia scientiam novit: et ostendit signa sua, et laudis opera.
verses.english: Wisdom knows knowledge and shows his signs and works of praise.

verses.latin: Qui habitat in aeternum creavit omnia in commune: et impiis dedit singulos.
verses.english: He who lives forever created all things in common and gave them individually to the impious.

verses.latin: Significavit opera sua: et gloriam suam, audivimus.
verses.english: He made known his works, and we have heard his glory.

verses.latin: Sermo de his multa: et in brevi, dicamus, quoniam ipse est omnia.
verses.english: The word on these things is much, and in short, let us say that he is all things.

verses.latin: Omnia opera Dei bona: et faciet in tempore suo.
verses.english: All the works of God are good and will be done in their time.

verses.latin: Non est dicendum: Hoc pejus hoc, quoniam omnia probabuntur in tempore suo.
verses.english: We should not say, 'This is worse than that,' because all will be tested in their time.

verses.latin: Nunc ergo in toto corde, et voce, laudate, et benedicite Deum.
verses.english: So now, with your whole heart and voice, praise and bless God.

verses.latin: Laudem virorum gloriosorum enarrabo, et memoria eorum benedicetur in saecula.
verses.english: I will now offer praise to the famous men of old, and their memory will be blessed for all time.

verses.latin: Prophetae in pace conditi sunt, et in ipsis gloria illorum.
verses.english: The prophets of old have found their rest, and in their lives is glory.

verses.latin: Populus ambulaverunt in justitia illorum, et opera virtutis illorum narrantur.
verses.english: Their people walk with them, and recount their heroic acts.

verses.latin: Misericordiae electorum Domini, et sanctorum facta sunt per signa magna, qui non defecerunt in sancta sua.
verses.english: The Lord has shown mercy to the elect, whose accomplishments are miracles. They never wavered in their devotion to God.

verses.latin: In semine eorum permanet bonum, hereditas sancta eorum.
verses.english: Their good works continue in their descendants, their holy heritage.

verses.latin: Et semen eorum in testamentis stetit, et filii eorum propter illos.
verses.english: Their descendants will keep the covenant, and their children will be guided by them.

verses.latin: In aeternum manebit semen eorum, et gloria eorum non derelinquetur.
verses.english: Their descendants will endure forever, and their glory will never be forgotten.

verses.latin: Corpora illorum in pace sepulta sunt, et nomen illorum vivit in generatione et generationem.
verses.english: Their bodies were buried in peace, and their names live on for all generations.

verses.latin: Sapiens loquetur in sapientia, et justitia ejus enarrabit laudes Dei.
verses.english: The wise will speak with wisdom, and their righteousness recounts the praises of God.

verses.latin: Multi dixerunt laudes illius, et non deficiet memoria illius.
verses.english: Many will sing his praises, and his memory will never fade.

verses.latin: Memoria ejus sicut mel dulcis in ore, et sicut musica in convivio vini.
verses.english: His memory is as sweet as honey in the mouth, and like music at a banquet of wine.

verses.latin: Hic disposuit in disciplina sua, et in doctrina sua, et in timore Domini.
verses.english: He was disciplined in his studies, in his teachings, and in the fear of the Lord.

verses.latin: Sancti non defecerunt in bonis, quorum opera misericordiae non defecerunt.
verses.english: The saints will not fail in their good works, and their works of mercy will endure.

verses.latin: Cum semine eorum manent bona, et sancta eorum non sunt derelicta.
verses.english: Their good works will endure, and their holiness will not be forsaken.

verses.latin: Corpora eorum sepulta sunt in pace, et nomen illorum vivit in generationem et generationem.
verses.english: Their bodies were buried in peace, and their name lives on through all generations.

verses.latin: Sapiens in hereditate reliquit bonam gloriam, et annuntiat in medio populi.
verses.english: The wise leave a good reputation, which they announce in the midst of the people.

verses.latin: Doctrina sapientium sicut gemmae honoris, et ubi se ostendunt, honorificantur.
verses.english: The teachings of the wise are like jewels of honor, and they are honored wherever they appear.

verses.latin: Stulti vero suscipiunt terram, et gloria eorum cito obliviscetur.
verses.english: But the foolish seize the earth, and their glory is quickly forgotten.

verses.latin: Filius iniquus minoratur gloriam patris, et qui natus est sine timore, in despectu est.
verses.english: A wicked son diminishes his father's glory, and one born without fear is held in contempt.

verses.latin: Filius justus honorificat patrem, et in conspectu Domini justificat matrem.
verses.english: A righteous son honors his father, and in the sight of the Lord, he vindicates his mother.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, honorat parentes, et dominis serviet quasi nato.
verses.english: Those who fear God honor their parents, and they will serve their masters as though they were their own children.

verses.latin: In opere et verbis honorifica patrem tuum, et matrem tuam, et omne tempus bona placita illis.
verses.english: In deed and word, honor your father and mother, and give them joy at all times.

verses.latin: In omni mente benedic patrem tuum, et pro peccatis matris tuae benedic.
verses.english: With all your heart, bless your father, and pray for the sins of your mother.

verses.latin: Qui dat misericordiam patri, quasi thesaurizat, et qui honorificat matrem, quasi thesaurizat.
verses.english: Those who show mercy to their father are like those who store up treasures, and those who honor their mother store up treasures.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, honorat parentes, et sicut dominis serviet.
verses.english: Those who fear God honor their parents and serve them as they would their masters.

verses.latin: Fili, adjuva senectutem patris, et ne contristes eum in vita illius.
verses.english: Son, support your father in his old age, and do not grieve him in his life.

verses.latin: Et si defecerit sensu, suscipe eum, et ne contristes eum in virtute tua.
verses.english: Even if his mind fails, be patient with him, and do not despise him in your strength.

verses.latin: Eleemosyna patris non erit in oblivionem, et pro peccatis matris tui quasi in refrigerio habitabis.
verses.english: The alms given to your father will never be forgotten, and for the sins of your mother, you will find refreshment.

verses.latin: In die tribulationis tuae recordaberis illorum, et sicut glacies in calore, sic solventur peccata tua.
verses.english: In the day of your tribulation, remember them, and your sins will melt away like frost in the heat.

verses.latin: Quis relinquit patrem, quasi blasphemat, et qui exacerbat matrem, a Deo maledictus.
verses.english: Whoever abandons their father is like a blasphemer, and whoever angers their mother is cursed by God.

verses.latin: Fili, in opere tuo sustine in mansuetudine, et superabundabis in amore illorum.
verses.english: Son, persevere in your work with gentleness, and you will abound in their love.

verses.latin: Quanto magnus es, humilia te in omnibus, et coram Deo invenies gratiam.
verses.english: The greater you are, the more you must humble yourself in all things, and you will find favor with God.

verses.latin: Quoniam magna potentia Dei solius, et ab humilibus honoratur.
verses.english: For the power of God alone is great, and He is honored by the humble.

verses.latin: Altiora te ne quaesieris, et fortiora te ne scrutatus fueris.
verses.english: Do not seek things that are too high for you, and do not search into matters that are beyond your reach.

verses.latin: Sed quae praecepta sunt tibi, illa cogita semper, et in operibus ejus ne multum.
verses.english: But always reflect on the commandments given to you, and do not involve yourself with too many of His works.

verses.latin: Non est tibi necessarium in operibus ejus, quae abscondita sunt tibi.
verses.english: You do not need to involve yourself with the things that are hidden from you.

verses.latin: In superfluis tuis ne multa curaveris, et in multis operibus non fueris.
verses.english: Do not become overly involved in your own affairs, and do not meddle in too many works.

verses.latin: Multa enim supra sensum hominum ostensa sunt tibi.
verses.english: For many things are shown to you which are beyond human understanding.

verses.latin: Et deceptio multos impios seduxit, et malitia cor eorum praecipitavit.
verses.english: And the deception of many impious people will mislead them, and their wicked hearts will bring them down.

verses.latin: Cor duris in dolore aggravabitur, et impius addet peccata peccatis.
verses.english: The heart of the hard-hearted will be burdened with sorrow, and the wicked will add sin upon sin.

verses.latin: In afflictionibus superaddent peccata.
verses.english: In their afflictions, they will add more sins.

verses.latin: In dolore malorum addent impietatem.
verses.english: In their sorrows, they will add to their impiety.

verses.latin: Superbia impii non est justificata, quoniam sicut spinam in ventis, sic erunt impii.
verses.english: The arrogance of the wicked is not justified, for the wicked are like a thorn in the wind.

verses.latin: Homo justus credit legi, et in lege Domini speratio ejus.
verses.english: The just man believes in the law, and his hope is in the law of the Lord.

verses.latin: Qui timet Deum, faciet bona, et qui continet justitiam, adquiret eam, et occurrent illi filii sicut mater honesta.
verses.english: Those who fear God do good, and those who practice justice will acquire it, and children will greet them as if they were a virtuous mother.

verses.latin: Sicut mater honesta, sic filii justorum, et in eis laetabuntur.
verses.english: The children of the just are like a virtuous mother, and they will rejoice in them.

verses.latin: Qui timet Dominum, habebit finem bonum, et in die consummationis suae inveniet gratiam.
verses.english: Those who fear the Lord will have a good end, and on the day of their completion, they will find grace.

verses.latin: Sacerdotium Aaron et Moysi in die donationis illius.
verses.english: The priesthood of Aaron and Moses began on the day when God gave them their mission.

verses.latin: Dominus unxit eos quasi fratres.
verses.english: The Lord then consecrated them, just as brothers.

verses.latin: Sanctificavit eos in virtute sua, et probavit illos.
verses.english: He made them holy by His power and proved their faithfulness.

verses.latin: Elegit eos ex hominibus, et obtulit illis legem vitae.
verses.english: God chose them from among men, and then gave them the law of life.

verses.latin: Testamentum aeternum fecit cum illis, et ostendit illis judicia sua.
verses.english: God made a covenant with them that would last forever, and he showed them his ways.

verses.latin: Magnificavit eos in decore, et cinxit illos in zona fortitudinis.
verses.english: He made them glorious and gave them great strength.

verses.latin: Dedit illis sacerdotalem stolam, et gloriosum ornamentum, et induit illos in perfectum.
verses.english: He gave them priestly garments and beautiful ornaments, clothing them in all that was needed.

verses.latin: Opera manuum ejus sancta, et circumdatus in honorem ejus.
verses.english: Their duties were holy, and they were always mindful of God's honor.

verses.latin: In diebus eorum perfecti sunt, et cum erant illis.
verses.english: They fulfilled their duties during their own time, and God was with them.

verses.latin: In generationibus eorum.
verses.english: Their good works are remembered to this day.

verses.latin: Alii unxerunt reges, et dederunt sacerdotium.
verses.english: Other men were anointed kings and given priestly duties.

verses.latin: Et Moyses, quoniam similis Aaron, honorificatus est in conspectu Dei et hominum.
verses.english: And Moses, like Aaron, was honored in the sight of God and men.

verses.latin: Benedixit illi Dominus in sanctitate, et dilatavit eum.
verses.english: The Lord blessed him and gave him a place of honor in His sanctuary.

verses.latin: Dedit illi in hereditatem divisionem gentium, et distribuit illi tribus Israël.
verses.english: He gave him authority over the various nations and distributed the tribes of Israel to him.

verses.latin: Et dedit illi in sanctitate, Aaron, de tribu Levi, legem aeternam, et testamentum pacificum.
verses.english: He gave Aaron, of the tribe of Levi, the eternal law and the covenant of peace.

verses.latin: Et fecit ei testamentum sempiternum, et dedit illi sacerdotium gentis, et beatificavit eum in gloria.
verses.english: He made an everlasting covenant with him and gave him the priesthood over the nation, glorifying him.

verses.latin: Et posuit illum super populum sanctum, et confirmavit illi, et filiis ejus, ut offerrent Deo incensum et suffitum.
verses.english: He placed him over the holy people, and he confirmed for him and his sons the right to offer incense and sacrifices to God.

verses.latin: Et ministrabant ei sacerdotes ejus: Moyses, cum unctis ejus.
verses.english: And his priestly sons ministered to him, along with Moses and his anointed ones.

verses.latin: In diebus ejus perfecit opus illius, et multiplicavit gloriam ejus.
verses.english: In his own time, Moses completed the work, and his glory increased.

verses.latin: Et distribuit portionem gentium, et divixit illam duodecim tribubus.
verses.english: He distributed the portions of the nations, dividing them among the twelve tribes.

verses.latin: Et dedit illi in hereditatem sanctificationem sanctorum, et in omnem plenitudinem primitiarum.
verses.english: He gave him the inheritance of the holy things, and all the best first fruits.

verses.latin: Et exhibuit manum suam in sacrificiis, et sacrificia libationis, in odorem suavitatis.
verses.english: He extended his hand in sacrifice and offered sacrifices of libation as a sweet fragrance.

verses.latin: Et glorificavit Aaron, et benedixit ei: et dedit illi hæreditatem.
verses.english: He glorified Aaron and blessed him, giving him an inheritance.

verses.latin: Moysi autem dedit mandata, et judicia populo, et ostendit ei gloriam suam.
verses.english: To Moses, however, he gave the commandments and judgments for the people, and he showed him his glory.

verses.latin: Sanctificavit Aaron, virum sanctum, simillimum illi: et coronam sempiternam, et sacerdotium illi.
verses.english: He made Aaron, a holy man, very similar to himself: and gave him an everlasting crown and priesthood.

verses.latin: Et Moysen sicut illum.
verses.english: And he did the same for Moses.

verses.latin: Filii autem Aaron, multiplicati sunt in generationes, in genere, et hæredes.
verses.english: The sons of Aaron multiplied through the generations, becoming a family and inheriting.

verses.latin: Ita David, cui dedit regnum sempiternum.
verses.english: So also was David, to whom God gave an eternal kingdom.

verses.latin: Et Salomon, qui erat vir sapiens, sedebat in throno regni.
verses.english: And Solomon, who was a wise man, sat on the throne of his kingdom.

verses.latin: Et regnaverunt in judicio.
verses.english: And they reigned with justice.

verses.latin: Gloria eorum erit cum ipsis, et gloria patrum eorum in manu filiorum eorum.
verses.english: Their glory will be with them, and the glory of their fathers will be in the hands of their sons.

verses.latin: Sapiens, et in verbis suis eruditus, et in signis sapientiæ suæ.
verses.english: The wise are well-instructed in their words and in the signs of their wisdom.

verses.latin: Homo sapiens ad doctrinam ipse quasi pluvia in die, et sapientia in judicio stabit.
verses.english: A wise man's teachings are like the rain, and wisdom will always be proven right.

verses.latin: Et nunc laudate sapientes viros, et honore eos.
verses.english: Now, praise and honor wise men.

verses.latin: Quoniam ex illis erunt docti in judiciis, et ex illis cognoscetur judicium.
verses.english: For the learned will be judged by them, and judgment will be known from them.

verses.latin: Et laudabuntur in gentibus, et in civitate laudabuntur.
verses.english: They will be praised among the nations and honored in the city.

verses.latin: Fortis in bello et potens in opere, est Samuel, et judicavit Dominum.
verses.english: Samuel, the strong one, powerful in his works, judged the Lord.

verses.latin: Et postea dormivit cum patribus suis, et ostendit Domino regem.
verses.english: Afterwards, he slept with his ancestors and showed the Lord the king.

verses.latin: Et dedit unctionem super caput ejus, et posuit David in regem.
verses.english: He gave anointing upon his head and appointed David as king.

verses.latin: Vir sanctus, et judicavit populum, et sanctificavit populum.
verses.english: A holy man, he judged the people and sanctified the people.

verses.latin: Inimicos ejus circumdedit in circuitu, et sicut Leo rugiens in via.
verses.english: He surrounded his enemies, roaring like a lion on the path.

verses.latin: Et dedit illi in saeculum potestatem, et posuit testamentum cum semine ejus.
verses.english: He gave him power forever and established a covenant with his descendants.

verses.latin: Et misit jacobitas de gentibus, et dedit illi terram in divisione, et partitus est illos in partibus suis, et in tribubus Israel.
verses.english: He sent Jacobites from among the nations and gave them land in division, distributing them according to their parts and the tribes of Israel.

verses.latin: Et memoria eorum benedicta in saeculum.
verses.english: And their memory is blessed forever.

verses.latin: Et quasi sol illuminans, ita et Helias: et qui cognovit Dominum.
verses.english: Like the sun, Elias illuminated and knew the Lord.

verses.latin: Qui in verbo Domini judicavit, et in verbis ejus cessavit judex.
verses.english: In the word of the Lord, he judged, and at his word, the judge ceased.

verses.latin: Qui suscitavit mortuum de morte, et de inferno in sermone Altissimi.
verses.english: He raised the dead from death and, from the abyss, at the word of the Most High.

verses.latin: Qui dedit reges in perditionem, et viros gloriosos in perditionem.
verses.english: He cast down kings and the glorious into ruin.

verses.latin: Qui audivit in Sina increpationem, et in Choreb judicia vindictae.
verses.english: He heard the rebuke on Sinai and the judgments of vengeance at Horeb.

verses.latin: Qui unxit reges ad paenitentiam, et prophetas post ipsum, in testimonium aeternitatis.
verses.english: He anointed kings for repentance and the prophets after him, as a testimony of eternity.

verses.latin: Qui assumptus est in turbine ignis, in curru ignium.
verses.english: He was taken up in a whirlwind of fire, in a chariot of fire.

verses.latin: Qui scriptus est in judiciis temporum, ad placandos iram Domini, in tempore.
verses.english: He is written in the judgments of the times, to appease the wrath of the Lord, in time.

verses.latin: Qui convertit cor patris ad filium, et tribus Jacob restauravit.
verses.english: He turned the heart of the father to the son and restored the tribes of Jacob.

verses.latin: Beati qui viderunt te, et in amicitia tua fuerunt.
verses.english: Blessed are those who saw you and were in your friendship.

verses.latin: Nam et nos vita vivimus: sed post mortem, tale nomen non erit.
verses.english: For we live by life, but after death, such a name will not be.

verses.latin: Helias tectus est in turbine ignis, et Heliseus repletus est spiritu illius.
verses.english: Elias was covered in a whirlwind of fire, and Elisha was filled with his spirit.

verses.latin: In diebus suis non timuit principem, et non conturbavit illi potestas quisquam.
verses.english: In his days, he did not fear the ruler, nor did any power disturb him.

verses.latin: Verbum illius superavit omnia, et in vita ejus mirabilia fecit.
verses.english: His word surpassed all things, and in his life, he performed miracles.

verses.latin: Non credidit cordi suo, nec timuit carnem, quoniam in fide Domini confortatus est.
verses.english: He did not trust his heart, nor did he fear flesh, because he was strengthened in the faith of the Lord.

verses.latin: Post mortem prophetavit corpus ejus, et post transitum ejus prophetavit.
verses.english: After death, his body prophesied, and even after his passing, he prophesied.

verses.latin: In vita sua fecit signa, et in morte mirabilia.
verses.english: In his life, he did signs, and in his death, wonders.

verses.latin: In omnibus istis non acquievit populus, nec recesserunt a peccatis suis, donec expulsi sunt de terra sua.
verses.english: In all these, the people did not acquiesce, nor did they depart from their sins, until they were expelled from their land.

verses.latin: Et in omnibus gentibus qui non credebant, et qui non operabantur mirabilia.
verses.english: And among all the nations who did not believe and did not work miracles.

verses.latin: Et in diebus Noe, viderunt, et salvi facti sunt: et in Noe, factum est saeculum.
verses.english: In the days of Noah, they saw, and were saved: and in Noah, the world was created.

verses.latin: Amicus Deo inventus est, et in judicio repertus est justus.
verses.english: He was found to be a friend of God, and in the judgment, he was found just.

verses.latin: In tentatione inventus est perfectus, et inventus est justus.
verses.english: In temptation, he was found perfect, and he was found just.

verses.latin: Ideo dabit illi Deus testamentum cum Noe: quod sit in saeculo super omnem carnem.
verses.english: Therefore, God gave him a covenant with Noah: that it would be forever over all flesh.

verses.latin: Abraam magnus pater multarum gentium, et non est inventus similis illi in gloria.
verses.english: Abraham, the great father of many nations, and there is no one like him found in glory.

verses.latin: Qui custodivit legem Altissimi, et fecit testamentum cum illo.
verses.english: He kept the law of the Most High and made a covenant with Him.

verses.latin: In carne sua statuit testamentum, et in tentatione inventus est fidelis.
verses.english: In his flesh, he established a covenant, and in temptation, he was found faithful.

verses.latin: Ideo jurejurando illi confirmavit, quod benedicat gentes in semine ejus.
verses.english: Therefore, he confirmed it to him by an oath, that he would bless the nations in his seed.

verses.latin: Quod multiplicaret semen ejus sicut pulverem terrae, et exaltaret semen ejus sicut stellas.
verses.english: That he would multiply his seed like the dust of the earth and exalt his seed like the stars.

verses.latin: Et dedit illi hereditatem, a mari usque ad mare, et a flumine usque ad terminos terrae.
verses.english: And He gave him an inheritance, from sea to sea, and from the river to the ends of the earth.

verses.latin: Isaac, et Jacob benedixit, et dedit illis benedictionem.
verses.english: Isaac and Jacob He blessed and gave them a blessing.

verses.latin: Benedictionem omnium gentium posuit super caput eorum, et posuit testamentum suum, et dilectionem in Jacob.
verses.english: He placed the blessing of all nations upon their heads and placed His covenant and love in Jacob.

verses.latin: Sanctificavit illum in sanctificationibus suis, et conservavit illum a tentationibus, et liberavit illum.
verses.english: He sanctified him in His sanctifications and preserved him from temptations and delivered him.

verses.latin: Magnificavit illum in conspectu omnium hominum, et confirmavit illum in omnibus gentibus.
verses.english: He magnified him in the sight of all men and established him among all nations.

verses.latin: Confirmatum est in eo testamentum, et benedictio ejus quam dedit illi, et distribuit illi in partibus.
verses.english: The covenant was confirmed in him, and the blessing He gave him, and He distributed it among the parts.

verses.latin: Qui dedit hereditatem in partibus, et diviserat tribus duodecim.
verses.english: He gave the inheritance in parts and divided the twelve tribes.

verses.latin: Et surrexit Helias propheta quasi ignis, et verbum illius quasi facula ardebat.
verses.english: The prophet Elijah arose like a fire, and his word burned like a torch.

verses.latin: Fame illorum induxit famem, et in zelo suo minuérunt illos in paucos.
verses.english: He brought famine upon them, and in his zeal he reduced them to a few.

verses.latin: Verbo Domini conclusit caelum, et de tribus vicibus deduxit ignem.
verses.english: By the Word of the Lord, he closed the sky, and three times he brought down fire.

verses.latin: Quam glorificatus es Helia in mirabilibus tuis! et quis tibi similis in gloria?
verses.english: How glorious you were, Elijah, in your wondrous deeds! Who is like you in glory?

verses.latin: Qui suscitasti mortuum de morte, et de inferno in verbo Altissimi.
verses.english: You raised the dead from death, and from the underworld at the command of the Most High.

verses.latin: Qui deduxisti reges ad perditionem, et viros gloriosos de lecto suo.
verses.english: You brought kings to ruin, and the mighty from their beds.

verses.latin: Qui audisti in Sinai judicium, et in Horeb judicia vindictae.
verses.english: You heard judgment on Sinai, and judgments of vengeance on Horeb.

verses.latin: Qui unxisti reges in poenitentiam, et prophetas fecisti in successione sua.
verses.english: You anointed kings for repentance, and established prophets to succeed you.

verses.latin: Qui assumptus es in turbine ignis, in curru igneo equorum.
verses.english: You were taken up in a whirlwind of fire, in a chariot of fiery horses.

verses.latin: Qui scriptus es in judiciis temporum, placare iram Domini, ut reconciliares cor patris ad filium.
verses.english: You are recorded in the judgments of the ages, to appease the wrath of the Lord, so as to reconcile the heart of the father to the son.

verses.latin: Et restituere tribus Jacob.
verses.english: And restore the tribes of Jacob.

verses.latin: Beati qui te viderunt, et in amicitia tua decorati sunt.
verses.english: Blessed are those who saw you, and were adorned with your friendship.

verses.latin: Quoniam nos vita vivimus, et post mortem nihil tale habebimus.
verses.english: For while we live, we have life, and after death we will have nothing like it.

verses.latin: Helias tectus est in spiritu, et Eliseus repleti sunt spiritu ejus: in diebus suis non timuit principem, et non potuit illi vis quicquam superare.
verses.english: Elijah was covered in spirit, and Elisha was filled with his spirit. In his days, he did not fear a prince, and no power could overcome him.

verses.latin: Verbum illius superabat omnia, et cor ejus prophetabat.
verses.english: His word surpassed all things, and his heart prophesied.

verses.latin: Qui in pace dormivit, et oculus ejus vigilavit in tempore somni.
verses.english: He slept in peace, and his eye remained watchful even in sleep.

verses.latin: In partibus eorum signa, et in gentibus notus est.
verses.english: His signs are in their portions, and he is known among the nations.

verses.latin: In Eliseo duplici spiritu; fecit signa magna, et mirabilia, et in verbo suo judicavit.
verses.english: In Elisha, a double spirit; he performed great signs and wonders, and judged by his word.

verses.latin: Qui non timuit quemquam, et non potuit illi animus hominis superare.
verses.english: He feared no one, and no human spirit could overcome him.

verses.latin: Non declinavit cor ejus, et nihil potuit conturbare voluntatem illius.
verses.english: His heart did not waver, and nothing could disturb his will.

verses.latin: Opera ejus sancta, et gloriosa, et in omni oculo operata sunt mirabilia illius.
verses.english: His works are holy and glorious, and his wonders have been performed in the sight of all.

verses.latin: Propter hoc in peccatis suis non remisit, et post mortem ejus corpus ejus prophetavit.
verses.english: Therefore, he did not give up in his sins, and after his death, his body prophesied.

verses.latin: In vita sua fecit prodigia, et in morte operatus est mirabilia.
verses.english: In his life, he worked wonders, and in death, he performed miracles.

verses.latin: In omnibus his non acquievit populus, et non cessavit a peccatis suis, donec ablatus est de terra.
verses.english: In all these things, the people did not believe, and they did not cease from their sins until he was taken away from the earth.

verses.latin: Et cor populi non intellexit, nec cognoverunt opera Dei, et opera manuum illius.
verses.english: And the heart of the people did not understand, nor did they know the works of God and the works of His hands.

verses.latin: Erat quasi lignum in operibus suis; et postea erant qui judicarent eum.
verses.english: He was like a tree in his works; and afterwards there were those who would judge him.

verses.latin: Hoc est de populo; et postea de omnibus gentibus.
verses.english: This is concerning the people; and later, concerning all nations.

verses.latin: Quis enim investigabit fortitudinem Domini? et quis enarrabit gloriam ejus?
verses.english: For who will search out the strength of the Lord? And who will declare His glory?

verses.latin: Quis enim magnus in operibus ejus? et quis mutabit opera illius?
verses.english: For who is great in His works? And who will change His works?

verses.latin: Deus fecit omnia, et hoc est bonum in conspectu illius.
verses.english: God made all things, and this is good in His sight.

verses.latin: Unusquisque ad opera sua.
verses.english: Each one for their own works.

verses.latin: Qui enim dicit: Hoc est, quid est? et quis honorificabit opera illius?
verses.english: For he who says: 'This is what is,' what is it? And who will honor His works?

verses.latin: Post ista laudabimus viros sanctos in operibus suis, qui non defecerunt in timore ejus.
verses.english: After these things, we will praise the holy men in their works, who did not fail in the fear of Him.

verses.latin: Gentes in sua justitia salvatae sunt.
verses.english: Nations were saved in their own righteousness.

verses.latin: Populus Domini in sua justitia salvatus est.
verses.english: The people of the Lord were saved in their own righteousness.

verses.latin: Et laudabimus gloriosos in gloria, qui gloriam dederunt in timore Domini.
verses.english: And we will praise the glorious in glory, who gave glory in the fear of the Lord.

verses.latin: Erat illis, qui non habuerunt, ut operarentur: in misericordiis, quibus datum est, justificati sunt.
verses.english: There were those who did not have, that they might work: in the mercies which were given, they were justified.

verses.latin: Quidam cum suo semine remanserunt: et quidam non nati sunt.
verses.english: Some remained with their seed: and some were not born.

verses.latin: Hic glorificatus est, et hic oblatus est.
verses.english: This one was glorified, and that one was offered up.

verses.latin: Pecuniam congregavit, et thesaurizavit quasi argentum.
verses.english: He gathered wealth and treasured it like silver.

verses.latin: Et non est inventus in operibus suis; et factus est alienus.
verses.english: And he was not found in his works; and he became a stranger.

verses.latin: Filii ejus, et filii filiorum illius, peccatores.
verses.english: His sons and his grandsons were sinners.

verses.latin: De genere illius remansit semen, et de gentibus.
verses.english: From his lineage, seed remained, and from the nations.

verses.latin: De bono patris hereditas permanet in filiis.
verses.english: From a good father, inheritance remains in the sons.

verses.latin: Sed et ab eo filiis impiis hereditas periit.
verses.english: But even from him, inheritance has perished to the wicked sons.

verses.latin: Qui non sunt justi, hereditatem perdiderunt, et cum peccatoribus perierunt.
verses.english: Those who are not just have lost their inheritance, and have perished with the sinners.

verses.latin: Plus quam aurum et argentum diligite amicos vestros.
verses.english: Love your friends more than gold and silver.

verses.latin: Melius est enim thesaurus bonus supra aurum et argentum.
verses.english: For a good treasure is better than gold and silver.

verses.latin: Melior est vita et anima in gratiam dilectionis.
verses.english: Life and soul are better in the grace of love.

verses.latin: Non est thesaurus melior auro, et melior est homo bonus supra argentum.
verses.english: There is no better treasure than gold, and a good man is better than silver.

verses.latin: Amicus et proximus in tempore opportuno, et in die tribulationis invenietur.
verses.english: A friend and neighbor in a time of need, is found in the day of tribulation.

verses.latin: Non est comparanda auro vita, et inestimabilis est optima conversatio boni.
verses.english: Life is not to be compared to gold, and the best companionship of a good man is beyond measure.

verses.latin: Quam aurum et argentum, diligite pietatem: plus quam thesauris aurum.
verses.english: Love piety more than gold and silver, more than treasures.

verses.latin: Surrexit Elias propheta quasi ignis, et verbum illius quasi facula ardebat.
verses.english: The prophet Elijah rose up, glowing like a fire. His words were like a torch that burned.

verses.latin: Ipse intulit famem illis, et in zelo suo attenuavit illos.
verses.english: He brought them famine, and in his zeal, he made them few in number.

verses.latin: Verbo Domini inclusit caelum, et pluit tribus vicibus ignem.
verses.english: By the Lord's word, he closed the sky, and he made fire fall three times.

verses.latin: Quam gloriosus factus es, Elias, in mirabilibus tuis! et quis similis tibi in gloria?
verses.english: How glorious you became, Elijah, in your wonders! Who is like you in glory?

verses.latin: Qui suscitasti mortuum de morte, et de inferno in verbo Altissimi.
verses.english: You raised the dead from death and from the underworld by the word of the Most High.

verses.latin: Qui deduxisti reges ad perditionem, et facile confregisti eos de excelso.
verses.english: You brought kings to ruin, and easily broke them from on high.

verses.latin: Qui audisti in Sinai judicium, et in Horeb judicia vindictae.
verses.english: You heard judgment on Sinai and the judgments of vengeance on Horeb.

verses.latin: Qui unxisti reges ad paenitentiam, et prophetas in successione sua.
verses.english: You anointed kings to do penance and prophets in their lineage.

verses.latin: Qui receptus es in turbine ignis in curru equorum igneorum.
verses.english: You were received into a fiery whirlwind in a chariot of fiery horses.

verses.latin: Qui scriptus es in judiciis temporum, placare iram Domini, convertere cor patris ad filium, et restituere tribus Jacob.
verses.english: You are written in the judgments of the times, to placate the Lord's anger, to turn the father's heart to the son, and to restore the tribes of Jacob.

verses.latin: Beati qui te viderunt, et in amicitia tua decorati sunt.
verses.english: Blessed are those who saw you and were adorned in your friendship.

verses.latin: Nam et nos vita vivimus, sed cum mortuis moriemur.
verses.english: For we also live, but when we die, we will die with the dead.

verses.latin: Elias erat involutus in turbine, et Eliseus repletus est spiritu ejus; in diebus suis non timuit principem, et non obtinuit illi vis ullius.
verses.english: Elijah was taken up in the whirlwind, and Elisha was filled with his spirit. In his days, he did not fear a prince, and no one had power over him.

verses.latin: Verbum illius superabat omnem potentiam; et in vita sua fecit signa, et in morte mirabilia.
verses.english: His word surpassed all power. He performed signs in his life and wonders in his death.

verses.latin: In omnibus his non paenituit populus, et non recesserunt a peccatis suis, usque dum ejecti sunt de terra sua, et dispersi in omnem terram.
verses.english: In all these things, the people did not repent, and they did not turn away from their sins, until they were cast out of their land and scattered throughout the earth.

verses.latin: Et derelicta est gens, et non fuit qui faceret misericordiam illi.
verses.english: The nation was forsaken, and there was no one to show them mercy.

verses.latin: Memoratus sum de Jeremia propheta, qui ex utero sanctificatus est propheta, ut destrueret, et plantaret, et aedificaret.
verses.english: I remember Jeremiah the prophet, who was sanctified from the womb to be a prophet, to destroy, to plant, and to build.

verses.latin: Qui in visione sancta tulit pluviam, et e coelo misit ignem super populum.
verses.english: Who in a holy vision brought rain and sent fire upon the people from heaven.

verses.latin: Qui denuntiatus est in sanguinem, et qui increpationem dedit peccatoribus, antequam moreretur.
verses.english: Who was denounced for bloodshed and who gave rebuke to sinners before he died.

verses.latin: Qui ascendit in coelum, et nunc manu Domini colligit animas, et in omnibus potentia videt.
verses.english: Who ascended into heaven, and now gathers souls by the Lord's hand, and sees with power in all things.

verses.latin: De Ezechiele, qui vidit visionem gloriae, quam ostendit illi in curru cherubim.
verses.english: Concerning Ezekiel, who saw the vision of glory, which was shown to him in the chariot of the cherubim.

verses.latin: Qui enim commemorat hostes in pluvia, et benefacientibus eis gratias reddit.
verses.english: For he remembers enemies in the rain and gives thanks to those who do good.

verses.latin: Et de duodecim prophetis: exspirent ossa eorum de loco suo, consolati sunt enim in Jacob, et cum fide magna consolati sunt.
verses.english: And of the twelve prophets: may their bones sprout from their place, for they consoled Jacob, and they consoled with great faith.

verses.latin: Quomodo honorabimus Zorobabel? qui factus est quasi signaculum in manu dextera.
verses.english: How shall we honor Zerubbabel? He became like a signet ring on the right hand.

verses.latin: Sic et Jesum filium Nave, qui in diebus suis factus est magnus in potestate sua.
verses.english: Likewise, Joshua, the son of Nun, who became great in his power in his days.

verses.latin: Quod testimonium de eo reddidit, quod post solis obitum fecit solem stare, et unam diem duplici.
verses.english: He gave testimony about him, that after the setting of the sun, he made the sun stand still, and one day, he made double.

verses.latin: Qui invocavit Altissimum cum fortitudine, et in adversariis circumdans eos.
verses.english: He called upon the Most High with strength, surrounding them in battle.

verses.latin: Quod testimonium illi reddidit in gloria, quod usque in finem perfecit coram Deo.
verses.english: He gave testimony to him in glory, that he fulfilled before God until the end.

verses.latin: In testimoniis Moysi cognovit vir sanctus, et David in misericordiis suis.
verses.english: In the testimonies of Moses, the holy man knew, and David in his mercies.

verses.latin: Salomon autem requiescebat in pace: et in diebus ejus sol turbatus est.
verses.english: Solomon rested in peace, and in his days, the sun was disturbed.

verses.latin: Fecerunt enim opera sua, et abierunt ad requiem.
verses.english: For they did their works and went to their rest.

verses.latin: Quoniam in omnibus senserunt populum, et in eis doctrinam eorum.
verses.english: For in all things, they taught the people, and in them, their doctrine.

verses.latin: Exsurgit memoria eorum, et non deficiet nomen eorum.
verses.english: Their memory rises, and their name will not fail.

verses.latin: Sapientiam narrabit natio, et laus eorum loquetur in ecclesia.
verses.english: A nation will proclaim wisdom, and their praise will be spoken in the church.

verses.latin: Memoriam Iosiae, bonam fecit in odorem incensi, et sicut mel in ore dulcedinem, et sicut musica in convivio vini.
verses.english: The memory of Josias is like a pleasant scent, like honey in the mouth, like music at a wine banquet.

verses.latin: Ipse enim aversatus est a delicto, et in directione direxit populum: et abstulit abominationem iniquitatis.
verses.english: He turned away from sin, leading his people in the right way, removing the abominations of iniquity.

verses.latin: Cor ejus direxit ad Dominum, et in impietate non est infirmatus.
verses.english: His heart turned toward God and was not weakened by impiety.

verses.latin: Præter David, et Ezechiam, et Iosiam, omnes peccaverunt: quoniam dereliquerunt legem Altissimi, et obliti sunt beneficentiarum ejus.
verses.english: Beyond David, Ezechias, and Josias, all others sinned, forsaking the law of the Most High, forgetting His blessings.

verses.latin: Et fortia regum Iudae, infirmata sunt, quoniam defecerunt in bellis.
verses.english: The mighty kings of Judea grew weak, failing in wars.

verses.latin: Reliquerunt legem Dei, et contempserunt testamenta ejus: et in vestigiis mandatorum justorum non ambulaverunt, et in via justitiae non gressi sunt: et omnes eorum consumpti sunt.
verses.english: They abandoned the law of God, despised His covenant, and did not follow the commandments of the righteous, nor did they walk the path of justice, and so they were all destroyed.

verses.latin: Et vidit Dominus impietatem eorum, quoniam coram eo discesserunt.
verses.english: The Lord saw their impiety because they had departed from Him.

verses.latin: Et divisit illis nationes, et dispersit eos in terra.
verses.english: So He divided them among the nations, scattering them across the earth.

verses.latin: Et adduxit in eos alienos, et multiplicavit in terra inimicos eorum.
verses.english: He brought in strangers against them and multiplied their enemies in the land.

verses.latin: Opera eorum mutata sunt: et in omnibus viis eorum immutata sunt.
verses.english: Their deeds were changed; in all their ways they were altered.

verses.latin: Et in diebus Iosiae facta est pax, et terra in eo quiete gaudebat.
verses.english: But in the days of Josias, there was peace, and the land rejoiced in his rest.

verses.latin: Confirmatum est cor ejus ad Dominum, et in impietate non est infirmatus.
verses.english: His heart was strengthened towards the Lord, and he was not weakened by impiety.

verses.latin: Omnia enim quae fuerunt ante eum, et quae fuerunt post eum, impietas et oblivionem iniquitatis fecerunt in terra.
verses.english: For all that was before him, and all that came after him, brought impiety and forgetfulness of iniquity upon the earth.

verses.latin: Et facta sunt opera ejus justa in oculis Domini, et in omni vita ejus.
verses.english: And his works were just in the eyes of the Lord, and in all his life.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem verborum Iosiae, et misericordiæ ejus in Domino, et impietas ejus, et omnia quae egit, scripta sunt in libro regum Iuda.
verses.english: The rest of the words of Josias, his mercy toward the Lord, his piety, and all that he did, are written in the book of the kings of Judea.

verses.latin: Et factum est, et factus est Iosias filius Amon, rex Iuda.
verses.english: And so Josias, son of Amon, became king of Judea.

verses.latin: Memoriam Iosiae faciebant ex odore compositionis, et sicut mel in ore dulcedinem, et sicut musica in convivio vini.
verses.english: The memory of Josias, they make in his composition like a scent, and like honey in the mouth, like music at a wine banquet.

verses.latin: Et ista in vita ejus, pro omni populo, in gloriam Dei.
verses.english: And these things in his life were for all the people, to the glory of God.

verses.latin: Et fecit Iosias, ut deponeret impietatem, et abstulit abominationem iniquitatis.
verses.english: And Josias acted to put down impiety and removed the abominations of iniquity.

verses.latin: Et direxit cor suum ad Dominum, et in temporibus impiorum confirmatus est.
verses.english: He directed his heart to the Lord and was strengthened in the times of the wicked.

verses.latin: Præterea opera David, et Salomonis, et magnificentiae, et sanctificationis, scripta sunt in libro regum.
verses.english: Moreover, the works of David and Solomon, their magnificence and holiness, are written in the book of Kings.

verses.latin: Neque enim ullus ex eis qui fuerunt in terra, comparatur Iosiae, ut in opera Dei.
verses.english: Indeed, none of those who were on earth are compared to Josias in the works of God.

verses.latin: Quoniam in omnibus operibus suis operatus est bene, et ipse quoque gloriosus.
verses.english: Because in all his works, he acted well and also he was glorious.

verses.latin: Salomon pater erat ad pacem: et Deus dedit ei pacem, et cessavit omni diebus ejus.
verses.english: Solomon was a father of peace; and God gave him peace, and it ceased all his days.

verses.latin: Et operatus est Salomon, et aedificavit domum in diebus suis.
verses.english: And Solomon acted and built the house of God in his days.

verses.latin: Quamvis sapientia Salomonis magna fuerit, et gloriosus, in parabola, et proverbiis, et sententiis, et responsis.
verses.english: Although the wisdom of Solomon was great and glorious, in parables, proverbs, sentences, and answers,

verses.latin: In nomine Domini, Dei Israel: congregavit aurum quasi stagnum, et quasi arena multiplicavit argentum.
verses.english: In the name of the Lord, the God of Israel, he gathered gold like a pond and multiplied silver like sand.

verses.latin: Et tuam posuisti in ventrem ejus, et a sapientia tua dedisti ei:
verses.english: You placed it in his womb, and from your wisdom, you gave it to him.

verses.latin: Exaltasti honorem ejus, et gloriam ejus adimplevisti.
verses.english: You exalted his honor and fulfilled his glory.

verses.latin: Congregasti inimicos, et adimasti ei iniquos, et exaltasti regnum ejus.
verses.english: You gathered his enemies, and removed the wicked, and exalted his kingdom.

verses.latin: Gloria enim Salomonis, illuminavit usque in longum: et nomen ejus, in gentibus, et propter ea fuit.
verses.english: For the glory of Solomon illuminated even to a distant time, and his name among the nations was famous because of these things.

verses.latin: Insania, et superbia, et iniquitas, et perversitas corruperunt cor ejus.
verses.english: But insanity, pride, iniquity, and perversity corrupted his heart.

verses.latin: Et divisit regnum: et exsurrexit ab eo regnum rebellis.
verses.english: He divided the kingdom, and a rebellious kingdom rose up against him.

verses.latin: Dominus autem manebit in omnibus beneficiis suis, et non dimittit gratias suas, neque diminuit opera sua: nec aufert a sancto suo, nec mutat opera sua.
verses.english: But the Lord will remain in all His blessings and does not abandon His graces, nor does He diminish His works; nor does He take away from His holy ones, nor does He change His works.

verses.latin: Et reliquit reliquias eorum, et nomina electorum suorum: et omnia opera sua sunt in saeculum.
verses.english: He left their remnants, and the names of His elect. And all His works endure forever.

verses.latin: Magnus pontifex in fratrum suorum gloria, et quasi sol in exortu suo.
verses.english: The great high priest is a glory to his brothers, like the sun when it rises.

verses.latin: Quasi luna in diebus suis: in plenitudine, et quasi sol circumdans terram.
verses.english: Like the moon during its days; when it is full it lights the whole world.

verses.latin: Festivales dies: et tempus mensium, illi faciunt diem festum.
verses.english: Feast days and the season of the months, those feasts make the celebration.

verses.latin: Quasi sol fulgens, sic et ille effulgens in templo Dei.
verses.english: Like the shining sun, so he shines when in the Temple of God.

verses.latin: Sicut arcus dans gloriam in nubibus, et in diebus festivitatis.
verses.english: Like a rainbow, which brings glory during the cloud-filled days of a festival.

verses.latin: Sicut flos rosarum in die verni, in diebus rosarum: sic et ille in statu suo in diebus suis.
verses.english: Like a rose in the springtime, and during the days of roses: so he is beautiful during his days.

verses.latin: Sicut cedrus exaltatus in montibus Libani, et sicut palma in directo stans.
verses.english: Like the cedar that is raised up on the mountains of Lebanon, or like a palm tree standing tall.

verses.latin: Sic et ipse exaltatus in diebus suis.
verses.english: So is he, when he is raised up in his days.

verses.latin: Sicut oliva in fructu suo, et sicut cyparissus exaltata in altitudine sua.
verses.english: Like an olive tree with its fruit, or a cypress that has been raised in height.

verses.latin: Quando induit stolam gloriae, et indutus est perfectae magnitudinis, ascendit altare sanctum.
verses.english: When he put on the robe of glory, and was covered with perfect majesty, he ascended the holy altar.

verses.latin: Circa altare sanctum, splendor veli, sicut palmae corona, et sicut rosae flores in diebus verni.
verses.english: Around the holy altar, the brilliance of the veil, is like a crown of palm branches, or like roses during the springtime.

verses.latin: In circuitu ejus, corona gloriae, quasi fetus tauri, et sicut vas incensi in templo.
verses.english: Around him is a crown of glory, like the horns of a bull, or like a vessel of incense in the Temple.

verses.latin: Filius Aaron, quasi nix in nive, et sicut flos rosarum in tempore verni.
verses.english: The son of Aaron is like snow in the winter, or like a rose during the springtime.

verses.latin: Sicut ignis et thus in thuribulo.
verses.english: Like fire and incense in the censer.

verses.latin: Vas aureum et gemmis ornatum, in omni genere decoris.
