verses.english: A golden vessel adorned with gems, with every sort of beauty.

verses.latin: Postea ingressus de templo, quasi stella matutina exiens de nube.
verses.english: After entering from the Temple, he is like the morning star coming from the cloud.

verses.latin: Quasi luna in plenitudine sua, et sicut sol refulgens.
verses.english: Like the moon in its fullness, and like the shining sun.

verses.latin: Clamor in diebus festorum, et sicut iris in nube gloriae.
verses.english: The call during the feast days, and like the rainbow in the cloud of glory.

verses.latin: Vasa aurea, et ornamenta hyacinthina, et vestimenta serici, et purpurae.
verses.english: Golden vessels, and hyacinthine ornaments, and garments of silk, and purple.

verses.latin: Munera electa, et dona optima.
verses.english: Chosen gifts, and the best donations.

verses.latin: Panis dulcis, et inebriatio in odore.
verses.english: Sweet bread, and the intoxication in the scent.

verses.latin: In hoc tempore, memor fuit cor meum, et turbatus est spiritus meus.
verses.english: In this time, my heart was mindful, and my spirit was troubled.

verses.latin: Timui propter timorem Domini, et gloriam ejus.
verses.english: I feared because of the fear of the Lord, and His glory.

verses.latin: Multitudinem peccatorum timui, et gloriam ejus.
verses.english: I feared the multitude of sinners, and His glory.

verses.latin: Et extensi manum meam, et inploravi et dixi:
verses.english: And I extended my hand, and I implored and said:

verses.latin: Peccavi, et inique gessi, et deliqui, et non fui dignus conspectu tuo.
verses.english: I have sinned, and I have acted wickedly, and I have failed, and I was not worthy of Your sight.

verses.latin: Quoniam cognovi quod nequaquam judicatur a te homo, et in omni loco.
verses.english: Because I know that you do not judge mankind in any place.

verses.latin: Si enim de operibus meis testimonium mihi dedero, non exaltabor: quoniam multi sunt mali opera mea.
verses.english: If I give witness about my own works, I will not be exalted: because my works are many and evil.

verses.latin: Si justus sum, omnia opera mea cum eo: et non sum dignus.
verses.english: If I am righteous, all my works are with Him: and I am not worthy.

verses.latin: Quoniam ecce in eo est omnis justitia mea.
verses.english: Because behold, in Him is all my justice.

verses.latin: Et de hoc inique gessi, quoniam usque ad finem.
verses.english: And of this I have acted wickedly, because I have done until the end.

verses.latin: Et audivit me Dominus.
verses.english: And the Lord heard me.

verses.latin: Et convertit in me luctum meum in gaudium, et tribulationem meam in gaudium.
verses.english: And He turned my mourning into joy, and my tribulation into joy.

verses.latin: Et hoc mihi retributum est a Domino, et factus est mihi gloria coram omnibus.
verses.english: And this has been given back to me by the Lord, and glory was made for me before all.

verses.latin: Descendens in humilitatem, benedicam Dominum, et laudabo illum.
verses.english: Descend into humility, and I will bless the Lord, and I will praise Him.

verses.latin: Accipite doctrinam, qui ignoratis, et ponite in cordibus vestris.
verses.english: Receive the doctrine, you who are ignorant, and place it in your hearts.

verses.latin: Quoniam prope est qui inveniet illam.
verses.english: Because he who finds it is near.

verses.latin: Audite me, parvi, et sicut rosa in campo germinate odorem.
verses.english: Hear me, little ones, and like a rose in the field, sprout the scent.

verses.latin: Et date odorem, quasi thus, et florete florem, et ponite coram illo gratiam.
verses.english: And give the scent, like incense, and bloom with a flower, and place grace before Him.

verses.latin: Quoniam Deus est magnus, et Dominus noster vivit in aeternum.
verses.english: Because God is great, and our Lord lives forever.

verses.latin: Amen, amen.
verses.english: Amen, amen.

verses.latin: Confitebor tibi, Domine rex, et laudabo te Deum salvatorem meum.
verses.english: I will give thanks to You, O Lord my King, and I will praise You, my God, my Savior.

verses.latin: Confiteor nomini tuo, quoniam protector et adjutor meus fuisti, et liberasti corpus meum a perditione, a laqueo linguae iniquae, et a labiis fabricantium mendacium.
verses.english: I confess Your holy name, because You have always been my protector and helper. You have freed my body from destruction, from the traps set by lying tongues, and from the lips of those who plot falsehoods.

verses.latin: Et ante oculos eorum fuisti adjutor meus, et eripuisti me secundum multitudinem misericordiae tuae et nominis tui sancti, a morsibus paratorum ad comedendum me, de manu quaerentium animam meam, a tribulationibus multis quas sustinui,
verses.english: You were always my helper. You rescued me from my enemies because of Your great mercy and Your holy name. You saved me from the jaws of those who prepared to devour me and from the hands of those who sought to kill me, and from the many troubles that I suffered,

verses.latin: a igne qui circumdedit me: et de medio ignis sum erutus.
verses.english: and from the fire that surrounded me: I was delivered from the fire.

verses.latin: Confitebor tibi, et laudabo te, et benedicam Domino.
verses.english: I will give thanks to You, I will praise You, and I will bless the Lord.

verses.latin: Cum adhuc essem juvenis, antequam inerrarem, quaesivi sapientiam palam.
verses.english: When I was still young, before I wandered astray, I sought wisdom openly.

verses.latin: Et oravi illam in conspectu templi.
verses.english: And I prayed for her in the presence of the Temple.

verses.latin: Et ante oculos sanctorum quaesivi illam.
verses.english: And I sought her in the sight of the saints.

verses.latin: Et postea cognovi, quoniam non habebat illam in conspectu homines.
verses.english: And afterwards, I realized that people do not have her.

verses.latin: Et exivi post illam, et quaesivi illam: et introivi in viam ejus.
verses.english: So I went after her and sought her, and I entered into her way.

verses.latin: Et tenui illam, et defloravi, et non eam abscondi.
verses.english: And I grasped her, and I blossomed, and I did not hide her.

verses.latin: Cor meum contristatus est in illa.
verses.english: My heart was troubled in her.

verses.latin: Propter hoc emisi os meum, et locutus sum: et dixi: Audite, potentes, et omnes populi, et inclinate aures.
verses.english: Therefore, I opened my mouth and spoke: “Listen, you powerful ones, and all you peoples, and incline your ears.

verses.latin: Attendite, filii, et, grandi, et audite verba oris mei.
verses.english: Pay attention, children, and adults, and hear the words of my mouth.

verses.latin: Docete filios vestros doctrinam, et benedicite illam illis, quoniam qui eam servant, vivunt.
verses.english: Teach your children doctrine, and bless them with her, because those who guard her, live.

verses.latin: Via justorum, sicut sol lucet, et semper it usque ad perfectum.
verses.english: The path of the just shines like the sun, and always goes towards perfection.

verses.latin: Justus autem non cognovit vias justorum: et semen impiorum, quasi ignis ardebit.
verses.english: But the unjust do not know the ways of the just, and the seed of the wicked will burn like fire.

verses.latin: Custodi te a malis, et non facias malum, et non facias iniquitatem.
verses.english: Guard yourself from evil, and do no evil, and do no injustice.

verses.latin: Fuge ab injustitia, et apprehendet te.
verses.english: Flee from injustice, or it will seize you.

verses.latin: Fili, ne opereris in vanis: et non deponas cor tuum in his quae non sunt necessaria.
verses.english: Son, do not involve yourself in vanity, and do not give your heart to things that are not necessary.

verses.latin: Declina oculos tuos, et custodi te a corruptione.
verses.english: Turn away your eyes, and guard yourself from corruption.

verses.latin: Pone animam tuam in justa justitia: et opera tua in mandatis Dei.
verses.english: Set your soul in righteous justice, and your works in the commandments of God.

verses.latin: Fide cum proximo tuo: et in timore Dei operare.
verses.english: Have faith with your neighbor, and work in the fear of God.

verses.latin: Et scito quia omnis caro, sicut foenum, senescit, et sicut folia in arbore viridia, et sicut fructus in malis cadit.
verses.english: And know that all flesh withers like grass, and like the green leaves on a tree, and like the fruit that falls from a tree.

verses.latin: Quoniam omnis caro cito deficiet: et qui fecerit, permanebit.
verses.english: Because all flesh will quickly fail, but He who made all things, will endure.

verses.latin: Noli timere judicium mortis: memento, quia et hi qui ante te fuerunt, et post te erunt, ibunt.
verses.english: Do not fear the judgment of death. Remember that those who came before you and those who will come after you, will pass away.

verses.latin: Omnis caro sicut folium senescit: et qui justificatus est, sicut lignum semper virens.
verses.english: All flesh withers like a leaf, but he who is justified is like an ever-living tree.

verses.latin: Iniquus quasi lignum mortuum cadit, et inpulsa gloria ejus, sicut fumus, disperit.
verses.english: The unjust falls like a dead tree, and his glory, once pushed, disappears like smoke.

verses.latin: Quoniam bona opera sunt quasi arbor robusta, et cogitatio bona, quasi radix fortis.
verses.english: Because good works are like a strong tree, and good thought is like a strong root.

verses.latin: Radix bona dabit fructum bonum.
verses.english: A good root gives good fruit.

verses.latin: Pauperis et miserationis et misericordiae et justitiae, et timoris Dei, quoniam in his est vita.
verses.english: Poverty and the lack of mercy, and justice and the fear of God. For in these is life.

verses.latin: Qui tenet legem, adquiret illam: et finis timoris illius, est sapientia.
verses.english: He who keeps the law will acquire it, and the end of his fear, is wisdom.

verses.latin: Ad illum qui non est iniquus, non est timor, sed in omnibus viis illius est fiducia.
verses.english: For him who is not unjust, there is no fear, but in all his ways is confidence.

verses.latin: Beatus qui habet vitam cum sapientia, et qui loquitur in sensu, et qui meditatur in justitia, et qui in intellectu considerat sapientiam Dei.
verses.english: Blessed is he who has life with wisdom, and he who speaks with sense, and he who meditates on justice, and he who considers the wisdom of God with understanding.

verses.latin: Si enim facis quae placent Deo, vives: et justificaberis in omnia opera tua.
verses.english: For if you do what pleases God, you will live, and you will be justified in all your works.

verses.latin: Et tunc dicam: Omnia quae facitis, date Domino, et in tempore, exhibete ei sacrificium vestrum.
verses.english: And then I will say: 'Give to the Lord everything that you do, and in due time, offer your sacrifice to Him.'

verses.latin: Date illi gratiam, et facite sacrificia justitiae, et sperate in illum.
verses.english: Give thanks to Him, make sacrifices of justice, and hope in Him.
